- About Me -

Thanks for clicking on the guide.
Hi, you can just call me Seph or Sephirosuy, caused of somebody like to jokes
on my name, I could be acceptable if you call Zeph. Anyway, I'm a contributor
of video games since December 2005, but this is not my proper job, though I
wish to be. I love video games, and I don't just want to play video games for
entertaining, but no way in my country allow me to exploit all my ideas, it's
too bad for me. I won't give up, I try to prove myself that I'm not only a
video game player, and that's why I became a video games contributor. Before
I really get to my proper job in my life, I've spended all free times on the
video games contribution, and this is one of my elaborately works, hope you
enjoy the guide. 


- About the guide -

This is a FAQs/Walkthrough for the game Final Fantasy XII, made by Square Enix.
The guide is based on Sony Playstation 2 NTSC/J version, which released on 16th
of March 2006. I will not explain much about the events during the game, but
still include some SPOILERs of the game.

Currently I'm revising the whole guide for matching with the US version, so
that it could be used for both version. For easy understanding, I've written
down both Japanese and English name for certain materials that had different
names, so what I mean is the revised guide is actually can be used for both
version of Final Fantasy XII.

Some translations were included in the guide as well, but the actual names
might be different with the English version. When using certain translator to
view these Japanese words, the default font and the shape of non-Japanese words
in the guide might run away, so I suggest don't open any translator or encode
with different font type when you don't need to read those Japanese words. The
guide was done by Notepad, I guess it could display everything properly, so
recommend view this guide by Notepad if possible. In case you don't know how
to encode, 'Right-Click' on the page, 'Encoding' -> 'Japanese Shift-JIS'.

The lastest version of the guide will always comes to GameFAQs first.
There's some other guides which can be referenced as well. I know somebody
would like to read everything in once, but sorry for separated them, for
certain reasons, I have to do this.

---------------
  NAME : Vaan  |---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------

 Age    : 17        A lighthearted hero who lost his parents, dreams of a 
 Gender : Male      day become an airship captain and having his own airship.
 Race   : Hume      He sets out from his home in the heart of Dalmasca to 
                    become a sky pirate.  He looks on the future with an 
                    air of hope.

     Character Growth:   HP  [OOOOOOOO--]  <A>
                         MP  [OOOOO-----]  <C>
                         Str [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Mag [OOOOOOOO--]  <A>
                         Vit [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Spd [OOOOOOOO--]  <A>

-----------------
  NAME : Penelo  |-------------------------------------------------------------
----------------- 
                    She's lost her family in the recent war, lives among
 Age    : 16        the same bustling streets as Vaan. Though a talented 
 Gender : Female    singer and dancer, she is no stranger to battle, having
 Race   : Hume      learned to fight from her brothers, who once belonged to
                    an order of knights. She overcomes any obstacles in her
                    way and exihibis strength of character in all she does.

     Character Growth:   HP  [OO--------]  <E>
                         MP  [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Str [OO--------]  <E>
                         Mag [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Vit [OOOOOOOOO-]  <A>
                         Spd [OOOOOO----]  <B>

---------------
  NAME : Ashe  |---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------

 Age    : 19        She is the daughter of Dalmasca King who dies in the war.
 Gender : Female    Her whereabouts since the Archadian invasion are unknown.
 Race   : Hume      The rightful heir to the Dalmascan throne, she also leads
                    the resistance, hope to bring peace back the kingdom again.

     Character Growth:   HP  [OOO-------]  <D>
                         MP  [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Str [OOOOO-----]  <C>
                         Mag [OOOOOOOOOO]  <S>
                         Vit [OOOOOO----]  <B>
                         Spd [OOOOOO----]  <B>

-------------------
  NAME : Balthier  |-----------------------------------------------------------
-------------------

 Age    : 22        A man without a country, he nevertheless is a sky pirate 
 Gender : Male      with a code, stealing only from the wicked. Always with
 Race   : Hume      Fran as his partner since long time ago. He is neutral 
                    when it comes to the war.

4. System
4-1. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-----------O ----------------------------------------------------------------
-O   Basic   O 
 O-----------O                                                           [s041]

Select "New Game" come to the menu below,

Config Menu:
  - Game start

System:
 Controller vibration : on / off ( default is off )
 Screen vibration     : on / off ( default is off )
 Subtitle             : on / off ( default is on )
 Smooth Edge          : on / off ( default is on )
 Sound                : Pro Logic II / Stereo / Mono ( default is Stereo )
 Screen Adjust

Etc:
  - Default setting

** you can change this options during the game, it's under "Config".


 -------------
 |  Control  |
 -------------

- Left Analog   = Move character
- Right Analog  = Zoom / Turn camera view
- D-pad     = Change character / Move selection
- Triangle  = Open Party Menu
- Square    = Arrange the stuffs inside Party Menu / Open battle command
- Circle    = Works as "confirm/next" function / Open battle command
- X   = Works as "cancel/exit" function
- L1  = Change page in certain option of Party Menu / Change target in battle
- L2  = Zoom in / out the Map
- R1  = Change page in certain option of Party Menu / Change target in battle
- R2  = Zoom in / out the Map, Escape from battle
- Select  = Open Map screen
- Start   = Pause / Resume the game


 ----------------
 |  Party Menu  |
 ----------------

Press "Triangle" button to view this menu,

- Party       = Set your battle member formation
- Status      = View character's statuses
- Equipment   = Change character's equipments
- Licenses    = View and upgrade character's License grid
- Gambit      = Set character's Gambit action
- World Map   = View the world map as well as the owned maps
- Inventory   = Check everything that're owned
- Clan Report = Check the hunting process, bestiary, Sky Pirate's Den
                and adventure tips/hints. (named Clan Primer for US version)
- Config      = Change the game configurations, read below


 -----------------
 |  Config Menu  |
 -----------------

You can find this under "Party Menu",

Battle:

 Battle mode setting : wait / active ( default is wait )
 Battle mode speed   : slow OOOOOO fast
 Target line         : on / off ( default is on )
 Cursor position     : memory / normal ( default is normal )

System:

 Controller vibration : on / off ( default is off )
 Screen vibration     : on / off ( default is off )
 Subtitle             : on / off ( default is on )
 Smooth Edge          : on / off ( default is on )
 Sound                : Pro Logic II / Stereo / Mono ( default is Stereo )
 Screen Adjust

Etc:
  - Default setting




4. System
4-2. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O   License Board   O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s042]

Similar FF-X, activate the notes to raise up the attitudes of characters.
For the License Board, it's no longer require the items like 'Sphere' in FF-X
anymore, but it requires License Point 'LP' to learn the abilities on the
board.

This is very important since leveling up your character  does  not  raise  much
of the stats, so you much use existing slot on the Licenses Board to strengthen
your characters as well as the item usage, equipments and abilities could be
learn too. So sometimes I mention  "level up some more"  in the guide doesn't
mean to only level up your characters,  you should active more other slots on
the License Board to make them stronger.

With the LP, characters can ativate the ability box on the License board with
appointed amount of LP,  and LP could be gained by defeating enemies. Each
character will be awarded the same amount of  LP  even for those non active
character (not in the main team) can also get the same LP after teamate have
defeated enemy.

LP will never disappear until the character has used them on the ability box.

There is an existing guide about the abilities on the entire License Board,
check this guide for the list of ability.

http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_ability.txt




4. System
4-3. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O   Gambit System   O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s043]

Gambit System is allow player to set the actions of each character during
battle, so that character can perform the actions as how the command has been
arranged in the Gambit menu.

At the beginning, players have only two Gambit slots for each character before
activate any extra Gambit slots from License Board, the maximun slots for one
character are 12.

Within the Gambit menu, you can see the Gambit slot splited to three column,
they are 'Gambit On/Off', 'Target', 'Action'. For the 'Target', you have to buy
them from Gambit Slot before you can use it, and the Gambit target that you
don't have will not display in the Gambit target selection list.

Below is an example of the Gambit action:

 column 1 -        column 2       - column 3
  1. On   - Ally: [KO'd]          - Phoenix Down
  2. On   - Ally: [HP<50%]        - Curaga
  3. On   - Foe:  Nearest visible - Attack

Result:
- any member Dead/Ko'd, use Phoenix Down.
- any member HP lower than 50%, cast Curaga.
- encounter enemies, Attack the nearest target.
*Curaga is named Curada in Japanese version

As long as the Gambit actions is 'On'. character will always perform the upper
Gambit action if the target's existing. From the example above, this character
will only attack enemies if none of the characters lower than 50% HP or been
Dead/KO'd. Let say if any member lower than 50% HP, he/she will stop attacking
and cast Curada until the members are over 50% HP. Same as the 'Ally [KO'd]'
Gambit, if anyone dead, he/she will use Phoenix Down before doing any other
action.

If you don't want to use Gambit action, you can just select the 'Gambit'
option in the battle command menu to switch it off, select it again to switch
on. If you just don't want a certain Gambit action, you can switch it off by 
selecting the Gambit Slot twice that's the action you don't want, remember
it's inside your 'Gambit' under 'Party Menu'.



4. System
4-4. --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  O---------------------------O -----------------------------------------------
  |  Mist Knack / Quickening  |
--O---------------------------O                                          [s044]

*Before anything, I would like thank Shammer for his/her sincerely helps,
 this section is actually done by Shammer, not me.

# Mist Knack = Japanese version
# Quickening = US version

---------------------------
< Mist Knack / Quickening >
---------------------------

   Mist Knack/Quickening may be performed once it has been licenced for that
   particular character. There are total of 18 Mist Knacks/Quickenings in the
   Licence Board, once the Mist Knack/Quickening is licenced by one character,
   no other character can licence the same one again. Each character may have
   up to 3 Mist Knacks/Quickenings licenced.

   ================================================
   |  Character  |  LVL  |          Name          |
   ================================================
   |  Vaan       |   1   |  Red Spiral            |
   |             |   2   |  White Whorl           |
   |             |   3   |  Pyroclasm             |
   |----------------------------------------------|
   |  Penelo     |   1   |  Intercession          |
   |             |   2   |  Evanescence           |
   |             |   3   |  Resplendence          |
   |----------------------------------------------|
   |  Ashe       |   1   |  Northswain's Glow     |
   |             |   2   |  Heaven's Wrath        |
   |             |   3   |  Maelstorm's Bolt      |
   |----------------------------------------------|
   |  Balthier   |   1   |  Fires of War          |
   |             |   2   |  Tides of Fate         |
   |             |   3   |  Element of Treachery  |
   |----------------------------------------------|
   |  Fran       |   1   |  Feral Strike          |
   |             |   2   |  Whip Kick             |
   |             |   3   |  Shatterheart          |
   |----------------------------------------------|
   |  Basch      |   1   |  Fulminating Darkness  |
   |             |   2   |  Ruin Impendent        |
   |             |   3   |  Flame Purge           |
   ------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------
< Fusion Technique / Concurrences >
-----------------------------------

   When the required number of Mist Knacks/Quickenings have been performed,
   there will be an additional fusion technique at the end. Depending on
   the number and the level of Mist Knacks/Quickenings have been performed, 
   different fusion technique will appear, each with different power and
   graphics effect. When multiple requirements has been met, the fusion tech
   with higher priority will be triggered. While Mist Knacks/Quickenings deal
   damage to one foe only, the fusion tech deals damage to all foes near the
   target.

   =================================================================
   |  Priority and Power  |      Name      |  Lv1  |  Lv2  |  Lv3  |
   =================================================================
   |         High         |  Black Hole    |   4   |   4   |   4   |
   |                      |  Luminescene   |   3   |   3   |   3   |
   |                      |  Ark Blast     |   2   |   2   |   2   |
   |                      |  Whiteout      |   -   |   -   |   5   |
   |                      |  Windburst     |   -   |   5   |   -   |
   |                      |  Torrent       |   2   |   3   |   -   |
   |                      |  Cataclysm     |   7   |   -   |   -   |
   |          Low         |  Inferno       |   3   |   -   |   -   |
   -----------------------------------------------------------------

Note:
 Doesn't matter how the name sound like or the graphics effect looks
 like, ALL mist knacks/quickenings and concurrences deals physical damage,
 and the mist knacks/quickenings damage is affect by the strength of the
 character that is performing it. None of it has any element effects.

 As for how to perform, player has to press the existing button during the
 Mist Knack/Quickening screen. Do the same thing for next turn till none of
 the skill button exists, press R2 to shift the chances, press the button
 when any of them exists again to chain the combo. Repeat as much as possible
 to make a higher combo.

 .======================|_____________________________________________________/
=|   6. Walkthrough    []____________________________________________________/
 '======================(  /
                     \_/~~'          
 _____________________________________________________________________________
/-----------------------------------------------------------------------------\
---------------------------|   Nalbina Fortress   |----------------------------
                           ------------------------                      sep001

The game start with Tutorial, you just need to follow the commands in game,
just skip this part if you want to go in the game directly.

Use Right Analog Stick to zoom or turn the camera view, then use Left Analog
Stick to move your character to the green point displaying in the mini map
at the top right screen. Now get close to the person near the gate and press
Circle to talk. Go in front the gate and press Circle again to open it. Next
area start the battle tutorial. Press Circle (X in American version) to view
the battle command, you have the following options: Attack with weapon, 
Magic/Skill, Item. More commands and actions will be added later on.

After finishing off the first enemies, go forward to fight with a mini boss. 
Don't worry, it's a very easy boss, halfway through the battle Basch will
finish it off. After the mini boss, defeat some more enemies and go to the
entrance, now you are able to view the Map screen by pressing Select button.

In the next section, you can using R2 to escape from battle. A potion is 
located in the right corner, and another is in the Northern area. Go upstair
will see the Save Crystal, you can restore your HP/MP by pressing it. Nothing
other then the Save Crystal is here so go up the following stairs. Defeat some
enemies here, then enter to the last hall in the North area. This concludes the
tutorial section.



===============================================================================
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------                 sep002

O --- Monster --- O

 Dire Rat
  Lv : 1
  HP : 60

The "Equip" is added in the Party Menu, but so far you don't have other
equipment to change to. Starting out in the pool, you have to defeat all
rats around to trigger an event. Afterwards, "World Map" is added in the
Party Menu, and you will come to the street. From current section, go to
South-East area for an event. Next head to The Sandsea to the North-East
and go inside to trigger another event. Let Tomaj explain Licenses.

** NOTE: you can actually view your current destination in the Map screen,
         your destination is marking as "X with a circle" in red colour,
         remember always view the Map if you get lost.

After talking with Tomaj, you begin the first Mob Hunt mission which is
Rogue Tomato, an enemy outside of the town, as for more details of other
Mob Hunts, read  'Mob Hunt'  section under  "7a. Side Quest & Mini-Game".
"Licenses" and "Clan Report" are added in the Party Menu (Clan Report was
named as Clan Primer for the American version). Now head to the Eastgate
through the central section (Southern Plaza), a Save Crystal can be found
there. Next go outside to the Dalmasca Estersand, don't forget to equip the
accessory that's given by Tomaj, the Orrachea Armlet.

                           --------------------------
---------------------------|   Dalmasca Estersand   |--------------------------
                           --------------------------

O--- Monster/Enemy ---O

  Cactoid              Wild Saurian         Wolf
   Lv : 1-4             Lv : 29-34           Lv : 2-9
   HP : 72-224          HP : 6001-6551       HP : 94-155
   Weak : Wind          Weak : Wind          Weak : Earth
   Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal
    - Broad Sword        - Earth Magicite     - Antidote
    - Earth Stone        - Hi-Potion          - Pebble
    - Potion             - Bone Helm          - Potion
    - Virgo Gem          - Leo Gem            - Wolf Pelt
    - Cactus Fruit       - Tyrant Bone        - Wind Stone
    - Bundle of Needles  - Tanned Hide

If you go further, you will encounter more monsters, but it is unesessary to
explore for now. Just go North-East direction will see the tomato enemy. Half
way of through the battle, it will jump down from precipice, go down and finish
it off.
                        --------------------------------
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------

Back to Rabanastre Eastgate and talk to the Kytes. After the scene, you came to
North End, just go forward until the Stairwell to Downtown (named Lowtown for
American version) at East and enter. Before that, you can find your Tomaj in
The Sandsea for reward, but you could find him later, he will still give you
the rewards.
                            ------------------------
----------------------------|   Downtown/Lowtown   |---------------------------
                            ------------------------

Reach to Southern area here, enter Old Dalan's Place near the water way. Don't
open  the treasure chest in front of this room, it has some connections with a
weapon called 'Strongest Halberd' which you can obtain it later. More details
about this weapon, read the  "Weapons"  section, it's call Zodiac Spear on the
US version. After the scene with Dalan, head to Southgate section through the
circle gate that's nearby. You can see the first Gate Crystal here, it works as
Save Crystal, the extra feather is teleport function. Choose the second option
is to teleport, but you have to activate the Gate Crystal in other location to
be used, and currently you don't have other places to go. Anyway, teleporting
using the Gate Crystal requires an item called "Teleport Stone (Telepo-Stone)",
which are fixed under "Loot" section in Inventory list.

Before leaving the town, thing that you must know is about the clan. In the
Northernmost Street section, go to the West area, there is a room you can't
enter before you talk to the bangaa in front. Just speak with him to enter that
room, the Clan Headquarter. Speak to the moogle named Montblanc at upstair to
become a member of the clan. Later of the game you can always return him for
rewards when your clan rank increases, when you defeated certain bosses and
more. Also they're certain Mob Hunt missions you can only get from Montblanc.
You can join as member anytime before you move on the final place of the game,
you will still get the rewards.

You can also find the clan shop in Bazaar section, where located South-West
of here. Things that are selling in the clan shop will always update when your
clan ranking increase. Again, the clan shop will only exist after you became
a clan member.

Next, go outside from Southgate of Rabanastre.



===============================================================================
------------------------------|   Giza Plains   |------------------------------
                              -------------------                        sep003

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

  Giza Rabbit        Hyena              Slaven             Urstrix
   Lv : 1-2           Lv : 2-3           Lv : 4-5           Lv : 3-4
   HP : 70-105        HP : 95-115        HP : 280-302       HP : 170-190
   Weak : Fire        Weak : Water       Weak : Wind        Weak : Wind
   Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal
    - Antidote         - Cotton Cap       - Earth Stone      - Echo Herbs
    - Pebble           - Fire Stone       - Eye Drops        - Earth Stone
    - Phoenix Down     - Pebble           - Tanned Hide      - Headguard
    - Potion           - Potion           - Pebble           - Large Feather
    - Water Stone      - Wolf Pelt        - Shortbow         - Potion
    - Drab Wool                           - 50 gil           - Pebble

  Werewolf             Wild Snake           Sleipnir
   Lv : 19-21           Lv : 3-5             Lv : 4
   HP : 2200-2570       HP : 210-250         HP : 280
   Weak : Wind          Weak : Earth         Weak : Ice
   Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal
    - Earth Stone        - Leather Plate      - Broadsword
    - Kotetsu            - Pebble             - Molting
    - Potion             - Snake Skin         - Potion
    - Pebble             - Telepo-Stone       - Pebble
    - Quality Hide       - Wind Stone         - 30 gil
    - Gemini Gem (S)     
    - Telepo-Stone (S)

Keep going straight to the South, on the way encounter some enemies. When you
reach the Nomad Camp, you can find a shop here and Save Crystal at the corner.
Talk to Nomad/Masyua in front of the giant black crystal and choose the first
option. Penelo joins with you after the scene. Now talk to the girl in front,
leave this area you will get some items from Penelo.

Gambit function added in the battle command. Now head to central South section,
fight more enemies if you want, but make sure you DO NOT disturb that two giant
beasts (Werewolf) walking around the South-West corner. Another Save Crystal is
in the South section (Crystal Glade). Speak to Jinn near the dark crystal and
choose the first option to  begin the mission.  Now you need to raise up the
energy until 100% from the shining dark crystal, view the map screen to find
out the location of all four dark crystals (exclamation mark), they're located
in four different area.

When the energy gets to 100%, you will be back at the Crystal Glade, and
return to the camp. After the scene, you obtain 3 Potions and 2 Telepo-stone.
Next, back to Rabanastre.



===============================================================================
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------                 sep004

Use the circle wall gate to Downtown/Lowtown.

                           ------------------------
---------------------------|   Downtown/Lowtown   |----------------------------
                           ------------------------

Penelo will leave the party before you entering Dalan's Place. You will
obtain a key item, the Crescent Stone after speaking with Dalan. Now move to
the Northern area which is the Storehouse 5. Remember the chest in front of
Dalan's Place is the chest that you're NOT supposed to open, or else you'll
lose an easy chance to obtain one of the strongest weapons later. Once you
reach the Storehouse, Kytes will give some items to you. Now enter the left
gate which leads to your next objective.



===============================================================================
--------------------------|   Garamsythe Waterway   |--------------------------
                          ---------------------------                    sep005

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

  Dire Rat            Ichthon             Steeling
   Lv : 1-4            Lv : 3-4            Lv : 2-3
   HP : 62-112         HP : 130-141        HP : 94-110
   Weak : Water        Weak : Thunder      Weak : Earth
   Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal
    - Antidote          - Eye Drops         - Antidote
    - Fire Stone        - Fish Scale        - Bat Fang
    - Leather Shield    - Potion            - Phoenix Down
    - Libra Gem         - Phoenix Down      - Pebble
    - Rat Pelt          - Pebble            - Wind Stone
    - Rat Tail          - Water Stone

A Save Crystal is here. The right route leads to nothing, just run up the left
route. Go East and then North, eventually you'll come to the North Spur Sluice,
find the chest at the West end of this section for a Mage Masher.



===============================================================================
---------------------|   The Royal Palace Of Rabanastre   |--------------------
                     --------------------------------------              sep006

Save Crystal is just right behind you. Hit the golden statue/urn for the map.
Start from now, DON'T touch that treasure chest on the right, one of the two
chests there hiding an Elixir, do not open it if you want 'Strongest Halberd/
Zodiac Spear' weapon easily later of the game. For more details about this
weapon, read the "11. Weapons" section.

In the hall, go forward to watch an event. Talk to the soldier, then talk to
the Palace Servent near the pole. Now press "Square" to call the soldier over,
once he leaves his position, run past him, up the stairs and enter the door.

The map of this area is roughly like this:

       __| |____________| |
      X__ A ____________B |____
         | |            |  ____
      ___| |____________| |
      ___ C _______D____  |
         | |            | |_____
    _____| |____________|  _____
   S_____ F ____________E |
         | |            | |
         | |____________| |
         |______________  '-----
                        | .-----
                        | |
                        | |___
                        |______

You start at S, and don't care about the passages at right side. Some soldiers
are blocking your way at point A,C,E.

All you need to do is press "Square" to provoke the soldiers away from blocking
you. First provoke the soldiers at E from F area, while they're coming, run to
the passage below of the map. Now no more soldiers at E, so go to B and provoke
the A soldier. Then go to D, examine the Lion Signet on the floor and use the
Crescent Stone that was given by Dalan before, and the Faint Wall at X will be
activated. Now provoke the C soldiers from D, then run back to E and provoke
the F soldiers. Go back to the passage below and move to X.

Inside the secret passage, just go to the end of the passage and check the
switch on the left wall, push it to unlock the door on the other side here,
open it to next area. After the scene, you will obtain Goddess's Magicite,
now just run to upper level through the stairs to trigger another scene.



===============================================================================
--------------------------|   Garamsythe Waterway   |--------------------------
                          ---------------------------                    sep007

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

   Lv : 1-4            Lv : 5-6           Lv : 3-4           Lv : 2-3

   Weak : Water        Weak : Holy        Weak : Thunder     Weak : Earth
   Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal

In the Water Way, Balthier and Fran join the party. Also a Save Crystal is
just in front of you. Go down Balthier will explain more about the Gambit
functions. After that, "Party" and "Gambit" options have been added in the
Party Menu. Next, check the dead bodies on left side, then leave here.

Next section, turn left from the junction,  hit that golden urn for the map.
Now you need to go central section. Explore the corners in different areas can
find some gil and items, as well as Escutcheon shield. Another Save Crystal is
in the South-East section.  Go to the bottom to meet with Ashe,  and she will
join as guest character for now. Defeat the Imperial Swordsman after the scene,
move to next section, prepare to cast Fire spell with Fran.

BOSS : Flan x4
HP   : 360-420

Very easy, just take them down one by one.

Reached the central section, can find a Save Crystal here, now prepare for
the boss battle before open the gate which leads to Overflow Cloaca.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Firemane                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 7          Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.

  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Consider this is the first real boss in the game, nothing hard actually.
  This boss is weak against Water. It can Poison you, just remember to cure it.
  Because of Ashe only performs the attacks during the battle, keep healing
  her, she can help lot.



===============================================================================
--------------------------|   The Nalbina Dungeons   |-------------------------
                          ----------------------------                   sep008

O --- Enemy --- O

  Imperial Hoplite   Imperial Magus    Imperial Marksman   Imperial Swordsman
   Lv : 9             Lv : 8            Lv : 8              Lv : 8-9
   HP : 283           HP : 205          HP : 180-220        HP : 180-237
   Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal        Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal
    - Potion           - Potion          - Potion            - Potion   
    - Phoenix Down     - Phoenix Down                        - Phoenix Down 

Currently you have lost all your inventory, but will get them back soon. Search
around this place for some items before leaving, use the Save Crystal near the
exit. Afterwards, defeat three Seeq enemies by using Vaan and Balthier. Fran
rejoins party after this battle.

Next area, you will get your items back as well as the map before the Save
Crystal. Don't open the other treasure chests here, like the one in front of
the Dalan's Place and the Elixir in the palace, it has some connections with
'Strongest Halberd' weapon which you can obtain later. Read the "11. Weapons"
section for more details about this weapon, again, it's call Zodiac Spear as
well. Next place, defeat the imperial militaries when necessory. An event
happens when you come to the central North area. The Judge has opened the 
door, get in there to meet with Basch, and he will join as guest character.



===============================================================================
--------------------------|   The Barheim Passage   |--------------------------

Run down and go into the right room to get some gil. A Save Crystal is in
the other corner.  Now head to the tower and examine the switch, Balthier 
tells you to get an energy source to active it. Talk to the Bangaa at the
bottom to get a Fuse Tube, now you can active the switch. Press the switch
at the tower and another near the Bangaa to open the gate. Before leaving,
buy the Blizzard magic from the Bangaa merchant.

Next area, defeat the zombie and kill the Battery Mimic to keep the battery
energy from depleting. You need to kill all Battery Mimics in the following
sections to gain battery energy. In the Great Eastern Passage, turn back to 
the broken railway on the right to find the urn, hit it for the map of this 
place.Go into the right station to find two more Battery Mimics, some Flans
are here too, use the Fire spell against them if you want to kill them faster.

After that, head to South, then go West from the next section. There's a switch
in the North-West end, and you must press it to open the Southern gate, back to
South route. Find the Save Crystal after the scene, then advance to the next
area. Another Save Crystal in the South-East railway, after this is the boss
fight, so make sure you save you game here, learn the Blizzard magic before
the fight.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Mimic Queen              |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 10         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 4073        - Knot of Rust     |   |   Recommended: > 10   |
  |   Weak : Ice       - Rose Corsage     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 8    |
  |   ELE. : Thunder   - Storm Magicite   |   |   Average Lv : > 8    |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Some small mimics join with the boss, killing them is just a waste of
  your time,  just focus on attacking the boss,  now Basch has slightly
  higher offensive power, so don't let him die during the fight. Thunder
  spell will heal the boss, but Bizzard spell deals the most damage, that's
  why you should buy it from the Bangaa at the beginning of this area.

                           --------------------------
---------------------------|   Dalmasca Estersand   |--------------------------
                           --------------------------

You Appear in the Dalmasca Estersand after the scene. Leave here and go South.
Next section, if you go East it leads to the entrance of Nalbina, you can go 
there and activate the Gate Crystal first. South is connected to Giza Plains.
South-West is back to Rabanastre, and this is your current destination.

If you need a map for this area, head North, a Moggle is selling the map for
50 gil, and you can also find a shop and Gate Crystal here. Enemies around
here are fairly easy opponents, but you probably will see the t-rex namely
Wild Saurian in the section before Rabanastre, try not to disturb it.



===============================================================================
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------                 sep010

After arriving in Rabanastre, everyone leaves your party. Starting from now, 
the Moogling is available, you can use them to warp yourself to other sections,
just talk to the moogle beside the Moogling. By the way, your next destination
is Downtown/Lowtown.

                            ------------------------
----------------------------|   Downtown/Lowtown   |---------------------------
                            ------------------------

Talk to Dalan in his place at South to obtain Sword of the Order, also remember
DON'T open the treasure chest  in front of his place  or you will lost the easy
chance to obtain a strongest weapon. Now you can see the Western area marked as
your destination, so reach to there, then talk to the Rabarastran/Balzac who's
sitting on the box, Basch rejoins the party.

                        --------------------------------
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------

Now back to the street, head to East area for some event. Enter The Sandsea and
go upstair to find Balthier and Fran, and they will return to the party. If you
haven't gotten your rewards for Rogue Tomato hunt, talk to Tomaj. Now head to
Westgate, go into the Airship Terminal (named Aerodrome for American version)
on your right hand side. Speak with Balthier in the terminal and choose the
first option twice will go to other place by airship.



===============================================================================
------------------------|   The SkyCity Of Bhujerba   |------------------------
                        -------------------------------                  sep011

Lamont join as guest character. Out to the street, the moogle in the junction
is selling the map for here and the next place that you're going, prices are
70 and 650 gil.  Go East section through the South area, on the way are some
shops, have a look at the shops if you're needing some itmes. After that, run
down the stair after Save Crystal in East section to the mines.

                            -----------------------
----------------------------|   The Lhusu Mines   |----------------------------
                            -----------------------

  Skeleton             Skull Defender      Slaven             Steeling
   Lv : 8-9             Lv : 8-11           Lv : 10-11         Lv : 7-8
   HP : 557-563         Lv : 476-708        HP : 780-802       HP : 446-462
   Weak : Holy          Weak : Holy         Weak : Weak        Weak : Earth
   Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal         Drop/Steal
    - Bone Fragment      - Antidote          - Aevis Killer     - Antidote
    - Bronze Chestplate  - Bone Fragment     - Earth Stone      - Armguard
    - Dark Stone         - Dark Stone        - Eye Drops        - Bat Fang
    - Echo Herb          - Iron Helm         - Pebble           - Eye Drops
    - Iron Helm          - Pebble            - Tanned Hide      - Pebble
    - Pebble                                                    - Wind Stone

Beware of the traps in this place, you can't see them unless your character 
has Libra status. The traps appear as a red light on the ground. Here is the 
first place that will you find the traps, there are more and more traps in the 
later parts of the game.

First, just go to West, then turn North. Don't fight the Skull Defender or
Skeleton in a group. Go until the Northern cave for a scene. After that, you
will being chased by four bosses,  flee from the fight you can't win at your
current level (you can fight them later in a side quest). Rush to the exit of
the mines, the music stop after you successfully escape from them. Afterwards,
go back to outside. If you can handle the Skull Defender and Skeleton, go to
the road leading North which has lot of these enemies,  chain them for 10-20
minutes, you will probably get lot of Bone Fragments, sell all them afterwards.
This place is really a best place to earn gil for your current level, earn at
least earn enough gil to buy items before advancing the story.

                        -------------------------------
------------------------|   The SkyCity Of Bhujerba   |------------------------
                        -------------------------------

Now back to Bhujerba, you have to do some propaganda to raise the bar until
100%.  Just press "Square" button to do it,  keep a look out and don't ever
let the guards see you while doing it. Do it to the man who's holding a blue 
colored book to raise the percentage faster. Once you've done this, watch the
scene.

There's a board inside the inn, like the one in Rabanastre, at The Sandsea,
which allows you to receive more Mob Hunt missions later. Now check the map,
your next goal should be shown to the North. Move to the North, talk to the
guard on the right, and choose the first option.



===============================================================================
-------------------------|   Dreadnought Leviathan   |-------------------------
                         -----------------------------                   sep012

O --- Enemy --- O

  Imperial Gunner   Imperial Magus   Imperial Swordsman   Mastiff
   Lv : 9            Lv : 9           Lv : 10-11           Lv : 11
   HP : 562          HP : ?           HP : 615             HP : 535
   Drop/Steal        Drop/Steal       Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal
    - Potion          - Potion         - Potion             - Potion
    - Phoenix Down                     - Phoenix Down

Vossler joins as a guest. Use the Save Crystal in the first section. Take 
the door that's closeby to advance. In the first passage, find the treasure 
chest to the South, it should be a Handaxe, but possible it's random, just
have a try on it.

Now check the map to see a mark that's shows your current objective. go to
the connected area and take the door at the bottom to reach there. There is
another weapon which is quite useful for your current status, located in the
Sub-Control Room, Assasin's Dagger, move West in that room, it's hiding in
the last chest. In the area before you reach your objective, a fight awaits.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Judge (x2)               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 11         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 2245        - 300 gil          |   |   Recommended: > 13   |
  |   Weak : -         - Hi-Potion        |   |   Minimum Lv : > 10   |
  |   ELE. : -         - Potion           |   |   Average Lv : > 10   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  **Sub Enemy: Imperial Swordsman x3
               Imperial Magus x1

  You just need to take down the Judges to end the battle, but the other
  enemies won't let you do this easily. If you're planning for a long fight,
  I recommend you kill the Imperial Magus first. During the fight, make sure
  to set a Gambit to use  Phoenix Down  on your ally and put it to the top,
  just in case. If your opponents gang up on your character, he/she will be
  KO'd instantly.

Next section, you can find a shop in left room, System Access Key and the
Save Crystal in right room, rescue Ashe in the second room to the right.
After that, you will obtain Manufacted Nethicite. Buy some recovery items
from the shop. If you got extra gil, buy the accessory call Gauntlets, it's
to increase chances of successfully blocking for the shield users.

Now head back to the previous area,  encounter some more enemies, remember 
you can go back to the Save Crystal to heal your party. Move to the control
room, run upstairs and operate the system with the System Access Key that you
got before. Now you must leave this area within 60 seconds. Check the map and
you can find two more panels that have the same usage, you will probably need
to operate the system again before you get to the West area (where you began
this place),  so just go to the appointed area  and operate it for another
60 seconds to flee. There's another battle awaiting in the West.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Judge Ghis               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 14         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 4120        - Dark Mote        |   |   Recommended: > 14   |
  |   Weak : -         - Potion           |   |   Minimum Lv : > 12   |
  |   ELE. : -                            |   |   Average Lv : > 12   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  **Sub Enemy: Imperial Swordsman x3

  Kill that three swordsmen immediately before focusing on the main boss.
  If you have  Mist Knack/Quckening move, just use it. Always keep your
  allies a more then half HP. Send two characters with shields to close
  combat, and you control the other character to heal them, depending on
  the situation, if they still have a lot of HP, you don't need to heal
  either.

                        -------------------------------
------------------------|   The SkyCity Of Bhujerba   |------------------------
                        -------------------------------

After defeating the boss, you arrive back to the Airship Terminal/Aerodrome in
Bhujerba. Now go around armor shop area and speak to the guard again, choose
first option to Dalmasca Westersand.

                          ---------------------------
--------------------------|   Dalmasca Westersand   |--------------------------
                          ---------------------------

There is a Gate Crystal when you appear in Dalmasca Westersand, you need to 
go West from here.

Just head up to the tower, follow the only route to West, on the way you'll
face some enemies. You can chain off all Alraune in the first section, you
can get a loot call Succulent Fruit from them, each sell for 363 gil, just
bring them back and sell to the merchant in Dalmasca Westsand from before.

In the second section, Vossler joins as a guest character again. This area 
branches off in a couple routes, but they end up in the same place. If you go
West, you can find a Save Crystal and a moogle, to the South-West, you will
meet an item/accessory/magic merchant and a Gate Crystal. The West route is
recommended, but if you want to buy something, you'd better go both routes.

Another place of importance is the Zertinan Cavern, it's an optional place 
which hides an Esper. This place is connected to many locations, and this is
one of them. Right now isn't the time to find this Esper, if you can't defeat
the monster inside easily, don't try to fight the Esper.

Please check "8. Esper / Summon" for more details on the Esper.

In the North-East area from where you came West out of Ogir-Yensa, talk to the
moogle,  then follow the Urutan-Yensa that he points out. In the Next section,
you will probably see the Urutan Eater fighting with the Urutan-Yensa. Defeat
it with the help of the  Urutan-Yensa. After that,  talk to the moogle again.
Then head back to Ogir-Yensa and up the ramp for a scene. Go back to where you
found the moogle  for an event.  After that,  talk to the moogle again. Then
examine the flower for Eksir Berries, an item quite useful for the next boss.

In the first section,  go to the  small  island  which is connected by two
suspension bridges, hit the statue/urn to get the map. Now keep heading West.
Defeat the enemies here and you can level up faster for your current status.
The Southern section is connected to the Zertinan Cavern. Again, you don't
need to go there for now.

In the Central/South-West section you can find HP<1000 Gambit at the end of 
the bridge. But it seems it has been changed in the American version. In the 
West section you can find the shop which is the same merchant that was by the
Gate Crystal section from before, and now he's selling Hi-potions. After this,
go into the cave there, you're able to save your game without a Save Crystal.
The next area is a boss fight.

  Use the Eksir Berries, then keep attacking until it dies, pretty easy.

Now the merchant come to this area too, buy some Eye Drops from him. Also buy
the Argyle Armlet accessory if possible, it's immune to Blind status effect.
In front of the Gate Crystal. Check the Way Stone and choose first option to
get into the tomb.



===============================================================================
-------------------------|   The Tomb Of Raithwall   |-------------------------
                         -----------------------------                   sep015

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

The Way Stone in front doesn't work yet, just go down from the stairs. Cross
the bridge, and the Demon Wall awakes, it has around 20,000 HP, so you better
avoid to fight for now,  just run to the door behind you. If you defeat it,
check the jewel in the wall to raise up two bridges which lead to the secret
area. But before defeating the other Demon's wall in the next area, it won't
work. In the secret area, you might get the Evil Slayer sword from the chest,
but you might just get some gil.

You can back here to fight it later, now just head to next area to face the
second Demon Wall.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Demon Wall               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 16         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 10332       - Quality Stone    |   |   Recommended: > 15   |
  |   Weak : Holy      - Gold Needle      |   |   Minimum Lv : > 12   |
  |   ELE. : -         - Solid Stone      |   |   Average Lv : > 12   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  At the start of the battle,  run up to the Demon Wall  and start attacking.
  The fires to the sides are used to  stop the boss  from moving,  examine it
  and choose the second option to turn it off,  BUT  if it turns to blue fire,
  the boss will speed up to crush you. If you have bad luck and it turns blue,
  hurry and examine the other fire and turn it off to stop the speeded up boss.
  Don't worry, there're only two of them with blue fire. Remember to cure from
  the Blind status with Eye Drops or Blindna.  Equip Argyle Armet if you had
  bought it before.  The Demon Wall has a skill  that can remove one of your
  characters instantly, and also knows Doom, you can't heal it for now since
  your  Lore of Remedy  has not reached a higher level yet. Keep your MP for
  Mist Knack/Quickening to deal a lot of damage at once.

After beating this Demon Wall, if you backtrack to the previous place to
finish off the first Demon Wall, you can press the shining jewel on the wall,
and it will raise up two bridges. Save your game by using the Gate Crystal
outside,  because if you don't do so the chest in secret area won't appear,
for the American version  you don't need to do this.  After that, just go
through the bridge to the secret area, this area won't display in the map
screen.

Next section, run down and you can see three Way Stones, so far only one of
them works.  Hit the statue/urn behind for the map.  Go either to the left
(South)  or right (North) section,  either way,  you should go both ways to
unlock the hidden passage, so it doesn't matter where you go first. There is
a Green Pedestal  in the South section  and an Orange Pedestal  in the North
section.  If you found the Way Stone,  it means you have found the Pedestal,
it's nearby.  After checking the Pedestal,  use the Way Stone to go back to
the central area quickly.  Then go to the other section. Do the same thing
for the other Pedestal to unlock the hidden passage.

In the next section, continue on to have your first Esper Battle.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                Belias                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 20         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 15943       - Aries Gem        |   |   Recommended: > 15   |
  |   Weak : Water     - Ether            |   |   Minimum Lv : > 12   |
  |   ELE. : Fire      - High Arcana      |   |   Average Lv : > 12   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  His attack is powerful, but the speed is slow.  As you might discover,
  Vossler will probably perform the  combo attack  on his turn, so you'd
  better support him and not let him die.  In the middle of battle Belias
  will cast Protect and Shell. If possible, cast Protect to you front line
  character as well. Always keep your allies over 300 HP when Belias' life
  bar near to half, prepare to receive his  Firaja. After that, heal your
  Oiled ally before he/she get fire damage.

After that you gain Belias Esper, you can find it on you License board now.
Go into inner area of the West, watch a scene,  and you will get the key item,
Dawn Shard. Level up a little more in this place for the next fight. Once you
have doen, leave this tomb using the Way Stone here. Use the Gate Crystal in
the entrance, then go down the steps. After some events will fight Vossler in
the airship.

                             ---------------------
-----------------------------|   Airship Shiva   |-----------------------------
                             ---------------------

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                Vossler                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 20         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 9318        - Black Belt       |   |   Recommended: > 17   |
  |   Weak : -         - Hi-Potion        |   |   Minimum Lv : > 15   |
  |   ELE. : -         - Potion           |   |   Average Lv : > 13   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Imperial Swordsman x3

  Fran in Berserk, isn't a bad thing. Her speed and damage become increased,
  but you're not able to control her, just leave her in berserk. Some swordsmen
  join in the battle too. Each of them has 854 HP,  needless to say, kill them
  immediately, then only focus on the main boss. He will cast Reflect later so
  becareful if you plan to cast spell on him. When he's nearly dead, his chance
  of combo hits will be highly increased, move character who's spotted by the
  boss away and it can slightly reduce his combos and turns.



===============================================================================
------------------------|   Royal City Of Rabanastre   |-----------------------
                        --------------------------------                 sep016

You'll be back here after some scenes. Go out to have a quick discussion. Now
you can buy some more advanced items from the shops. Make sure to buy Esuna
magic if you've got enough gil, also learn it as soon as you've enough LP.

Starting from now,  you can trigger a sub-event in Nalbina. You will miss 
this when you reach the Mosphoran Highwaste later on,  and the reward for
finishing this event is a Salamand Halcyon, it is a rare treasure/loot which
is used in creating the Arcturus weapon. Make sure you don't miss this event
if you want the treasure.

To start this,  go to Nalbina  and find the guards who block the way going
North, that leads to the Mosphoran Highwaste. You can see July who is sitting
in front of them, talk to her, then move towards the guards for a scene. Then
hire a chocobo from the stable nearby and rush the guards, he will run away.
Afterwards,  July thanks you with the reward,  but she wants you to find her
over in Archades to get it. Later when the walkthrough reaches Archades part,
I will explain it in further detail, or you can just check the details of this
event under 'July The Female Spy' under the "7b. Sub-Event" section.

Back to the storyline, go South from Rabanastre to reach the Giza Plains.

Note: you can only get the Lambent Hat from Gigantoad by Steal

Now it's the  rainy season,  some monsters have changed.  Central section you
will meet moogle and a seeq,  they can tell you  how to get to  Ozmone Plains,
which is your current destination. Continue forward to the South-West to reach
the Ozmone Plains. On the way you may find some withered trees, cut them off to
form a bridge in the South-East  to unlock that section.  This is actually for
Gilgame/Gil Snapper hunting mission  and item for  Cockatorice Find side quest
as well. Spend some time to find all six withered trees around, so it's easier
for you when you go hunting the Gilgame/Gil Snapper later. The trees are in the
Nomad Village, Crystal Glade, Starfall Field, Toan Hills, Gizas North Bank  and
Throne Road sections. For the details of Gilgame/Gil Snapper or Cockatrice Find
side quest, check "7a-2 Mob Hunt" and "7a-6 Cockatrice Find".

Enemies are getting stronger, don't fight them in groups. Central section
leads to Zertinan Cavern, but theres no need to go there for now. An Esper is
hiding inside this cavern, but the monsters inside the cavern are very tough,
come back here later when you are stronger.

Head to the Southern section. You can see a NPC warrior fighting with some
monster, join the battle if you want. Go the West route to get to the next
place, beware the black or red Chocobos, they always come in groups.



===============================================================================
-----------------------|   Jahara, Land Of The Garif   |-----------------------
                       ---------------------------------                 sep019

A Gate Crystal with moogles are here, you can buy the map from them. Talk to
the right warrior on bridge for a scene. After that, will come to next area, a
shop is here. Now talk to the High-Chief Zayalu (opposite of the shop) to get
Jaya Stick. Now go North-West and speak with the War-Chief Supinelu and give
him the Jaya Stick too, choose the first option twice and cross the bridge.

In the following area, just get close to the warriors in front, choose the
first option during the dialogue to trigger a scene. Larsa joins as guest
character, he's Lamont that joined with your team before.

Nothing to do now, just back to Ozmone Plains, and you can take the chocobo
for free, also obtain Onion Bolt from the Garif if you passed the Jaya Stick
to him.

===============================================================================

                           --------------------------                    sep020

If you haven't learned the Esuna spell yet, don't fight the monsters here
escpecially the Panther, it can Petrify your character anytime. Anyway, try
to steal the Coeurl Pelt from them, then sell them for some gil. A seal is
blocking the way to East area, go there will trigger an event. After that,
Fran will lead you to a new road, follow the new road to next place.



===============================================================================
-----------------------------|   Eruyt Village   |-----------------------------
                             ---------------------                       sep021

The Gate Crystal of this place is just at the entrance. Have a look at the shop
that's nearby. Go to the central area and run up the circle bridge. In the next
area,  cross the only bridge there to trigger a scene.  After that, just leave
here and return to Ozmone Plains through Golmore Jungle. If you got enough gil,
buy the Drain magic.

                             ---------------------

                             ---------------------

When you reach the plains, talk to the injured soldier and give him a potion.
Speak with him again and choose the first option to borrow a chocobo, then
leave for previous section of Ozmone Plains.  Now pay attention to the left
side,  go until the area with the other chocobo,  and you now have to go to 
South-East at the place with the  chocobo tracks  on the ground, this path
doesn't exist in the map.

Back to the soldiers area where you borrow the chocobo when you get further
in the story, you can find some items on the ground.

In the ext section you will see some dead bodies in front of the cavern.
All you need to do is enter that cavern without chocobo.



===============================================================================

                              -------------------                        sep022

In the first junction, go to the right side to find a switch, press it to 
open the road South.  In the  Phase 1 Shaft  section you can find the map.
Back to the junction, turn West.  You will face lots of bats in the next
passage. The following sections are South-West, then go East. In the East
section you will encounter the dragon in the junction passage. Defeat it
isn't a big problem for your current levels.

Reach to the four-way junction in the Eastern area, press the switch and back
to the dragon's section. Once you press that switch, you will be surrounded by
many Jellies, prepare Fire spells for them. You can just run away if you don't
want to fight them. Now move North, the gate has opened. After a scene, you'll
see a Gate Crystal here, continue North for a boss fight.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                Tiamat                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 25         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 49993       - Hi-Potion        |   |   Recommended: > 20   |
  |   Weak : Earth     - Leo Gem          |   |   Minimum Lv : > 18   |
  |   ELE. : Wind      - Ring Wyrm Scale  |   |   Average Lv : > 15   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  At the beginning the boss only keeps its attacks on one person. Be careful
  of its Aero spell, it could hurt the characters in one area. If you see the
  boss is charging it, make sure all your character are ready to use healing
  items or spells. However, you can take control of a character to evade this
  move,  just run further from the targetted person,  once you are out of the
  Aeroga range, you won't get any damage, the recommended area to run is behind
  the boss.  Same tactics go for its other area attack, Disablega. But even if
  you run from the Disablega,  your allies will still get Disable status, cure
  them with Esuna. When the boss is left with around 20% HP, its defense power
  will be increased,  but you can kill it with a  Mist Knack/Quickening combo
  before it bursts up, you probably used a lot of MP in the battle, so if you
  can't get a full bar to perform the Mist Knack/Quickening,  you can try and
  cast Drain to kill off the boss.



===============================================================================
---------------------------|   The Golmore Jungle   |--------------------------
                           --------------------------                    sep023

Back in Eruyt Village. Move to Golmore Jungle and now you can cross the seals
there. If you go through the South seal, you will reach Feywood. From Feywood,
search around North-East to find a road to Paramina Rift,  which is the next
place that you have to go.  If you go through the East seal, you can find the
Gate Crystal, this route also leads the Paramina Rift, but before getting there
you will have a tough boss battle, this may be the first problem of the game.
If you cannot beat it,  you can always  skip this fight  by going the Feywood
route, but make sure you save your game before entering the battle, that way
you can skip this fight if you can't beat this boss.

Let see the boss at the North from Gate Crystal.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Elder Wyrm               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 20         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 15943       - Emperor Scale    |   |   Recommended: > 25   |
  |   Weak : Wind      - Succulent Fruit  |   |   Minimum Lv : > 22   |
  |   ELE. : -                            |   |   Average Lv : > 17   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Treant x2

  A tough battle, I recommend your characters are over 25 level, otherwise you
  must plan a perfect strategy to fight. Two Treants join with boss, kill them
  as soon as possible. The special skill from the boss can send you lots of bad
  effects which are Blind, Confuse, Silence, Oil, Slow, Sap and Poison. If you
  get these bad statuses,  cure them as soon as possible, or try changing out
  one of your members immediately when the boss readies  Sporefall, so you do
  have a chance to heal your allies after freeing from these bad statuses 

It's better if you have some accessories immune to the status effects from
this boss. Esuna spell can cure most of the bad statuses except for Oil, if
you get Oil, the fire spell from the boss will probably take more then 2000 HP.

Again, an optional way awaits. If you can't finish this boss off, I suggest
not wasting time on this fight. Reload your game, remember this boss is always
here, back for reavange when you're stronge even. By the way, don't fight the
monsters in the Feywood, just rush out to the North-East for the next
destination.



===============================================================================

To the Northern part is where you have to go, or you can explore around this
wide area first.  South-East exit leads to  Feywood,  The Southern area is
connected to The Stilshrine Of Miriam, you will go there later. The Central
section triggers a scene. After the scene, move to North-East area for your
next destination. The enemies here are not too hard, explore around for some
treasure. If you find the Yeti, try to steal the Tanned Giantskin from them,
which can be sold for 672 gil for each.



===============================================================================
-----------------------------|   Mt. Bur Omisace   |---------------------------
                             -----------------------                     sep025

A Gate Crystal and two shops are here, you can find some advanced spells 
from the seeq. Forward to the North, next turn East and you will see the
entrance of this building. Enter the building, some events happen in the
hall, then Larsa leaves the party.

Buy one or two Ice Shields from the shop, because you're going to face an
Ice elemental boss in the next destination. However, you can get this shield
from a drop  from one the monsters there if you are  lucky.  Now back to the 
previous area,  talk to the moogle around the Gate Crystal for a chocobo, if
you don't want to fight your way to the next area, but it'll cost you 600 gil.
Go back to Paramina Rift, then head South, continue past the Save Crystal to
reach the next place.



===============================================================================
-------------------------|   The Stilshrine Of Miriam   |----------------------
                         --------------------------------                sep026

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

  Oiling/Oil Tower
   Lv : 27-28               *Two unknown monsters,
   HP : 2818-2838            Reaper Mage and Reaper Claw

   Drop/Steal                they're near the Way Stone in the main hall.
    - Golden Staff           And they're belonged to Nightwalker monster.
    - Handkerchief
    - Sagittarius Gem
    - Telepo-Stone
    - Yellow Liquid

Cross over the long bridge to find a Gate Crystal before the entrance.
Inside there,  search the central area to see a  Pedestal of the Dawn.
Let your  leader character  equip the  Dawn Shard  that you got in the
Tomb Of Raithwall before, examine the stand and choose the second option.
For the Japanese version, you have to choose Ashe as your leader.

Follow the passage until the next pedestal, do the same thing with the Dawn 
Shard as before. On the way you'll encounter some enemies, don't fight them
in groups especially the Dragon Aevis.

In the next area, get ready to destroy the green crystal/Crystalbug, its magic
is quite strong,  prepare to heal for each turn it takes.  After defeating it,
the real Save Crystal appears in the same place, use it to restore your HP and
save your game too.  Now down to the central passage, then move South in the
next area,  examine the giant blade there to open the room in North, use the
Way Stone inside that room to return the main hall.

Go down the West stairs in the main hall, in the next area the West passage
will come to three way section. Here follow the right (North) passage until
you get to a huge statue, rotate it to face East. In the following section,
find the second statue in the South, rotate it to face North. Move to the East
section, before the third statue, a boss awaits.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Vinuskar                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 27         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 15138       - Damascus Steel   |   |   Recommended: > 28   |
  |   Weak : -         - Knot of Rust     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 23   |
  |   ELE. : -         - Thief's Cuffs    |   |   Average Lv : > 16   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Cast Protect on your team before opening the door. If you're wearing some 
  heavy equipment, your action speed will be slowed down because of the magnet,
  but it isn't a big problem. Just cure your characters from negative statuses.
  The boss can cast Slow on your members. It will probably perform Sword Dance
  before it dies, this move can hurt all your characters in an area, make sure
  to heal your characters when needed. The entire battle is easy.

After the boss, go into the room and rotate the statue, this one should face
West, you can also find the map behind the status. Back to previous area to
see the giant blade has raised up. Now go to main hall and use the Way Stone
back to the inner area. Head to Southern section, make sure you have some 
Alarm Clocks item.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                 Mateus                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 30         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 34259       - Ether            |   |   Recommended: > 28   |
  |   Weak : Thunder   - High Arcana      |   |   Minimum Lv : > 25   |
  |   ELE. : Ice       - Pisces Gem       |   |   Average Lv : > 20   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Ice Azer x5

  Must set Gambit to use Alarm Clock when alies get Sleep. Some Ice Azer join
  the battle, they are not your friends.  Finish off them first.  Ice Shield
  helps lot for this battle, equip it. Don't use elemental attack, just keep
  on your normal attack. The Blizarja from Mateus causes 700-900 damage to all
  targets, so keep your characters over 900 HP unless you have Ice Shield.
  If you're a zodiac gems collector, you can steal the Pisces Gem from the
  boss, this gem is quite rare.

Now you've got new Esper, Mateus in the License board. Continue to South,
get Sword of King after the scene. On the way going back to the Way Stone,
you might encounter Negalmuur, which is a rare monster. This monster will
keep summoning the Ghastes, if you want to kill it easier, send Silence to
Negalmuur to stop the it from summoning.

Now go back to Mt. Bur Omisace, use the Gate Crystal to teleport there if
you want.

                            -----------------------
----------------------------|   Mt. Bur Omisace   |----------------------------
                            -----------------------

Something has changed since your last visit. Prepare your team before moving
on, a fight awaits in the building. Before that, Haste magic is available in
the shop, buy it if you have enough of gil,  also buy the  Regen if possible.
Go out to Paramina Rift and cast all support spells like Protect, Haste and
Regen (if you have bought it) to all characters, then back to Bur Omisace to
save your game on the Gate Crystal, so you can begin the next fight with all
these support statuses.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |             Judge Bergan              |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 30         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 17200       - Ether            |   |   Recommended: > 30   |
  |   Weak : -         - Hi-Potion        |   |   Minimum Lv : > 28   |
  |   ELE. : -         - Ruby Ring        |   |   Average Lv : > 20   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Judge x3

  Kill the three Judges behind your team, and be sure you focus the lowest HP
  Judge first. For the main target, he can cast Dark, Watera and Aero randomly,
  also his normal attack. For safety, set one of your character stay behind to
  heal other characters, for characters who have shield, I recommend equiping
  the Gaunlets accessory, which increases your chance of successfully blocking.
  The battle takes place in a long passage, sometimes you can use the length of
  the passage to delay the attack from the boss. After getting a hit at one of
  the ends, run to the opposite end, but make sure the boss is still targeting
  on your leader.  While the boss is  chasing  your leader, let your other two
  character deal some damage to him. Meanwhile,  cast Regen on the character
  that you are using to lure the boss.

After that,  speak to the  Acolyte  who's walking around stairs outside the
building, and you will get Stone Of The Condemner. With this stone, you can go
back to Stilshrine Of Miriam to fight the hidden Esper, it's call Zeromus. To
find this Esper, go Stilshrine Of Miriam and use the Stone Of The Condemner to
the Way Stone in main hall, and you will be warped to a secret room, go next
door the fight it. But of cause it's very strong for now, go find this Esper
when you're stonger. Check the "8. Esper / Summon" section for the details,
and this is call Zeromus esper heading.

Your next destination is Archadia, from the locations that you've been so
far, it's North from Nalbina West Entrance.  So if you've already activated
the Gate Crystal there,  and if you still have some  Teleport Stones, just
teleport there from the Gate Crystal here,  if not,  you should backtrack
to Rabanastre city, then take the airship to Nalbina Fortress.

Additional notes:
Some advanced items are being sold in both Rabanastre and Nalbina shops, 
have a look at the shops. I recommend buying the Foe: Lowest HP Gambit from
the shop in Rabanastre, it targets on the lowest HP enemy in the group, which
makes you defeat the lowest HP enemy, easy for many random battle, just spend
50 gil to own it.

Beware of the Fire Element in the second section,  it has 14,830 HP, tough
enough for your current level, but if you defeat it you could gain lots of EXP.
Another tough monster is the Ash Wyrm, but you probably won't encoutner it for
now. In the Central section you can find a Gate Crystal and shop.

Assuming you've noticed the Shrine of Winds that are around, once you've
touched it, the stones will be raised up to the sky and form a road in the
sky. As for what is in the sky? There's an optional Esper awaiting, Exodus.
Later when you have reached the Phon Coast,  backtrack here for the quest.
All you need to activate are the Shrine of South, North-West and West to form
the correct road, if you don't want to solve this puzzle yourself, check the
"8. Esper / Summon section", look for Exodus/Exdeath Esper.

Hint: the chocobo at North-East area can help. But do remember the Esper is
quite tough for now, make sure to save the game before going for a try.

The South connects to the Dalmasca Eastersand, the North-West is where you
have to go. Cross over the big suspension bridge to reach Salikawood.
