Before the following suspension bridge you will see a  Save Crystal. In the
next section after the Save Crystal, go in a South-East direction to find the
map inside that golden statue/urn. In the Central section the Gate Crystal can
be found.  East is where you have to go for now.  Chain the Pumpkin Heads for
possible Succulent Fruits to sell, most of them were sleeping, so you do have
some advantages in fighting them.

**Below is the information of optional places

West leads to Necrohol Of Nabudis, go North-West can reach Nabreus Deadlands,
and these two places are connected to each other. If you're going to find the
Chaos Esper, you must go through these two places. And as I mentioned in the
ealier in the walkthrough, the chests that you're  not supposed  to open are
related to the Strongest Halberd/Zodiac Spear in Necrohol Of Nabudis. If you
have followed the walkthrough, the 16 chests are definitely in the Nabudis,
check this map below find the 16 chests.

http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_nabudis.png

Before that, I would like to tell you, the monsters in Nabudis are very tough,
and you need to defeat an optional boss in Salikawood only then can you reach
to Nabudis. From the Gate Crystal, go North to fight this boss.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               King Bomb               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 34         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 37596       - Bomb Fragment    |   |   Recommended: > 38   |
  |   Weak : Water     - Bomb Shell       |   |   Minimum Lv : > 35   |
  |   ELE. : Fire      - Fire Crystal     |   |   Average Lv : > 23   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Bomb x3

  Better prepare a Flame Shield for your characters for this battle. Three more
  mini bombs join in the battle, their self-destrustion deals great damage, but
  you can kill them before they explode. Remember to cure Oil status before the
  boss casts Fire, Fira or whatever Fire elemental attack. Not much HP for this
  boss,  but the hardest part is the fact it can to fully restore its HP, it
  mostly will restore when the life bar is left around half.  When you see it
  running away from you  (decribed as "Crying for some help"), it is possible
  it will spawn new mini bombs or restore HP.  What you can do is  perform
  Mist Knack/Quickening  when the boss has around half its HP bar left, and 
  hopefully your Mist Knack/Quickening combo will kill it.

Again, if you couldn't beat it for now,  remember you can always  run  away
from the fight. For your next destination, move to the Eastern part and talk
to the Moogle Boss (not the boss that would fight you) to find out that he
needs the moogles around to build the gate. Now find 9 other moogles in the
wood, they're displayed as exclamation marks on the map screen, search for
them in Forest Bungalows and speak with them.

After finding the last moogle,  choose the first option during the dialogue
to follow them back to the Eastern area. Now a new road has opened up, before
leaving here, speak with the  Moogle Boss  for an accessory, Quasimodo Boots.
Then follow this road to next place.

Once you reach will see a Save Crystal. A pretty big area here if you wish to

a shop and Gate Crystal, through the board around here can find more side
missions.

If you haven't take the 16 treasure chests in Nabudis, at South-East most of
this area, you can see 16 treasure chests there, don't open anyone of them,
reason is they had some connections with the 16 treasure chests in Nabudis,
if you open the chests here, those were inside Nabudis will disappear. One of
the chest in Nabudis was hiding the weapon, 'Strongest Halberd'! Read the
"Weapons" section for more details about this weapon, or read the section
above (Salikawood) for the location of it. By the way, Zodiac Spear was the
name for American version.

Now go to North-East, there is another Save Crystal in the last part, pass
there reach to next place.

------------------------|   The Sochen Cave Palace   |-------------------------

  Needless to say, you should focus on killing one of them. At the beginning,
  they just running around, find your target and cast Dispel it, attack before
  the other bosses come together, and remember never ever be surrounded. Attack
  your target again when they are separated. If you could handle this battle
  well, try steal the loot/treasure from each of them,  they're holding some
  pricy things.  Steal Four-leaf Clover from Mandragora Prince, Tomato Stalk
  from Topstalk, Onion from Onion Queen, Gimble Stalk from Alraune King and
  Jack-o'-Lantern from Pumpkin Star.

After this you can return to the boy in the Tchita Uplands Gate Crystal section
for your rewards, of cause you could find him later if you want.. Now go either
left or right door, through the passage to North. You can see the Save Crystal,
but it's the Crystalbug again, do prepare your team before you touch it.

Next section is Mirror of the Soul, quite complicated, make sure you take the
map at the East. Move to North come to Fall of Time section, here's a hidden
treasure awaits to be exploded.

Look at the map now you can see you're currently at the place with five
different pathes, which is the Fall of Time section, the small area in the
middle was the hidden treasure, but you can't reach there before you solve
some little puzzle. See below to solve it.

Reference map:

  (_  ___  ___  ___  ___  _)
    1N   2N   3N   4N   5N
     |    |    |    |    |
    _|____|____|____|____|_
   (                       )
   (                     S )
   (_______________________)
     |    |    H    |    |
     |    |         |    |
   _1S___2S___3S___4S___5S___
  (                        (M)


(M)= where you get the Map
 S = start here
 H = hidden treasure

-The hidden treasure at H is blocking by waterfall.
-So once you visit the central section from the right (Eastern) path you're
 reached to S.
-From S follow this route:
 S > 5S > 1S > 1N > 4N > 4S > 2S > 2N > 3N > H
-If you follow so, the waterfall which blocking in the central will disappear.
-Enter to H for your treasure, you will get either Koga Blade, Iga Blade,
 Elixir, Dark Matter or gils.

Afterwards, head to North. In Destiny's March section, run to South, West,
North and finally back to East, the secret path to the West will be unlocked
which leads to the arena of an optional boss. Now you can't open the arena yet,
for more details of this boss, you can check the Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu under the
"Optional Bosses" section. Continue to North when you done.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  Just keep attacking, always cure the negative status. When the boss left
  around 50%, it will send you Doom repeatedly. Besides that, the boss can
  always create one or more of its own shadow, the shadow has not much HP,
  so you better defeat them for first, but sometimes the shadow will automatic
  disappear. When it has created many shadows, try running around until some of
  them were gone.

Same place, search the side for possible random treasure with Elixir and
Phoenix Down.  After all, continue to North until the last area, operate
the panel above and will go upper level. You can see the Gate Crystal there.
After that, follow this passage which leads to outside.



===============================================================================
------------------------------|   Old Archades   |-----------------------------
                              --------------------                       sep032

Here you can buy the double experience accessory from the shop. Western area,
a Save Crystal. Talk to the soldier guarding on the stairs, then pay 1,500 gil
to Informant Jules. Now find the NPC known as Lucky Man, but you need to speak
with the NPC only they would show the actual name. Afterwards, talk to Jules
again, and then find the NPC know as Beasley. After some events, you can enter
to the Imperial.



===============================================================================
----------------------|   The Imperial City Of Archades   |--------------------
                      -------------------------------------              sep033

Lot of shops are around, and now the item shop is start selling X-potion,
you better purchase some of it for the next battle. Inside the last shop of
North-East section, you can buy the map from the moogle who looking at the
bookcase as well as the map for Tchita Uplands. Eastern area is Aerodrome/
Airship Terminal, and a Save Crystal is inside there.

Ok, if you've done the July The Female Spy event in Nalbina, now you can find
her in the magic shop, talk to her for your reward, Salamand Halcyon. It's a
treasure/loot to trade for the Arcutus (Atk +44) gun type weapon.

In South-West around the weapon/armor shop, talk to the taxi guard, Jules
appear again, pay him 2,500 gil. Now you need 9 Pinewood Chops/White Leafs for
the taxi/cab.

To get Pinewood Chop/White Leaf, you have to talk to the right pair of people.
When you speak to one of them, commit his/her tale and a sentence will appear
on the top left screen, now you have to find the appointed NPC and tell him/her
the tale. If you get it correctly, the Pinewood Chop/White Leaf awarded. In the
current section, Nilbasse, you could get 6 Pinewood Chops/White Leafs, go other
section for more, you can find 28 pair of people for Pinewood Chop/White Leaf.

Here is the list of NPC who give you the tale and who will receive the tale.
Note: You must talk to the NPC once only he/she show the address name.

Nilbasse section
  Determined Researcher --> Ex-Researcher
  Gentleman Onlooker --> Eager Crier
  Senior Researcher --> Failed Researcher
  Aspiring Starlet --> Eaded Star
  Worried Husband --> Materialistic Women
  Athletic Women --> Avid Reader

Molberry section
  Reminiscing Lady --> Family-minded Girl
  Daughter-in-Law --> Man from Giza
  Talented Woman --> Akademician
  Would be Judge --> Judge's Wife
  Avid Traveler --> Traveling Gentleman
  Ardent Women --> Ardent Man
  Poor Husband --> Poor Wife
  Proud Mother --> Tutor
  Look-alike --> Look-alike

Rienna section
  Philosopher of Cuisine --> Dangerous Chef
  Lazy Profiteer --> Researcher's Wife
  Green Seller --> Vegetable Seller
  Good Brother --> Waiting Women
  Tarot Reader --> Happy Nolist
  Tour Leader --> Bhujerba Lady
  Lucky Man --> Romantic Lady

Trant section
  Music Appreciator --> Lutenist
  Smitten Man --> Smitten Women
  Farce-Goer --> Girl on an Errand
  Boutiquere --> Moneyed Gentleman
  Historian --> Perceptive Man
  Builder --> Artisan Architect

After collecting 9 Pinewood Chops/White Leafs or more, speak with that taxi
guard again to go other section. If you get all 28 of it, go any shop and trade
them to Chopmaster for the Sandalwood Chop, which use as the entry key for the
Terrace section at North, there's a part of 80 Rare Monsters hunting and the
Cockatrice Find side quests. So if you've decided to clear these side quests
later, is better you get all 28 Pinewood Chop/White Leaf now, and do forget
to trade for the Sandalwood Chop.

From here, go South for Gate Crystal, go North for an event. Back to around
taxi station, Jules once again appears. After that, talk to taxi guard and
choose second location, watch a scene.

First, move to North through the left passage, there is an elevator, check on
the panel and choose 67 floor.

67 floor, head to North-East to trigger a scene. After that, obtain the map
and Lab Access Card. Before moving on, enter to room 04 to find Save Crystal,
then enter to room 03 beside, check and change the Bulkhead controls.

Inside room 11 at South-West can find some treasure, but you have to play with
this blue/red Bulkhead controls puzzle to get to there. After all back to
elevator, now go 68 floor.

68 floor, move to room 03 around East, change the Bulkhead controls to blue.
Go to other side, enter to room 04 and change the Bulkhead controls to red.
Now you can reach room 11 in South-West passage, go there and change Bulkhead
controls to blue colour again, then move to the other elevator in central South
passage, choose 70 floor to leave here. Enemies are unlimited spawning, just
avoid to fight them if unnecessary, but if you can't handle them well, you do
have to fight even more for leveling up before you head up for the boss battle,
just save your game at 70F before back here to gain EXP.

Just to notify before you go to explore the whole area, inside the room 11 at
East hiding some Hecteyes enemies, they're stronge than other enemies and know
to send some badly statuses to your characters. Room 14 at East is hiding some
Lab-Rat, the quanlity of it was a problem. Room 13 at West is the Judge battle.
Do prepare your team before entering these rooms.

At 70F, enter the room 7002 at East for Hastega Mote or Pheasant Netsuke random
treasure. Once you've done, cast the support spells like Regen and Haste on
your team, save the game on the Save Crystal before run up stairs to face the
boss fight.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Dr. Cid                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 40         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 72989       - Hi-Potion        |   |   Recommended: > 40   |
  |   Weak : Holy      - Knot of Rust     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 38   |
  |   ELE. : Dark      - Potion           |   |   Average Lv : > 26   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Rook x4

  The Rooks can absorb your MP, so make a Mist Knack/Quickening before your MP
  gone, make sure it's the good combo. Set Gambit to heal ally with Hi-Potion,
  X-Potion is recommended if you have lot, if not, save it for later. Focus on
  destroying the Rooks before the boss, but becareful when the Rooks left two,
  they will shoot your team like crazy, so you better prepare your X-Potions.
  After all Rooks have been defeated, beware of the special move from the boss,
  sometimes he will just walking around without attacking, actually it was the
  sign to tell you the special move is coming, spend a turn to heal all your
  character if due. And do remember Dispel his supporting spells for the first.

After some scenes, your party came to this place. Some better items were

Eastern is the Airship Terminal/Aerodrome, and there's a Save Crystal inside.

from the man who's on the chocobo. The moogle near the tree selling the map for
this place and Cerobi Steppe. The path to North after the Gate Crystal leads to
Cerobi Steppe, it's an optional area, but you can hve some fights there if you
want.

Now you have to go Feywood, just use the Gate Crystal to the nearest place,
Golmore Jungle. From Golmore Jungle, move to South

When you just step inside here, make sure you had cast Libra, reason is there
was a trap which can send a large damage to all your characters at the entrance
of Golmore Jungle. The map for this area is located at the Walk of Stolen Truth
section.

North-East route leads to Paramina Rift, West route is to the inner side of
Henne Mines, you can't go further in the Henne Mines for now since the road
was blocked, but you can have a try to fight with one of the strongest enemies
of the game there, Abysteel. Make sure you've saved your game before go to this
place. By the way, the only Sve Crystal here is at the South. Get close to the
seal storm for a scene. After that, you're able to South. Before that, cast all
Haste, Regen to everyone.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Rafflesia               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 43         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 73393       - Putrid Liquid    |   |   Recommended: > 40   |
  |   Weak : Wind      - Screamroot       |   |   Minimum Lv : > 38   |
  |   ELE. : Earth     - X-Potion         |   |   Average Lv : > 28   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Malboros

  It's a MP decrease handicap, means your MP will be decreasing overtime.
  Set Gambit to heal ally with items, and cast Dispel on the boss at the
  beginning of the battle. When you're able to use Mist Knack/Quickening,
  use them before your MP decreased lesser than a bar. Later, some Malboros
  will be spawned to help the boss, focus to kill them one by one. After the
  Malboro, the boss start sending some nasty statuses by the special move,
  prepare the items for the bad statuses especially Confuse. Another way is
  change your party to be one character to receive those bad statuses, then
  set out other characters to heal him/her immediately.

Continue to South, next section can find the map for here, don't forgot to take
it. Following section, you can see some Feywood Glyphes here, they're displayed
like a star shape in the map, for now only one of the them is activated, go on
to it and examine the Pattern on the only activating glyph.  By doing so, you
can see an illusion show on the side,  turn your camera view to find it, then
face to the illusion and forward to that direction, you will reach to the next
Feywood Glyph with the pattern. Examine the pattern on this glyph for the next
illusion, do the same thing to find the following Feywood Glyph. Keep on doing
this until you get to the next section.

Next section has some more Feywood Glyphes like previous area, just to the same
thing like before. Eventually the last illusion will direct you to the gate at
South-West corner, now summon out your Belias esper, then check on the door and
choose second option to open it. Before to the next area, have a look on the
area around, there's an random treasure with Ensanguined Shield would appear
here. From the direction of the gate at South-West, go forward and you will
see a trap is there, the Ensanguined Shield in on the trap if it does appear.

Anyway, this shield has highest evasion point (90), but it has auto Slow, Sap
and Poison statuses, seem to be a bad shield, but you can have a try on using
it when your character stats get to higher level. And here is the location,
again, it's random.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/en_shield.jpg

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Daedalus                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 42         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 65644       - Damascus Steel   |   |   Recommended: > 42   |
  |   Weak : Holy      - Dark Crystal     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 38   |

  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Cast Haste, Regen and Protect on your party before attack, but it's better
  you done all these jobs before trigger out the fight. The boss will use some
  elemental attacks, change the suitable equipment to block against them, like
  while he readies Ice elemental spell, equip Ice Shield to reduce the damage.
  When he left around 1/5 life bar, his combo attack like crazy, try perform
  Mist Knack/Quickening  to finish him off,  otherwise you have to spend some
  Phoenix Downs.  Another easy way is use the healing spell since it could be
  a damage on him, cast Curaga or Curaja may be even powerful than your normal
  attack. But it's better learn at least the level 2 Mist Knack/Quickening so
  that your do have more MP to cast healing spell as your attack move.

Afterwards, use the Way Stone to leave here. Next section, go down and push the
switch to unseal the road. Continue to down (South) for the next switch, beside
this, Mythril Golem is guarding, push the switch then run if you don't want to
fight them. Western most of the section would face two more Mythril Golem, the
looks like the end, but if you face North and run out, a hidden bridge will
appear, just cross it.

Next section, push the switch at central of South passage, North-East corner
and central South-West, is better don't fight the enemies in group, finish off
them one by one could save lot of strength. After all, head to the end of the
road, another hidden bridge appear when you run out to West.

After the scene, open the Bulwark Hemera in front, the Save Crystal is here
before the next Bulwark Hemera. Next section, the Gate if Fire, stay in central
of the long road, face East and run outside, the hidden bridge appears, just
follow it to the central for a boss battle, make sure Haste all your ally now.

  it when the Firaga being used, do remember you can find out what is going on
  from the information message on the top left screen. Regen or Esuna to cover
  Sap status if you don't have much of Remedy.

After defeating the boss, take the  Way Stone here to the next area.

some tries on it. After that, take the Way Stone VII. Next, you will see VI,
and from here can see three ways, one is where you came, another one is sealed,
follow the remaining way to find the switch, push it to unseal other way, then
cross over that way. 

Continue to down till the Way Stone V, use it warp to IV. From IV, go up to
end and push the switch there, but before you can get there, you can see some
Mom Bomb surrounding a treasure, and you do have a chance to get Holy Lance
from this treasure, but it's random, since most of the later enemies are weak
against Holy, so I recommend back here to have some tries if you didn't get
the Holy Lance. After pusing the switch, back to IV and go down to other way,
push the one in the middle, then continue to next way will see III. From here
if you go up will get back to IV, but you don't need to go there. Now just take
the Way Stone III to next area to trigger a scene.

Now appear in II, go down and you will see Way Stone I and the Save Crystal,
save your game here. Take the Way Stone I back to Ancient City, then open the
Bulwark Hemera in front for the next boss battle, cast all support spells on
your party before entering the battle.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Shemhazai               |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 45         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 91136       - Hi-Ether         |   |   Recommended: > 45   |
  |   Weak : Random    - High Arcana      |   |   Minimum Lv : > 40   |
  |   ELE. : Soul      - Sagittarius Gem  |   |   Average Lv : > 30   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Dispel her Haste for the first. The esper can absorb all elemental spells,
  but only when she changed, better pay attention on her elemental weakness
  change if you going to use magic.  The esper will absorb your MP randomly,
  so set a Gambit to use X-Potion as your sub healing action in case of your
  MP has been absorbed. Although you would get Silence status, but sometime
  you can avoid from your MP being absorbed,  from what I've noticed, this
  esper didn't absorb the MP from the character with  Silence, so when the
  character has regained some MP, cure the Silence to heal other. Shock and
  Flare could are very dangerous moves, prepare your Phoenix Down or Raise
  magic on the character who's spotted as the target. By the way, you could
  steal the Sagittarius Gem from this esper,  it's using to trade with the
  strongest bow, Sagittarius. Stealing one for now is better than you find
  this loot from other monsters,  if you decided to own the strongest bow
  easier.

After that, you gain Shemhazai Esper.

Next, open the wall to South, check the Way Stone there and choose the first
option, watch a scene. After getting Treaty-Blade, check the same Way Stone,
now it should became Tellurian Way Stone, use it to return to the first area.
Take the Gate Crystal to return Port At Balfonheim.

                         ------------------------------
-------------------------|   The Port At Balfonheim   |------------------------
                         ------------------------------

Move to South-West, talk to the Manse Watch and choose to enter the Manse.
Reddas join as guest character. After the scene with Rikken, Raz and Elza,
head to the Airship Terminal/Aerodrome in the Eastern section, use the private
airship to your next destination, The Ridorana Cataract, it's located at the
South-West side on the world map, but don't forgot to restore your item stock
and buy the suitable equipment before moving. You must purchase some Vaccine
for the next esper fight, otherwise it would become the worst fight ever.

Also buy the Arise white magic for now, it's just became available right after
Giruvegan. Another thing is Rose Carsage accessory, it has immune to Silence
ability, which is recommended for the next fight as well, go find two or three
for your party.

Althought you got some helps from Reddas, but the enemies still weren't that
easy, also make a Libra on your own, reason is to avoid from the traps were
set around. South-East is a round area, there are lot of traps in the middle,
search the corner of North-West can find the map in the statue/urn.

Move on to North-East, there is another Save Crystal, beside it got a row of
traps, beware of them. Cast Haste, Protect, Regen on your party, then use the
Save Crystal, go up the staircase to East after saving your game.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                 Hydro                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 47         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 203800      - Corpse Fly       |   |   Recommended: > 47   |
  |   Weak : Holy      - Maggoty Flesh    |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : Dark      - Wyrm Bone        |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  First of all, use Dispel to stop his Haste, and you can even Slow him down.
  Once he get slowed, he would be slow for the entire battle, so be sure you
  had successfully send him Slow status as early as possible. Hydro can send
  you Sap, Disease and more bad statuses, and his tail has Poison touch, so
  prepare the items or  Esuna  to cure these statuses.  Use your Mist Knack/
  Quickening before it has hit away your MP, just make sure you have enough
  of healing items after you spent your MP.  Set one character stay behind
  for healing and support the spells when necessary. Hydro is like Daedalus,
  the boss that you fought in Giruvegan, you can use healing spell to deal
  damage on him, but only do this if you have enough of MP, otherwise you
  better save the healing spells for your own teeam.

After defeating the boss, get close to the entrane to trigger a scene, then
will enter the pharos automatically.

                              --------------------

01F, in front on a Way Stone, left hand side can find the Gate Crystal. Search
the Southern corner for the statue/urn, hit it for the map.

In this floor, you have to activate three Black Altars here before you can
enter to the East room, each altar require one black orb/pearl for activation.
To get the black pearls, go kill the enemies around, the orb/pearl appears as
blue colour from certain enemies, check it to obtain. Of cause ou could get
more than three black pearls for collection.

Once you have done, examine all altars one by one and choose second option to
activate them. All altars are around the circle area but in different part, so
you must go through each section to find them. After all, enter to East room.
In the room, your will appear in a desert, find the further rock here and close
to it, it's a boss.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |             Pandaemonium              |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 45         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 116678      - Ancient          |   |   Recommended: > 47   |
  |   Weak : Wind        Turtle Shell     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : Earth     - Aries Gem        |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Cast Dispel to stop its Protect and Shell at the start, then attack with
  your weapon. When the boss down to 50% life, it will build up the barrier,
  and now you can't hurt it,  just wait awhile until the barrier gone. Cure
  your characters from negative status especially Blind, because your weapon
  should be the main attacker for this boss.  When the boss readies for the
  Stone Gaze, move a character further from it, at least one of them is free
  from Petrifying status. If your magic power high enough, you can try the
  wind elemental spell. Anyway, this boss is easier than Hydro, I believe
  you will not have problem in this battle.

After that, leave the room and head back to main hall, use the Way Stone
near the entrance which is not avalable before.

10F, go up will see two Brainpan enemies, you must defeat them to form the 
bridge. Defeat more Brainpan to form up all blocks of the bridges for this
section. Before up to the next section, you can see an empty space lead to a
treasure in 26F, the treasure probably is a Holy Rod, but you could get there,
just leave it for now, if you really want it, back here after solving the
bridges for upper floors.

28F, same as below, defeat Brainpan and move on, if you can't get enough of it,
just run around to find them, they will spawn in the same places. At 35F, you
can see some empty space which leads to a treasure like 26F, but killing the
Brainpan couldn't form the bridge to the treasure. Assuming you've found some
enemies like Brainpan but in red, that's Deidar. To form the treasure bridge,
you must defeat the Deidar, and you can search them here and the section above.
Defeat all of them to build up the bridges in 35F treasure as well as the inner
treasure there, you will get Duel Mask from the first treasure, and either
Zeus Mace or Muramasa from the inner treasure.

Other Deidar will probably spawn at 31F, 32F, 35F, 36F randomly. The last one
with Aeronite should be Vishno, it's actually a rare monster (No.44). It has
lot of HP and powerful magic, better take down the Aeronite before you trigger
out its detection. And the rare drop of Vishno is Ribbon!

NOTE : Killing the Deidar is unnecessary if you don't want the treasure.

Continue to upper levels, open the door to next area, and here can find the
Save Crystal. Go South-West, run up the stairs and open the door to 49F. In
the next door, choose second option to get in, also cast all support spells
on your party.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                 Slyt                  |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 47         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 92661       - Pisces Gem       |   |   Recommended: > 47   |
  |   Weak : Fire      - Yensa Fin        |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : Water     - Yensa Scale      |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  It has Regen support, don't bother to Dispel it since it would recast it
  in a second. Recommend two or three character with shield, and Gauntlets
  equipment for them. The speed of the boss attack is very fast, and the boss
  probably kill your ally  instantly  by the combo attacks, better prepare a
  Gambit to heal with X-Potion. Use Fire elemental spell if your magic power
  is good.

After the battle, open the door in front and then use the Way Stone in the
end to next section.

60F, you can see four doors around the circle area, each door seals an ability.
The door to North-West seals magic, South-West seals normal attack, South-East
seals mini map, North-East seals items. You're goinf to face some enemies and
lately a boss, make your best choise for now, I recommend chose the mini map
or item sealing is easier. After your decision, examine the altar in front the
door to open it.

Before that, you now can back to 26F for the Holy Rod if you want, but remember
you have to back here through the way that you came. If you head back to bottom
floor through the Way Stone, at 01F, use it again to reach 10F, then run back
to 26F, now more Deidar should be spawned around there, kill all Deidar to
form the bridge, some of the them would appears above than 26F. The Holy Rod
isn't that powerful, but it has Holy strike which made it powerful against lot
of monsters. Again, if you don't want to spend time on it, don't return to the
bottom floor anymore.

Back to where you were,
61F, just reach South-West corner to next floor.
62F, the stair to above in South-East corner.
63F, move to North-West, hit the wall there will see the passage to next floor.
64F, a Save Crystal here, the way to following level at South-West.
65F, go forward to the door, choose second option to enter.

If you have got the Bio, Sleep spells and your characters had lot of MP
(learn Mist Knack/Quickening Lv 2 or above), there's an easy way for the
next boss, kill Reddas for now and don't revive him. Also make sure to cast
all support spells on your team before entering the fight.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                Fenrir                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 49         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 189992      - Beastlord Hide   |   |   Recommended: > 48   |
  |   Weak : Earth     - Beastlord Horn   |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : Wind      - Behemoth Steak   |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  First of all, cast Dispel again before attack. If you've done the tactic as 
  mentioned in the paragraph above, cast Sleep to Fenrir as soon as the battle
  has began.  Once he's fell to sleep,  attack him with only Bio. That is why
  you must KO'd off Reddas so that he wouldn't attack the boss, which mean the
  boss will just lying in Sleep. Just attack as much Bio as you can, send him
  Sleep again when he has awaken. But without this tactic, he's still no a hard
  boss, just don't let your character KO. Recommend equip shield, normally you
  can block some attacks from the boss. If you've took the Holy Rod, now is the
  time to show it. The boss has great attack power, so put on a Protect on your
  party, of cause you do need a Haste for more advantages. When Fenrir readies
  to perform Ice Break, equip Ice Shield to reduce the damage, change back the
  equipments that were you using before.

Now continue the passage to reach 66F. At 66F, examine the altar which you
choose at 60F, the Dais of Ascendence comes up. Now remember the altar's
colour that you have selected to unseal the Dais of Ascendence, it has some
connections with the Way Stone in 86F. Just do remember the last altar colour
that you select for unsealing the ascendence, if you don't want to know how's
this be affected on the 86F, just read the next paragraph. Let say you choose
the item seal in the 60F which is yellow, at 66F you unseal with the same altar
which is also yellow, so yellow is the one would be affected at 88F. But after
unsealing with yellow, you go and touch the other altar, let say the purple
altar, so now the affected colour at 86F has became the purple.

Take the Dais of Ascendence to the next floor. 67F, a Save Crystal is here.
Check the Way Stone in the central to next section. Again, make sure you have
some Vaccine and Arise white magic for the next esper fight, if you don't have
them, warp back to Balfonheim and purchase them.

                              --------------------
------------------------------|   Third Ascent   |-----------------------------
                              --------------------

O --- Enemy/Monster --- O

  Aeronite            Cataract Aevis        Dead Bones

   Weak : Thunder      Weak : Thunder        Weak : Holy
   Drop/Steal          Drop/Steal            Drop/Steal
    - Dragon Helm       - Caldera             - Ancient Bone
    - Ice Crystal       - Charger Barding     - Blood-darkened Bone
    - Leo Gem           - Holy Mote           - Dark Crystal
    - Wyvern Fang       - Ice Crystal         - Eye Drops
    - Wyvern Wing       - Pebble              - Golden Skullcap

  Necrofiend           Purobolos            Zombie Warlock
   Lv : 48-49           Lv : 49-50           Lv : 48-50
   HP : 12709-12889     HP : 9531-9691       HP : 7598-7958
   Weak : Holy          Weak : Holy          Weak : Holy
   Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal           Drop/Steal

This section, you must choose the right medallion only were you able to reach
the upper level, if you took the wrong one, either you will be warped back to
the previous area or 79F. The monsters in 79F are very annoying, you might need
alot of time and items for this fight, and you have to defeat certain amount of
these monsters to unlock the ancient door. Just follow the steps below to
safely reach your destination.

80F, take the Black medallion/sigil
81F, head to South-East, you're able to hit the wall (Fool's Facade), just hit
  it away run into the secret area, inside there was a Green medallion, use it
  to 83F. On the secret area way to Green medallion, a random treasure with
  Rubber Suit might appear, but beware of traps.
83F, evade some traps here. Go hit the wall to outside, take the Red medallion.
84F, make sure you take the treasure behind that two Aeronites, it's Circlet,
  which quite a good helm equipment for your current level. Remember the last
  colour that were you unsealed in the second ascent? Now you have to take the
  same colour with that altar, let say you had unseal it with the Purple altar,
  now you must take the Purple medallion, if you unsealed with Yellow, now you
  must take the Yellow medallion and so on.
86F, go North and hit the wall there, inside there can find a medallion, use
  it to upper level.
88F, get ready to the fight? If not, you can use the only medallion here to
  return 79F. If you had follow these steps above, you won't get trapped in 
  the 79F, which means you won't get the map for this section. Now use the
  White medallion to 79F for the map, however, you don't need to face any
  enemies at 79F by doing so. After taking the map, use the White medallion
  at the back of 79F to return this level. Once you have done, go take the 
  Dais of Ascendence to 90F.

**NOTE: 1. Recommended level up to 50 for the next battles (4 bosses await!).
        2. There's not save point in Third Ascent before the fight at 90F, if
           you're going to level up some more, get back to the Save Crystal
           in Second Ascent or First Ascent. Thanks to Tyler Cooper.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                Hashmal                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 50         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 209060      - Hi-Ether         |   |   Recommended: > 48   |
  |   Weak : Wind      - High Arcanal     |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : Earth     - Leo Gem          |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Make use you have set your Gambit to heal Disease with Vaccine. Dispel his
  Protect and Haste whenever he casts.  You can try use Bio spell on him if
  you have it.  Use Arise for the KO'd character, but if that character got
  Disease status,  needless to say, just use Phoenix Down to revive him/her.
  The boss can also send you Slow effect from his Quakeja, equip Slow proof
  accessory for if you have it, or just use Haste to recover it. Better stop
  attack when the Quakeja it's ready,  start recast Haste and Curaja, if you
  done it faster enough, your party would be recovered before Hashmal perform
  the next attack. Another way is use Float, I think it should be the easier
  way to face against Quakeja; with Float status supports your team, Hashmal
  will probably miss his Quakeja. When his HP down to 20%, he will build the
  full barrier which block all attack and magic, while waiting the barrier
  gone, heal and cure your characters, prepare to finish off him after his
  barrier gone.

Esper Hashmalim added after this fight.

Now you appear in 90F, run up to 92F to watch some events. After that, head up
to 98F for Save Crystal, you're going for some tough fights, make sure cast all
the support spells on your team and save your game here. Continue the way, use
the Way Stone in the end to watch some scenes. 


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Gabranth                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 47         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 64094       - Hi-Potion        |   |   Recommended: > 48   |
  |   Weak : -         - Potion           |   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
  |   ELE. : -         - X-Potion         |   |   Average Lv : > 32   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  This is quite easy, cast Dispel at the beginning of the battle before
  anything. Just use the normal attacks to take him down. He has a move
  is quite powerful, but on one target only. You can use a Bucchus's Wine
  one a character to speed up the process. The next fight was the real!


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=====================================O====================================O
  |               Dr. Cid               |               Famfrit              |
  O=====================================O====================================O
  |  Lv : 50       Possible Steal:      |   Lv : 52       Possible Steal:    |
  |  HP : 92093     - Hi-Potion         |   HP : 149060    - Aquarius Gem    |
  |  Weak : Holy    - Ketu Board        |   Weak : Fire    - Elixir          |
  |  ELE. : Dark    - Magepower Shishak |   ELE. : Water   - High Arcana     |
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

                            .--- Lv to challenge ---.
                            |   Recommended: > 52   |
                            |   Minimum Lv : > 48   |
                            |   Average Lv : > 35   |
                            '-----------------------'

  Equip all character with Rose Carsage for this battle, if you don't have
  three, make sure spend a Gambit slot to heal Silence. First of all, Dispel
  all support spells of Dr. Cid, recast Haste on your party when necessary.

  After taken down Dr. Cid's HP to half,  he will summon an esper, Famfrit.
  Now you can't hurt him, but he still attacking you, you better focus on his
  esper first, take it down as soon as possible only will you able to fight
  Dr. Cid again. His esper is around 160,000 HP, not kidding, it was a long
  battle, make sure you heal your character all the time, watch out for the
  Wateraja which deals around 1,000 damage to all your characters, if you got
  any other equipments with good Magic Resist point, change it to block the
  Wateraja, another good example is Shell Shield. Also Dispel his esper when
  he casts any support spell to it. Fire elemental deals slightly more damege
  to the esper since it's belong to Water element. If you don't think you will
  use much on magic attack, just ignore if he's only cast Shell on the esper.
  Anyway, normal attack can be more useful than magic attack. Sometimes after
  Wateraja, you would get chained attack by Cid's stupid firearm move, and you
  party might ended by this combo, so you must keep your party over 50%/1500HP
  anytime before their combination moves. After finish off the esper, focus to
  your main target, becareful his special attack which can damage all your
  characters.

One more Esper, Famfrit added on License board, after this battle,
and the game allows you to save here.

                         ------------------------------
-------------------------|   The Port At Balfonheim   |------------------------
                         ------------------------------

The last upgrade of the shop before you move for the final stage, of cause
buy the better equipments and restore your recovery items as well. Buy the
Flare (black magic) if you're not going for any other places for the side
quest, and make sure you buy Arise white magic if you haven't got it yet.
Teleport to Dalmasca Estersand and buy the Hastega.

If you're interesting with more side quests for the game, you can actually
start it from here. Once you enter the final stage, you're not able to return
anymore.

After some scenes, take either bulkhead to next area. Defeat some enemies in
the passage, but they're unlimited, so just keep running when you have the
chance of escape. Take the middle path from the junction to leave current area.
Next section, run down the circle area and cross it as soon as possible, only
kill the enemies who're really blocking your way. Reach to the elevator area,
examine the panel for a scene.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |               Gabranth                |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 49         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 70719       - Elixir           |   |   Recommended: > 52   |
  |   Weak : -         - Hi-Potion        |   |   Minimum Lv : > 48   |
  |   ELE. : -         - X-Potion         |   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Cast Dispel to stop his Haste.  Not too tough,  just the physical attack
  battle. Cast Regen and Protect to your characters, use Bacchus's Wine of
  Barserk if you want, but don't use to all characters in once. When his HP
  is down to half, he will fully restore his HP and change a little fighting
  style, nothing much different actually, just leave an ally with a Gambit to
  heal when anyone down to 50% HP. You can send him Blind and Slow for easier
  the fight, but you should know this status effect will miss for sometimes.
  Also use the Expose/Armor Break skill if you have. Like some other bosses,
  when he's getting lesser HP, his chance of higher combo will be increased,
  you may need to prepare to revive your character.

After that, prepare for another boss fight, cast all support spells on your
party. Operate the panel when you have done.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |                 Vayne                 |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 47         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 64094       - Hi-Potion        |   |   Recommended: > 52   |
  |   Weak : -         - Potion           |   |   Minimum Lv : > 48   |
  |   ELE. : -         - X-Potion         |   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Larse will help healing your character, so you can just focus on attacking,
  but make sure to revive your ally if anyone is KO'd. Dispel the boss when he
  has any support spells. Of cause recast the support spells like Regen, Haste
  on your party.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              Vayne Novus              |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 53         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 104210      - nothing          |   |   Recommended: > 52   |
  |   Weak : -                            |   |   Minimum Lv : > 48   |
  |   ELE. : -                            |   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'
  **Sub Enemy: Sephira x5

  Again, Dispel the boss at the beginning.  You can see some flying weapons
  around, you actually can destroy all of them. Since the weapons are flying,
  you have to use range weapon or magic if you want to destroy them. Slow does
  work on the boss. Beware his special attack which can deal over 1,000 damage
  to the party, before he perform this move,  you can see the flying weapons
  will surrounding him. One way to kill him faster is use Expose/Armor Break
  and normal attack, Berserk a character if you want, be sure you heal this
  character.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<<  BOSS  >>~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  O=======================================O
  |              The Undying              |
  O=======================================O
  |   Lv : 55         Possible Steal:     |   .--- Lv to challenge ---.
  |   HP : 228299      - nothing          |   |   Recommended: > 52   |
  |   Weak : -                            |   |   Minimum Lv : > 48   |
  |   ELE. : -                            |   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
  -----------------------------------------   '-----------------------'

  Dispel his support spell first, also recast the support spells on your
  party characters, always build Haste on everyone. This is the final battle,
  no need to save your items anymore, use all the Elixir, Megalixir, X-potion
  to heal if necessory, use Gil Toss if your got gil remain, Gil Toss can send
  over 9,000 damage in each throw, 1 damage equal to 1 gil if you have lot of
  gils. Later, the boss will builds physical barrier or magic barrier randomly,
  pay attention on your attacks. Also use your Mist Knack/Quickening to chain
  a large damage, and make sure he's not in the physical barrier. Restore your
  MP with items or Charge and use the strongest spell when the physical attack
  barrier is builded.  If the boss in  magic and  physical barrier in the same
  same time, the only thing you can do is wait, same time heal and cure you
  character as well.

After this long battle, you have beaten the game, enjoy the ending.

Note:
 Consider an optional area, if you're only to the storyline, you would
 come to this area, but only pass the Gate Crystal section at the West.

 Sometimes, you need the sandstorm to find the Gnome Entite and the Ring Wyrm
 Mob/Mark Hunt. In case of need the sandstorm, you can simply go to North-East
 area, which is the liar of Earth Tyrant optional boss, just enter and exit
 that area to trigger the sandstorm. But if you have defeated Earth Tyrant,
 the sandstorm is no longer there, so you can only leave for other places
 and return this place later for the random sandstorm situation.

 So you better clear the Ring Wyrm hunting before go for the Earth Tyrant.
 As for the Gnome Entite, you need to find it for the Gnome Halcyon, which
 is one of the loot for Ultima Blade trading.

Note:
 Lot of equipments, items can be found here, here I only listed the
 rare item. Have some exercises here and you might be suprised to get
 certain treasures.

 Fomalhaut and Ribbon can be found in the Crossfield section, which is
 North of Save Crystal, but only if you equip Diamond Armlet, and the
 treasure is random.

 Venetian Shield is located in Crossfield as well, the treasure is around
 North-West, near the windmill No.7. Equip Diamond Armlet.

 Castellanos can be found either Crossfield (North from Save Crystal)
 or The Terraced Bank (South from Save Crystal). Equip Diamond Armlet.

 Another Fomalhaut is located at North-East section, which is The Northsward,
 equip Diamond Armlet and find it around the middle West area of the section.

 Grand Bolts is located at the North-West section, known as Old Elanise Road.
 If you enter from Crossfield, find the second treasure in the middle. Equip
 Diamond Armlet.

 Dragon Whisker can be found in the second section from Balfonheim, you must
 equip Diamond Armlet as well, and the treasure is random too.

 Other than the equipment treasures, you can get lot of gil potions from
 the treasure chests around, actually they are the replacement of equipment
 treasures.

 they will steal the items dropped by the other enemies. By the way, if you
 want them to be visible, you can cast a Reflect on a character and bounce
 off any spell when you're close to the invisible Bakamy. Once he has got
 damage, he will be visible.

 Lot of traps and each can probably bring a lot of pain, they're near the
 entrance from Salikawood. Recommend use Libra and Float spell on your party
 before exploring the area. A secret shop is selling some rare items, some
 are even not available in any other places.

 As for Zodiac Spear/Strongest Halberd, you can find it only if you didn't
 open some treasure chests in other area which are not suppose to be opened,
  - treasure in front of Old Dalan's place (Downtown/Lowtown).
  - treasure in Rabanastre Palace, right corner which is Elixir.
  - treasures in Nalbina Dungeon where you get back your equipments and map.
  - 16 treasure in Phon Coast.
 All this chests were mentioned in the Walkthrough, you will get this weapon
 here if you had follow the walkthrough useless you purposely open one of
 these treasure chest.

 Check this map for details.
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_nabudis.png

Note:
 To unlock the Site 3 Mines, you have to start the Antlion Mob/Mark mission,
 so that you would receive the Site 3 Key from the client of this hunt. To
 unlock the Site 11 Mines, clear the Antlion hunting, then go to Phon Coast
 Gate Crystal section where known as hunters' camp, the Site 11 Key is around
 the North-West area, near the two men. Really hard to find? Many people still
 asking me the location, here is the location, it's in the hunters' camp,

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/site11key.jpg

 In the area where you found Antlion, there's a random treasure contain the
 Fomalhaut, leave and return this place after hunting down Antlion. If you
 explore the whole mines, you can find a lot of treasure with Knot of Rust,
 these treasures might give you other item when you return this place in the
 different timing, and you might get lot of gils from just a single treasure.
 The strongest monsters of the place start from the Lasche Span, they are
 much more stronger than the monsters before, so prepare your team well.

 The rare monster Bombshell will appear in the Lasche Span, and it could
 drop the best Ninja Sword, Yagyuu Darkblade, make sure you don't miss it.
 If you didn't find Bombshell, exit and re-enter the Lasche Span.

Note:
 The hard point of this place was the quantity of monsters, you will always
 the monsters/enemies in a group. And if you're inside the hall (inner area),
 it's pretty hard to escape once the enemies emerged.

 To get lower level, you need to put certain amount of Black Orb on all
 four altars in the different corner, and the Black Orb can be found from
 the monster who're not in the circle area. When the Black Orb appear, you
 must close to it and examine it like how you get a treasure. However, if
 you leave the Black Orb, it will fly to certain points and will become a
 Massvie Black Orb. The number of Black Orb from the  Massive Black Orb is
 count as the total Black Orbs that you left x3.
   Example, you had left 3 Black Orbs to fly away,
   so the Massive Black Orb will become 6 Black Orbs.

- Check this map for the details of Subterra.
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_ridorana_subterra.png

 Here is the amount of Black Orb require on the altar (Pedestal of Night).
   B1F - South-West  6, South-East  3, North West  9, North-East 18
   B2F - South-West 18, South-East 15, North West  9, North-East 15
   B3F - South-West 12, South-East 27, North West 21, North-East 15

 As for treasure, there're actually more than the stuff listed above,
 here I just only show the rare and better items:
  - Dragon Whisker at B1F, the West treasure in South-West section.
  - Ultima Blade at B2F, inner of North-East section.
  - Venetian Shield at B2F, North-East section, right from the door.
  - Fomalhaut at B2F, inner South-East section.
  - Lordly Robes at B3F, inner of North-East section.
  - Circlet at B3F, inner of South-West section.
  - Dueling Mask at B3F, South-East section, the East corner.
  - Ribbon at B3F, inner of North-West section.
  ** they're random

 Must prepare Esuna/Esunaga and Remedies to challenge B3F/Abyssal, the
 Zombie Warlocks team up with Necrofiends will be very tough, they could
 send a lot of nasty statuses to all your characters, and they're not easy
 to beat. Try to obtain Ribbon and Excalibur before entering this place.

 hiding a lot of special treasure, check this map for the details.

http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_henne_secret.png

 The path from Feywood has been blocked, you can only unblock it by beating
 the secret Esper inside, Zodiac/Zodiark. Actually no save point in the secret
 areas, the only save point is the Gate Crystal at out there, which is also
 the only save point in the Henne Mines.

=|   7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game    []________________________________________/
 '=================================(  /
                                \_/~~'
 _____________________________________________________________________________
/-----------------------------------------------------------------------------\


Feel the main playthrough has less challenge? Now come to do some side quests,
you will encounter with some monsters even much more stronger than the final
boss in the story. Myself, start exploring the side quests after Pharos At
Ridorana.

7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-1. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-----------------O ----------------------------------------------------------
-O  Clan Centurio  O 
 O-----------------O                                                     [s7a1]

You can join as member anytimes before you move on to final stage in the game.
The Clan Headquarter is at the Northern Street in Rabanastre City, before you
can enter it, talk to the bangaa in front will be bought into Clan Headquarter.
Inside there. Talk to the moogle at upstair who named Monblanc to join the
clan. Reasons of joining the clan are:

- Get rewards from Monblanc when your clan rank increase.
- Get rewards from Monblanc after defeating certain bosses.
- Clan shop in Rabanastre Muthru Bazaar section, which sells something that
  you couldn't found from other normal shops. Things that were selling in the
  clan shop will be updated when your clan rank or level was increased.
- Get extra Mob Hunt/Mark Hunt missions from Monblanc.

Anyway, it's related to many other quests, recommanded join the clan. You can
join it anytime, as long as you don't enter to the final stage. You could still
get the same rewards no matter when were you joined the clan.

Here is the list of rewards of clan level and clan shop.
For the details of Mob Hunt/Mark Hunt, check the "Mob Hunt" section below.
*It's call Mark Hunt for the US version.

7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-2. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O--------------O -------------------------------------------------------------
-O   Mob Hunt   O 
 O--------------O                                                        [s7a2]

Named Mark Hunt for US version.

To start the Mob Hunt missions, go check on the bulletin board in different
towns, exsample like the inn in Rabanastre City, the inn of Bhujerba Skycity,
the board at Phon Coast and so on. After that you have to speak with the client
of that mission to start it, the location of client will display as exclamation
mark in the map screen. If you forgot, just open up your "Mob List/Hunt" under
"Clan Report/Clan Primer", select the mob which you want to start, then press
"Square" button to check your client's location. Speak with your client after
finishing the mission for reward.

Certain missions below will only exist from Clan Headquarter in Rabanastre,
you must join as Clan Centurio member first. From more detail, read the
"Clan Centurio" section above.

Going through the mob hunt, you will obtain many rare items and best equipment,
also face the most difficult enemies in the game. You can find your mob list
under "Clan Report/Clan Primer" in Party Menu.

For Japanese version, the missions ranked as E, D, C, B, A...,
as opposed to US version, which ranked as I, II, III, IV.....

     -------------
     | Ranking   |
     |-----------| 
     | E  = I    |      ** The strategies for each mob were found
     | D  = II   |         useful by myself, doesn't mean they're
     | C  = III  |         the best or perfect way to beat certain
     | B  = IV   |         mobs especially those who're  stronger.
     | A  = V    |         Anyway,  I'll explain in depth for the
     | S  = VI   |         stronger mobs,  and may you to discover
     | H  = VII  |         better strategy by yourself if you don't
     | X  = VIII |         like my strategies.
     -------------

  (start from E rank)

 unless you have over 1000 HP.

~|  Little Love on the Big Plains  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ===========================================
 -<<  Cluckatrice  >>-|-<<  Chickatrice  >>-  ( Niwatoris for JP version )
 =========================================== Location : 
 |  Lv : 15           |  Lv : 8            |   Giza Plains (dry season)
 |  HP : 7509         |  HP : 3067         |   Gizas North Bank.
 |  Weak : Earth      |  Weak : Earth      |
 |  Possible Steal:   |  Possible Steal:   | Client : 
 |   - Wind Stone     |   - Large Feather  |   Dania, Giza Plains/Nomad Village
 |   - Small Feather  |   - Small Feather  |   women in the stable.(dry season)
 |   - Taurus Gem     |   - Potion         |
 |--------------------|--------------------| Reward : 
 | LP gain    : 6     | LP gain    : 1     |  - 1,000 gil

 -------------------------------------------  - Rainbow Egg x1

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 15   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 12   :
 :   Average Lv : > 12   :
 '-----------------------'

 Prepare some Hi-Potions and Gold Needles,  you will need these items for
 this fight.  Kill everything in the North Bank (North-East section), exit
 and return to find them.  Can say they're the toughest hunt of this rank,
 recommend your main team characters are over level 15. When you return to
 this section after clearing the monsters, you will probably see Chickatrice
 alone. If you have Disable spell (buy from Rabanastre), try send it at the
 beginning, if it's missed, exit and re-enter for another try. Needless to
 say, you should defeat them one by one, attack as much as possible before
 the Cluckatrice has detected your location. It's easier when Lamont/Larsa
 is in you team.

 statuses at the beginning.

 with this weapon. If you successfully sent Blind, Silence and Slow to this
 mob, you should have no problem to defeat it. Or you can summon Belias to
 fight since it's weak against fire.

 case of need. As for Doom, you probably kill it before countdown reaches
 to 0. If you like to use Mist Knack/Quickening, be sure you use it earlier
 since this mob would hit your MP away. As for status, you can try Blind and
 Silence, it will use magic attack when it gets close to death.

 This mob only appear during the sand storm. Lot of HP but not that tough,
 the problem is Ring Wyrm can restore its HP, so even if it couldn't beat
 your team easily, but you still need to have enough power to kill it as
 well. Recommend fight this mob when your main team characters are above
 level 30. First of all, kill off the enemies around, just to avoid them
 from bothering this long battle. Since Ring Wyrm mostly use its normal
 attack, and seems to focus on one target normally, so other characters
 can support and heal, also means Blind works well for your advantage,
 cast Protect spell on your characters as well.

~|  Befoulment of the Beast  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =============================
 ---<<  Feral Retriever  >>---   ( Chopper for JP version )
 =============================  Location : 
 |   Lv : 28                 |    Paramina Rift/ Spine of the Icewyrm,
 |   HP : 22559              |    found near the entrance from Save Crystal.
 |   Weak : Earth            |
 |   Possible Steal:         |  Client : 
 |    - Pebble               |    Hymms, near the Bur Omisace Gate Crystal,
 |    - Prime Pelt           |    man in blue shirt beside chocobo.
 |    - Quality Pelt         |
 |---------------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 14           |   - 1,500 gil
 | Clan Point : 1820         |   - Recurve Crossbow x1
 -----------------------------   - Teleport Stone x1

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 30   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 23   :
 :   Average Lv : > 18   :
 '-----------------------'

 Must prepare Esuna white magic and Haste is recommended as well. Set Gambit
 for curing negative statuses with Esuna, also prepare Echo Herbs to cure the
 healer in case if he/she got Silence. There's a dangerous move from this mob
 when it's low HP, Balance. This spell deals damage according to the different
 of caster's max HP and remaining HP, let say if it cast Balance when it left
 2559 HP, and its max HP is 22559, so the result would be 20000 damage! And
 the amount of damage send to all targets in the area. Either you have to use
 Mist Knack/Quickening to finish it off before it casts Balance, or sacrifice
 a character to close combat, and other two characters stay in a distance with
 range weapon attack, so the Balance would on damage on the close combat ally.
 Make sure to revive as soon as the Balance has been casted.

 until you get the heavy rain, Gil Snapper/Gilgame should be there. Dispel on
 the first, then follow with Blind, Silence and Slow to this mob, and you can
 beat it easier. Back to your client duing dry season, she's in the central
 camp section (Nomad Village) of Giza Plains.

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 35   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 30   :
 :   Average Lv : > 25   :
 '-----------------------'

 You must learn more support spells like Haste, Esuna, Curaja and more, of
 cause better you have all of them, the most important is Dispel white magic.
 Without Esuna, you have to get some Remedies to cure some negative statuses
 especially Stop (can be cured with Chronos Tear).  Head to the Phase 1 Dig,
 you should spot it around the South of this part when your leader character
 is full MP, kill all monsters around before trigger out the fight with this
 mob. Dispel him when the support spells were build. Once Mindflayer has taken
 enough of damage, he will restore HP with lot of positive statuses, now Dispel
 him again before cnotinue the fight. Another way is send Berserk and Blind to
 this mob, so it will only keep on missing on its attack, and you can defeat
 it without worrying much.

 send you Berserk status, I don't get what's the meaning, but it's better if
 Braegh really does it.

 back here later and hopefully it changes to be easier.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  A Tingling Toast  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ======================
 ---<<  Marilith  >>---
 ======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 38           |    Zertinan Cavern/ Invitation to Heresy
 |  HP : 54921        |    North-East section of the cavern.
 |  Weak : Water      |
 |  Possible Steal:   |  Client : 
 |   - Fire Crystal   |    Tavermaster, Rabanastre inside The Sandsea
 |   - Fire Stone     |    man behind the counter.
 |   - Prime          |
 |     Tanned Hide    |  Reward :
 |--------------------|   - 2,200 gil
 | LP gain    : 22    |   - Serpent Eye x1
 | Clan Point : 3610  |   - Teleport Stone x3
 ----------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 40   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 35   :
 :   Average Lv : > 30   :
 '-----------------------'

 Just enter from Dalmasca Westersand. First section, defeat all enemies
 and go South until the sunlight area (alot of light). If Marilith didn't
 show, wait there for awhile, then run around the area, make sure you don't
 leave the section while running around. Return to the sunlight area and get
 ready to fight, make sure you've killed all monsters. But I have a test for
 you before the fight, if you couldn't kill the Slime within 3 turns, forget
 about fighting with Marilith.

 Cast all useful support spells that you have before luring out Marilith.
 Send Blind and Slow to Marilith as soon as you spot it, you need a few try
 to reach your succession. If you have got Nihopalaoa accessory, just equip
 and throw a Remedy or Eye Drops to it, change back your accessory was using
 afterwards.  Not too hard since Marilith seems to focus on one target, keep
 on healing the character who's spotted by Marilith, heal him/her when HP down
 to 60%, because Marilith will always hit in a combo even with Blind, and it's
 ignore evasion. Do remember using item is always faster then casting spells,
 so prepare some X-Potions instead of using Curaga.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  The Deserter's Revenge  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 ---<<  Bloodwing  >>---
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 37            |    Barheim Passage/ West Annex,
 |  HP : 41171         |    East from Save Crystal, before Terminus No.7.
 |  Weak : Holy        |
 |  Possible Steal:    |  Client : 
 |   - Bat Fang        |    No.381, Dalmasca Estersand/ South Bank Camp,
 |   - Pebble          |    the blue bangaa around the beach.

 |---------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 24     |   - 2,400 gil
 | Clan Point : 2990   |   - Stun Bombs
 -----------------------   - Vampyr Fang

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 48   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 45   :
 :   Average Lv : > 33   :
 '-----------------------'

 Require Barheim Key before to return. Read "Back to Barheim Passage" section
 for more details. Holy Lance and Holy Rod are recommended weapon, Excalibur
 is much better. Telekinesis skill/technick is recommended as well, since you
 can handle the monsters here, you should had enough strength to visit Nabudis.
 Buy Telekinesis from the Necrohol of Nabudis secret shop after the event in
 Giruvegan and Crystal Grande/The Great Crystal. Learn and set it to attack
 the flying foes, otherwise, you need to spend MP on the magic, which is the
 slower way to defeat this mob. Prepare Rubber Suit for the undead enemies
 there,  if you got the Zodiac Escutcheon shield is much better since they
 immune to Thunder.

 Back to the West Annex section, take down the Dead Bones and Spectars whoever
 spawn. By using the Holy Lance, Holy Rod or Excalibur, and with Rubber Suit
 or Zodiac Escutcheon you should be fine. Recast Haste/Hastega, Bubble on the
 way, forward slowly until you get to Bloodwing. Attack it with Telekinesis
 or any stronger magic you have, equip range weapon for the character without
 Telekinesis of best magic, be sure you don't fight it with the Dead Bones and
 Spectars together.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Crime and Punishment  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 ----<<  Orthros  >>----
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 34            |    Garamsythe Waterway,
 |  HP : 87141         |    Southern Sluiceway.
 |  Weak : Fire        |
 |  Possible Steal:    |  Client : 
 |   - Caramel         |    Contrite Thief, Downtown/Lowtown in Rabanastre,

 -----------------------   - Unpurified Ether x1

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 38   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 35   :
 :   Average Lv : > 28   :
 '-----------------------'

 Something like the powered version of White Mousse. Before searching for
 this mob, prepare Smelling Salts, Gold Needles and Eye Drops. Recommend
 Argyle Armlet or Goggle Mask for preventing Blind status on your close
 combat ally since this mob like to send you Blind. For additional stuff,
 buy the Ardor black magic from the Barheim Passage shop after Ridorana
 event.

 This mob likes to see a team with only female characters, so change your
 team to be Fran, Ashe and Penelo BEFORE enter to this section, it's next to
 the section where you fought White Mousse. If the female characters are not
 your strongest team, just change it back after spawing. Set Gambit to heal
 Confuse status and put it on the top slot. Dispel Orthros as soon as you've
 done, make sure you have removed its Bravery. Equip Shell Shield to reduce
 its magic damage, change back your best equipment afterwards. If you have
 learned Ardor, send it to this mob randomly for more damage.

 don't bother to finding its weakness. Keep on your attack till Trickster's HP
 bar is down to around 15% HP, you can only damage it with non-elemental magic
 as mentioned above, (Flare, Scourge...).

 who was to close combat. Keep a character at the bak for casting Curaja and
 other support spells, Gambit set to Ally: HP < 70% = Curaja when Antlion is

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  A Dark Rumor  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 ---<<  Ba'Gamnon  >>---   ( titled as "Belito" )
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 49            |    Nam-Yensa Sandsea/ Withering Shores,
 |  HP : 115659        |    South from the central section, at the round area.
 |  Weak : Water       |
 |  Possible Steal:    |  Client : 
 |   - Dark Matter     |    Montblanc, Rabanastre Clan HQ.
 |   - Elixir          |    the person who gives you mob hunt mission.
 |---------------------|
 | LP gain    : 24     |  Reward :
 | Clan Point : 3420   |   - 5,100 gil
 -----------------------   - Megalixir x1

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 50   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 48   :
 :   Average Lv : > 33   :
 '-----------------------'

 Recommend find this mob after Pharos at Ridorana, your level should be ok.
 Clear Antlion (rank A/V) mission if you don't have a Bubble Belt, get one
 from you client as reward. Better you have all other useful magics such as
 Bubble, Hastega, Bravery and more prepared. For the black magic, I suggest
 Scourage, which can be found in the Balfonheim shop after Pharos at Ridorana.

 Once you've done, find the Zertinan Caverns in Ogir-Yensa/ Central Junction,
 and you will get to Zertinan Caverns/ Canopy of Clay.  Just go to the other
 exit of the section will reach to Nam-Yensa Sandsea, and there is the place
 to find this mob.  You opponents are Ba'Gamnon, Bwagi, Gijuk and Rinok, who
 were found in the Lhusu Mines earlier of the game,  and the Belito's stats
 shown above is actually the stats of Ba'Gamnon. Only two of them shown at
 the beginning, and the other two of them will join the battle after a short
 while. You can attack the visible enemies at the start, since Ba'Gamnon has
 the most HP here, just leave him for a moment, later cope all them in once
 with Dispelga when the other two has shown.  Afterwards, cast a Blindga on
 the group with Ba'Gamnon, Bwagi and Rinok, probably Gijuk will stay at the
 side and keep on using magic to damage your team, so just send him a Silence.
 Later on, cast Scourage to damage all of them in once and Sap status will be
 sent to them who hit by Scourage. Focus to defeat one of them after sending
 the negative statuses, cast Curaja when due, recommend heal when ally's HP
 down to 60%. Sometimes you do have to cure Silenca since you might get it
 from their attack.

 later, then return to Tchita Uplands from Cerobi Steppe, the weather will
 become cloudy.

 Try adjust your character's level not at even number (ex: 40, 42, 44..)

 of cause, Dispel him at the first before you send these statuses. Try on to
 close combat with this mob, reason is to avoid him from using Fireball, he'll
 miss alot since he has Blind status. Dispel him again when he has casted the
 Greater Barrier, which is to build Protect and Shell on his own. You need to
 spend most time on the late part, because of Lindwym will highly increase his
 defense power when he gets to death, but doesn't seems to increase his attack
 power, so just keep on going with you tactic till it goes down.

 Go South from Gate Crystal to The Slumbermead, then go through the hidden
 path around North-West of the area. Have some training before going to this
 section. Roblon himself isn't that strong, the problem is Dead Bones enemies
 spawning around, train your characters till you're able to handle all this
 Dead Bones that're spawning around Roblon area. Use Holy Lance or Holy Rod
 weapon to kill them faster, have Excalibur is much more easier. Clear all
 Dead Bones that're spawned around before triggering the fight with Roblon.

 Roblon use magic attack more than normal attack, and Silence doesn't work
 on him, so you need to have the equipments to increase Magic Resist point,
 or keep on changing equipments against his different magic uses, like equip
 Flame Shield when Roblon readies Fira, equip Rubber Suit when Roblon readies
 Thundara and so on. Also try to send Slow status to Roblon at the beginning.
 Some more Dead Bones might spawn again during the fight, recommend kill off
 the Dead Bones before continue the fight.

http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_nabudis.png

 Recommend train up your main team to level 50 or above, get some stronger
 equipments like Magepower Shishak,  Circlet,  Golden Skullcap or whatever

 start, so you can do a Reflectga on your team before it detects you. Make
 sure to have Opal Ring on your healer, who works as Hastega, Curaja, Arise
 caster (Bravery and Faith is optional). For those without Opal Ring, cast
 Darkja on your own team before the Reflect status gone, so Goliath will be
 damaged by triple Darkja. Keep on going until it goes for normal attack,
 now you should have to cast Protectga on your team, of cause recast other
 support spells when anyone of them gone.

 one by one. Later on, he might reduce your character's MP to 0, immediately

 your MP.
