 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  A Wild Stench  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ========================
 --<<  Wild Malboro  >>--
 ========================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 50             |    Feywood/ Redolent Glade,
 |  HP : 110842         |    South of Save Crystal, where you fought the boss.
 |  Weak : Wind         |
 |  Possible Steal:     |  Client : 
 |   - Foul Liquid      |    Rena, Eruyt Village/ The Spiritwood,
 |   - Malboro Flower   |    the viera in white.
 |   - Virgo Gem        |
 |----------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 28      |   - 4,600 gil
 | Clan Point : 4000    |   - Euclid's Sextant
 ------------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 45   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 40   :
 :   Average Lv : > 30   :
 '-----------------------'

 Have a Zwill Crossblade will be easier. Thought this mob with some Malboros
 around are weak against Wind, but I noticed the Oil + Ardor trick is still
 better to be used. Ensure you have Ardor black magic with all character on
 your main team, then Reflectga and Oil, Nihopalaoa is better since you can
 send Oil instantly by using this accessory. Have a healer with range weapon
 just to prepare for curing bad statuses in case of need.

 As mentioned, this mob stay with some Malboros, needless to say, you should
 defeat the Malboros one by one. Wild Malboro know to cast Renew randomly, so
 it's pretty hard to kill it before taken down the other Malboros. Dispel if
 they had positive status, have a Zwill Crossblade with support spells like
 Bravery and Haste, you should be fine. Down to only Wild Malboro, you can
 reduce its HP some more since it doesn't have much dangerous moves at the
 beginning. When it's down to 80% HP, build the Reflection on your team and
 send Oil to Wild Malboro, using Remedy to Wild Malboro with Nihopalaoa equip
 is recommended. Once it has got the Oil, cast Ardor on your own team, with
 the Reflect status, the Ardor will be bounced off the Wild Malboro.

 On my fight, I did 9999 damage for each hit of Ardor, and each Ardor does
 triple damage caused of three Reflections, each turn with three characters
 to cast Ardor, so the total damage will become (9999 x3) x3 =  89991. Even
 if your magic power isn't that stronge, but with the Oil status on this mob,
 your Ardor can still be very powerful. Just in case if you need to cast Esuna
 or other support spell, be sure you equip Opal Ring to the caster. Actually
 you don't even need to heal much if you have Bubble Belt equiped.

~|  Fishy Dreams  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 -----<<  Ixion  >>-----
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 58            |    Pharos at Ridorana, Subterra.
 |  HP : 306559/       |    Randomly appear in any Interior.
 |       166559        |
 |  Weak : Holy        |  Client : 
 |  Possible Steal:    |    Whitecap Wench, Port At Balfonheim/ The Whitecap,
 |   - Grimoire Aidhed |    the women in first counter.
 |   - Magick Lamp     |
 |   - Storm Crystal   |  Reward :
 |---------------------|   - 3,000 gil
 | LP gain    : 32     |   - Sapping Bolts x1
 | Clan Point : 5000   |   - Ragnarok x1
 -----------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 55   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 50   :
 :   Average Lv : > 38   :
 '-----------------------'

 If you found this mob at B1F Penumbra or B2F Umbra, it will show with
 306559 HP. If you found it at B3F Abyssal, it has only 166559 HP, but
 it has triple defense point. Recommend not to fight it at B3F.

 Before finding this mob, make sure you can handle the enemies in Subterra,
 if you failed this test, forgot about fighting with this mob. Also explore
 some more in the Subterra for some better equipments and get higher level.
 Ixion is weak on Holy, absorb Dark, but still likely to use Thunder though
 it's not belonged to Thunder/Lightning element. To make this battle easy,
 go find the Rubber Suit light armor or Zodiac Escutcheon shield, is better
 you get both of them. For weapon, find Excalibur from The Great Crystal,
 it deals great damage on this mob, since you can only have one Excalibur,
 so better you have more other stronger weapons like Deathbringer sword,
 Golden Axe, Zodiac Spear, Ultima Blade, and other 'easy found' ultimate
 weapons. make sure some Echo Herbs and Alarm Clocks in your inventory.
 Have a Gambit slot for  'Ally: Any/status=Sleep -> Alarm Clock'  set to
 everyone, so you don't need to worry of the Sleepga from Ixion which is
 very annoying.

 When the Interior area of any floor in Subterra has nothing (no enemies),
 that's mean Ixion is coming out, but sometimes it will take 1 minute or
 even more to appear, sometimes it just show a few second after running
 around the Interior area, it was random. Dispel it as soon as it's shown,
 equip Nihopalaoa and use Remedy to Ixion, the main statuses are actually
 Silence and Slow. Afterwards, make sure the Zodiac Esctcheon shield and
 the Rubber Suit are equiped to block take on its Thunder striking attack.
 Decoy the character with Zodiac Escutcheon of Rubber Suit, and Ixion will
 keep striking with no damage on this character.

 Recommend keep your healer away from the fight, reason is to use Esunaga
 to cure your allies from Curse. Another thing Ixion will hit your MP away
 later, either use Charge technick or Ether to restore some if necessary,
 trust you had already activated the MP gain by attack ability slot on the
 License Board you can just keep on attacking to get back some MP, meanwhile,
 use X-Potion to cure instead of white magics. Be sure you use the item and
 technique on the right timing, there's nothing hard to defeat this mob.
 Keep it Silence to avoid it from using Sleepga and Silencega.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  God or Devil?  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ======================
 --<<  Shadowseer  >>--  ( titled as "The Seer"; Darkness God for JP version )
 ======================
 |  Lv : 67           |  Location : 
 |  HP : 278078       |    Pharos at Ridorana,
 |  Weak : Holy       |    Bottom floor in Subterra known as 'Unknown'.
 |  Possible Steal:   |
 |   - Forbidden      |  Client : 
 |     Flesh          |    Montblanc, Rabanastre Clan HQ.
 |   - Foul Flesh     |
 |   - Maggoty Flesh  |  Reward : 
 |--------------------|   - 20,000 gil 
 | LP gain    : 6     |   - Megalixir x2
 | Clan Point : 6000  |
 ----------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 65   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 62   :
 :   Average Lv : > 40   :
 '-----------------------'

 I wonder why this mob listed as rank S/VI,  he's actually much stronger
 than many other ranked H/VII mobs. I recommend your main team characters
 are all over 65 level since I fought it at 64-65 level team is still tough.
 So leave this mob for a moment, go for other rank H/VII mobs before this.
 
== Preparatories ==

   Here are some recommended equipments:
     Excalibur, Masamune, Zodiac Spear, Whale Whisker, Golden Axe,
     Durandal, Fomalhaut, Perseus Bow/Artemis Bow, Valcano...
     Zodiac Esctcheon, Demon Shield, White Mask, Black Mask, Dueling Mask,
     Circlet, Golden Skullcap, Genji Helm, Brave Suit, Lordly Robes...
     Nihopalaoa, Sage's Ring, Bubble Belt, Ribbon, Genji Gloves...

   Well, almost all are the best equipments in the game, seriously you need
   most of them for this fight, but I'm not telling you to get all of them,
   just try to get as much as possible. However, most of them can be found
   in the Subterra, have some exercises in  Subterra  for these equipment,
   and you don't need to equip Diamond Armlet to obtain them.

 - Check this map for the details of Subterra:
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_ridorana_subterra.png

   For Excalibur, you can find it in the Crystal Grande/The Great Crystal, read
   the "11. Weapons" section for details. For Masamune, you can either trade it
   or clear the Gilgamesh rank H/VII mob, and it will become the reward of this
   mission. Also make sure you  steal  all Genji equipment  from Gilgamesh mob.
   As for magics and technick/skills, Curaja, Hastega, Esunaga, Arise, Bubble,
   Charge, Telekinesis are most important, make sure you have all them.

   Needless to say, you should learn all abilities slots on the top part
   of the Licenses Board to get your character to become stronger.

== Unlocking Subterra ===

   Return to Pharos at Ridorana, take the Dais of Ascendence at 1F to
   underground (B1F, Penumbra). Collect enough Black Orbs/Pearls by killing
   monsters and fill it to the Altars at four different corner to get to
   lower floors. Here is the require orbs of each floor.
     B1F - South-West  6, South-East  3, North West  9, North-East 18
     B2F - South-West 18, South-East 15, North West  9, North-East 15
     B3F - South-West 12, South-East 27, North West 21, North-East 15
     B4F - Battle~!

   Before you can reach B4F/Unknown, you have to defeat Phoenix optional boss
   at North of B1F/Penumbra. You can check Phoenix under "9. Optional Bosses"
   section for some details. Anyway, Dispel Phoenix at the beginning of the
   battle, then equip Nihopalaoa and use a Remedy to Phoenix, that's all you
   need to do, after this you can defeat it easily.

== The main target ==
 
 If you look carefully on the bill, you can actually see there's more than
 Shadowseer on the portrait, and the other opponents are Pandaemonium, Slyt,
 Fenrir and Phoenix, which are also the elite enemies in the Pharos. During
 the battle, all these Pharos elites will be summoned out one after one, no
 other to skip the fights, you have to defeat all of them again before you
 can defeat Shadowseer.

 At the beginning, Dispel Shadowseer before attack. He will probably cast
 Shinning Ray or Darkness to attack, just equip White Mask or Sage's Ring
 to absorb Shinning Ray and Black Mask or Demon Shield to absorb Darkness.
 When Shadowseer down to 75% HP, he will be invincible and start summoning
 the bosses that you fought before. Start from know, Shadowseer will also
 use many many annoying moves to attack you team. Nothing you can do other
 than defeat all four bosses that were summoned by Shadowseer.

 My Gambit setup for this fight (only show the important Gambits):
 ----------------------------------------
 | Character 1:  Fran                   | As mentioned before, you have to face
 |  1. Ally: Any       = Phoenix Down   | four bosses beside Shadowseer, so the
 |  2. Ally: Any       = Smelling Salts | Gambit setup here  is still has some 
 |  3. Self: MP < 10%  = Charge         | flaws,  so some actions you actually
 |  4. Ally: HP < 50%  = Curaja         | have to  use it manually  since the
 |  5. Ally: Any       = Bubble         | different strategy needed to be used
 |  6. Foe : flying    = Telekinesis    | against different boss.
 |  7. Foe : lowest HP = Attack         |
 |                                      | Do remember to cast Dispel to each
 | Character 2:  Ashe                   | of the bosses as soon as it has been
 |  1. Ally: Any       = Arise          | summoned, then following by Remedy
 |  2. Ally: Any       = Smelling Salts | with Nihopalaoa accessory equip.
 |  3. Self: MP < 10%  = Charge         |
 |  4. Ally: HP < 50%  = Curaja         | Make sure your healer has equiped
 |  5. Ally: Any       = Bubble         | Ribbon when Shadowseer readies the
 |  6. Ally: Any       = Hastega        | Curse.  You can actually cure your
 |  7. Ally: Any       = Eye Drops      | ally instantly right after they're
 |  8. Foe : flying    = Telekinesis    | cursed,  just cast Esunaga to your
 |  9. Foe : lowest HP = Attack         | ally when the Curse is almost sent,
 |                                      | means you have  to  calculate  the
 | Character 3:  Penelo (healer)        | timing. If you don't have  Ribbon,
 |  1. Ally: Any       = Arise          | make sure you healer is not in the
 |  2. Ally: HP < 20%  = X-Potion       | range of Curse, or else you will
 |  3. Ally: Any       = Esunaga        | get many bad statuses as bad as
 |  4. Ally: Any       = Remedy         | getting hit by allies (Confuse).
 |  5. Self: MP < 10%  = Charge         |
 |  6. Ally: Any       = Bubble         | Fenrir is a bit tough, I recommend
 |  7. Ally: HP < 60%  = Curaja         | equip a shield.  Since Sleep does
 |  8. Foe : flying    = Telekinesis    | work on Fenrir,  try only use non-
 |  9. Foe : lowest HP = Attack         | elemental magics to him after using
 ---------------------------------------- Remedy + Nihopalaoa trick.

 Another problem is Invert, which is to switch between you HP and MP from
 Shadowseer. He will probably use this after he has drained your MP, so once
 you get switched, your HP will be reduced to a few or even death. For safety
 a Gambit slot for X-Potion using is no a bad idea. Once you've successfully
 heal the switched character, he/she will be full of MP uses, cast Renew if
 you have it, probably your team has not much HP left when you get to this
 situation, Curaja instead if you don't have Renew.

 After defeating all bosses, Shadowseer seems has raised his stats, when he
 gets lesser HP, his defense power is even stronger, probably you can't deal
 over 1000 damage to him. Since now the Shadowseer is the only opponent left,
 plus Berserk and Bravery to your main attacker, and better you have Excalibur
 to end the battle faster, just make sure you always have a healer with range
 weapon to support.

 ----<<  Carrot  >>----

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 45   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 42   :
 :   Average Lv : > 30   :
 '-----------------------'

 If you got a Ribbon, this battle would become easy, so try get a Ribbon
 from the treasure in Cerobi Steppe/ Crossfield section with Diamond Armlet
 equip since there's the easier place. For more details of Ribbon, please
 read the "13. Accessories" section. Of cause you can still beat this mob
 without Ribbon, all you need is just a little battle tactic.

 Recommend your main team characters are level 45 or above, and learn all
 Lore of Remedy in the Licenses, also Esunaga is recommended too. Once you
 enter the Salikawood, don't attack anything before you see Carrot. A viera
 NPC will come for helps during the fight. Likewise, cast all support spells
 on you team before attacking Carrot.  The only difficult period is during
 Carrot in Critical status, her Putrid Breath can say is 100% accurated hit
 on the nearer targets, unlikely she will always miss the Putrid Breath at
 the beginning of the battle. Do remember the Putrid Breath sends many nasty
 statuses until you can't even take control of your characters, you have to
 avoid this happen.  What you can do is  always keep a character away from
 Carrot especially when she's in the Critical status, leave other characters
 to close combat. Once you see Carrot is readies Putrid Breath, cast Esunaga
 for the close combat characters since the breath can only hit on the nearer
 targets, the bad statuses will be cured instantly if you did it with the good
 timing, use Remedy instead if you missed casting Esunaga. Keep on doing this
 until you taken down this mob.

O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Visitor on Deck  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 ---<<  Deathgaze  >>---
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 50            |    Airship, on the deck.
 |  HP : 184000        |
 |  Weak : Earth       |  Client : 
 |  Possible Steal:    |    Traveler, any Aerodrome/Airship Terminal,
 |   - Charger Barding |    the boy with his family.
 |   - Emperor Scale   |
 |   - Phoenix Down    |  Reward :
 |---------------------|   - 3,400 gil
 | LP gain    : 28     |   - Elixir x2
 | Clan Point : 7560   |
 -----------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 50   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 45   :
 :   Average Lv : > 33   :
 '-----------------------'

 You have to find your client serveral times, talk to them everytime you
 found them in the different Aerodrome/Airship Terminal for more informations.
 Take the airship after each meeting with the client, when Deathgaze appears,
 you will get a different scene on the airship. Anyway, I found this mob at
 the flight from Archades to Rabanastre. Once it's shown, you must defeat it
 to leave the airship, so be prepared before taking the flight.

 Recommended level is 50-55, depends on your equipments. At the beginning,
 Deathgaze will put up the physical barrier, which means immune to normal
 attack,  so you don't need to use Bravery,  Berserk and such thing for a
 moment. The important statuses for the beginning are Haste, Faith, Regen
 and Protect, make sure you done these spells before triggering Deathgaze's
 detection. Dispel Deathgaze at the first turn, attack it with the strongest
 magic that you have, of cause heal your allies when necessary. Beware of
 its Crushing Fangs which might send Death on you character, Arise the KO
 character if this happened. For its Fireball, you can use Flame Shield to
 reduce the damage. Later Deathgaze will change its physical barrier to be
 magic barrier. Now start using Bravery instead of Faith status.

 Continue attack until Deathgaze down to Critical status, and it will heal
 itself, nevermind, just give it a chance, repeat the same things to reduce
 its HP until it puts Reverse on his own. After this stupid move, just send
 it Curaga or Curaja before its Reverse status gone. The Reverse will gone
 after a short while, be sure not to attack it during the Reverse status
 period. Deathgaze might rebuild the physical barrier instead of its magic
 barrier, so attack it with either normal attack of magic according to its
 status until it goes down. 

O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O ------------ O

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  The Child Snatcher  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ======================
 ---<<  Diabolos  >>---
 ======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 46           |    Lhusu Mines,
 |  HP : 93551        |    the Western end in Site 11.
 |  Weak : Water      |
 |  Possible Steal:   |  Client : 
 |   - Demon's Sigh   |    Miclio, Bhujerba SkyCity/ Miners' End,
 |   - Fire Crystal   |    the girl in blue, behind the gate.
 |   - Scorpio Gem    |
 |--------------------|  Reward : 
 | LP gain    : 27    |   - 2,600 gil
 | Clan Point : 3800  |   - Demon Shield x1
 ----------------------   - Zeus Mace x1

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 50   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 45   :
 :   Average Lv : > 33   :
 '-----------------------'

 Must clear Antlion (rank A/V) mission. Back to Phon Coast Gate Crystal
 area, go North-West can see two men there, check beside the sitting man
 can find Site 11 Key. With the key only you're able to start this mission.

-Here is the key location:
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/site11key.jpg

 This mob isn't that durable target (look at his HP), the difficulty is on
 his strength, that's mean he has great power stats for both normal attack
 and magic power.  Another thing is no Save Crystal around this place and
 the monsters are quite tough, you should be able to handle these monsters
 (Killer Mantis, Vampyr...) before going for this mob.  Hopefully you have
 done activating all 'HP+',  'Swiftness' (action time shorthen) abilities
 slots on the License Board,  also try to have two Bubble Belts and learn
 Bubble arcane magic and Bravery green magic. Of cause, other common spells
 like Hastega, Esuna, Curaja and more should be prepared as well.

 Needless to say, cast all support spells on your team before attacking.
 Always make sure your characters have Haste and Bubble status, have a
 Gambit to heal your ally at 50% HP, it's better heal at 60% HP if you
 have Sage's Ring to reduce MP cost  or you have enough MP to be spent.
 Send a character to close combat, the rest for support and cure. At the
 beginning has not much problem, but when Diabolos down to around 35% HP,
 his stats seem to be raised, and during Critical status is even stronger.
 Start using Berserk on your attack when Diabolos down to 40% HP, be sure
 Bravery, Regen, Protect and Haste are on the attacker as well. Reason to
 do so is to take down this mob faster before he has more chances to send
 you some massive damage. If you're worrying Diabolos attack other then
 your attacker/berserker, just cast a Decoy on him/her so you could only
 focus on your healing action. With one or two characters to only attack
 in a distance, you should be able the heal some bad statuses well.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Who's the Strongest!?  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =======================
 ---<<  Pylraster  >>---
 =======================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 63            |    Pharos at Ridorana,
 |  HP : 493513        |    in front of the entrance, where you fought Hydro.
 |  Weak : Fire        |
 |  Possible Steal:    |  Client : 
 |   - Hastega Mote    |    Rikken, Port At Balfonheim,
 |   - Tyrant Bone     |    South-West most. Beat him on racing once.
 |   - Tyrant Hide     |
 |---------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 36     |   - 8,000 gil
 | Clan Point : 12000  |   - Grand Mace x1
 -----------------------   - Scathe Mote x2

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 58   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 50   :
 :   Average Lv : > 40   :
 '-----------------------'

 Consider one of the top rank attacker if compare to other mobs, it deals
 tons of damage with its physical hit and special skills, also you might
 get Death attack from his special skill. Make sure you had good shield
 and armor to face this mob, as for the Death attack, nothing else other
 than base on your luck, also make sure you have Arise Gambit set or many
 Phoenix Down to revive your ally in case of need.

 Since you can stay a chance to block it, so find some shield with better
 evasion for close combat, learn all 'Shield Block' ability slots on the
 License Board.  Recommended shields are Demon Shield, Zodiac Escutcheon
 and Ensanguined Shield.  The easy way to get Demon Shield is the reward
 of Diabolos hunt, or you can buy it from Necrohol of Nabudis secret shop
 after Giruvegan.  Get Zodiac Escutcheon in Barheim Passage treasure, get
 Ensanguined Shield in Feywood or Henne Mines secret area.  Of cause there
 are few more way to obtain these shields, read "12. Shield & Armor" section
 for all details.

 If you have Ensanguined Shield, equip on the attacker and cast a Decoy on
 him/her.  Since this shield has some bad statuses, so don't depend much on
 this character as you main attacker. Send another character with good shield
 to close combat too, support and heal by using your healer behind, and equip
 a good range weapon for your healer as well.  Bubble all characters anytime,
 so even if Pylraster attack the character without Ensanguined Shield, he/she
 would able to survive after getting a hit. You can try cast Slow to this mob,
 but probably will miss a few turn, better have Nihoparaoa equip and throw a
 Remedy to Pylraster instantly inflict Slow to it, be sure Dispel initially
 when it has support status builded.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Battle on the Big Bridge  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
         ( first fight )
 ===============================
 -------<<  Gilgamesh  >>-------  ( titled as "Ancient Man of Mystery" )
 ===============================
 |  Lv : 45                    |  Location :

 |  Possible Steal:            |      West from the Gate Crystal.

 |   80~60% HP - Potion        |      South-West section known as Site 7.
 |   60~40% HP - X-Potion      |
 |  *40~20% HP - Genji Shield  |  Client : 
 |  *20~ 1% HP - Genji Gloves  |    Montblanc, Rabanastre Clan HQ.
 |-----------------------------|    the person who gives you mob hunt mission.
 | LP gain    : 55             |
 | Clan Point : 4000           |  Reward : 
 -------------------------------   - 10,000 gil
          (second fight)           - Masamune!!!
 ===============================
 -------<<  Gilgamesh  >>-------
 ===============================  *NOTE:
 |  Lv : 70                    |     The  Genji  equipments  can only be
 |  HP : 473246                |     obtained from this mob.  If you had
 |  Weak : -                   |     missed them, you're not able to find
 |  Possible Steal:            |     them anymore. So make sure you STEAL 
 |  100~80% HP - random        |     all of them in the appointed  period 
 |   80~60% HP - Hi-Potion     |     before defeated Gilgamesh.
 |   60~40% HP - X-Potion      |
 |  *40~20% HP - Genji Helm    |
 |  *20~ 1% HP - Genji Armor   |
 |-----------------------------|
 | LP gain    : 120            |
 | Clan Point : 6700           |
 -------------------------------

       (first fight)             (second fight)
 .--- Lv to challenge ---. .---- Lv to challenge ----.
 :   Recommended: > 48   : :  Recommended: 61/65/67  |
 :   Minimum Lv : > 40   : :  Minumum Lv : 53/55/59  |
 :   Average Lv : > 30   : :  Average Lv : > 42      |
 '-----------------------' '-------------------------'

 Before you can get to Site 7, back to Phon Coast Gate Crystal section,
 take the Site 11 key that's near the two men around North-West. And you
 must clear Antlion Mob Hunt, probably you have done it.

 Here is the point:
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/site11key.jpg

 First fight is easy, something like rank A/V mob level. Dispel your
 opponents at the beginning, and you can send Slow to Gilgamesh. Focus
 to defeat Enkidu for first, then Gilgamesh. Again, be sure you steal
 the Genji equipments.

 Second fight, Gilgamesh will use the level status skills, the bad statuses
 from these skills can only affect certain level. And the skills are:
 - Lv 4 Break,   only affects to the multiple level of 4
 - Lv 3 Disable, only affects to the multiple level of 3
 - Lv 2 Sleepga, only affects to the multiple level of 2
 So if your characters are at level 53, 55, 59, 61, 65... you don't need
 to worry about them. You can use the Firefly (Gain EXP 0) to maintance
 your characters' level.

 Set Gambit to heal allies at 50% HP, needless to say, Hastega, Bubble and
 other useful support spells should be done as well. Dispel him and Enkidu
 at the beginning, take down Enkidu before going for Gilgamesh. When Enkidu
 in Critical status, its evasion will be highly increased. Now I recommend
 use gun type weapon to finish it off faster since gun ignore evasion. If
 guns are not your best weapon, change it after defeating Enkidu. Have a
 Decoy on the character with highest HP while fight with Gilgamesh.

 Later when he shows the Sword of Legend, cast Dispel immediately before
 his Monarch Sword special move, otherwise you have to face him with many
 support statuese and Perfect Defense on his side for a period. When he
 performs the second  Monarch Sword,  prepare to continue your attacks.
 Gilgamesh will increase his combo rate automatically when Critical. If
 you're using Decoy tactic, cast  Reverse  on the Decoyed character, so
 Gilgamesh will heal your character with serveral attacks, otherwise you
 need to prepare Arise or Phoenix Down. Just to remind you, steal the
 Genji Helm and Genji Armor!

 After all, he left his Sword of Legend there, have a look if you like it,
 but you can't obtain it for now. Need to know more about his weapons?
 Check this guide:
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_gilgamesh.txt

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Wyrm Wrath's Renewal  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 ========================
 -----<<  Fafnir  >>-----
 ========================  Location : 
 |  Lv : 68             |    Paramina Rift, Silverflow's End,
 |  HP : 1390378        |    South section of the map, the smaller area.
 |  Weak : Thunder      |
 |  Possible Steal:     |  Client : 
 |   - Hi-Potion        |    Ieecha/Relj, Bur Omisace, Temple Approach,
 |   - Pebble           |    the viera leaning on the crate.
 |   - Ring Wyrm Scale  |
 |----------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 39      |   - 7,000 gil
 | Clan Point : 20000   |   - Assasin's Arrows
 ------------------------   - Teleport Stone

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 55   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 52   :
 :   Average Lv : > 40   :
 '-----------------------'

 This mob will only show up during then snowstorm, actually there's a route
 to keep the snowstorm from Bur Omisace to Silverflow's End to find Fafnir.
 Teleport to Bur Omisace, then out to the Paramina Rift ...
 -> Freezing Gorge -> Head of the Silverflow -> Icebound Flow
 -> Karydine Glacier -> Silverflow's End

 There's an part of this area Fafnir is not able to reach, if you stay there
 and use range weapon, Telekinesis or magic, you're almost to own the whole
 battle,  only thing to worry is the Shock from Fafnir which can be bounced
 back by Reflect status. If you go for the South-East part you can actually
 see some rocks are there, Fafnir couldn't get pass the area behind the rocks,
 so all you need to do is stay behind the rocks and attack it in a distance.
 Cast Reflectga on your team and equip Opal Ring for your healer, that's all
 for this tactic. By the time,  cast the strongest spell like Scathe, Ardor
 on your team before the Reflect status gone, you will notice even if Fafnir
 is the only target, but you can deal three times damage by using this trick.

 - And the point that Fafnir not able to reach is here (pic):
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/fafnir.jpg

 If you insist of fighting in the fair rules, you should prepare many things.
 Fafnir is much more stronger than many other mobs that you fought, you should
 gain higher strength and better equipments for this fight. Recommended level
 at 55 or above, learn all capacities on the upper part of Licenses Board if
 possible.  Prepare Chronos Tear, Alarm Clock and Echo Herbs for curing some
 negative statuses which would be sent by Fafnir.  For equipments, I suggest
 clear the Ancient Man of Mystery/Gilgamesh (above) for Masamune reward, and
 steal the Genji Gloves from Gilgamesh from the first fight, with these two
 equipments, you can hit more and gain MP faster during the fight of Fafnir.
 (Gilgamesh fight is easy when your characters at certain levels, read above)

 Besides, get all strongest weapons that're possible for you current status.
 Also find two Bubble Belt from the clan shop for the other characters, one
 Nihopalaoa for additional usage. For the magic, use Curaga (if you're going
 to follow this strategy, you don't need Curaja), Decoy and Reverse Arcane
 magic, which can be found from Eruyt Village and the clan shop. Needless to
 say, Hastega and Arise are the must, again, you can buy Arise in Balfonheim
 after Giruvegan event and Hastega from Dalmasca Estersand after Ridorana.

 Ok, this might be a complicated strategy, but I find it useful. If you had
 already know the Reverse + Decoy tactic, just skip this part, I'm going to
 explain it here. Use character 1 as main attack, the other two for support
 the main attack,  set Gambit for Reverse and Decoy for your attacker, and
 make sure put it on the top slot. Use Gambit to heal themself with Curaga
 since Reversed character would gain damage on heal, be sure set the Gambit
 for curing the Stop, Sleep and Silence as well. 
 Example, my Gambit is roughly like this:

 ------------( First Half )-----------  Dispel Fafnir at the start, then equip
 | Character 1: Fran                 |  Nihopalaoa and use a Remedy to Fafnir,
 |  1. Foe: lowest HP = Attack       |  Slow and Sap should be sent to Fafnir.
 |      **the rest are less          |  Now use Character 1 as your attacker,
 |        important for now          | (the one with Genji Gloves and Masamune)
 |                                   |  keep on going Reverse and Decoy your
 | Character 2: Ashe                 |  attacker as well as Bubble. For other
 |  1. Ally: Fran     = Reverse      |  two characters,  equip Bubble Belt so
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        |  you don't need to worry much on casting
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear |  Bubble. If Fafnir readies White Breath,
 |  4. Ally: Any      = Echo Herbs   |  move your leader character to the back
 |  5. Self: HP <50%  = Curaga       |  of it, reason is to avoid this move of
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Hastega      |  cause,  but actually by staying at the
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       |  side could evade the White Breath also,
 |                                   |  but sometimes your character will move
 | Character 3: Penelo               |  into the White Breath range, so it's
 |  1. Ally: Fran     = Decoy        |  quite dangerous too, and White Breath
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        |  could send Stop status, but since you
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Echo Herbs   |  have Gambit to cure Stop, it doesn't a
 |  4. Ally: Any      = Alarm Clock  |  big matter at all. The trick of running
 |  5. Self: HP <50%  = Curaga       |  to the back goes to Silencega and the
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Bubble       |  Sleepga as well, just pay attention on
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       |  the information bar at top left.
 -------------------------------------  
 ----------( Second Half )------------  For later of the battle, Character 2
 | Character 1: Fran                 |  who is working to Reverse magic will
 |  1. Ally: Ashe     = Reverse      |  run out of MP, and the attacker with
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        |  the Masamune should has lot or full
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear |  of MP. Now what you can do is switch
 |  4. Ally: Any      = Echo Herbs   |  over all your Character 1 (attacker)
 |  5. Self: HP <50%  = Curaga       |  and Character 2 (Reverse caster)'s
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Hastega      |  Gambit system over to each other,
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       |  means now you have to change your
 |                                   |  attacker. 
 | Character 2: Ashe                 |  
 |  1. Foe: lowest HP = Attack       |  My Gambits for second part of the
 |      **the rest are less          |  battle are roughly like this:
 |        important for now          |  <~ second half.
 |                                   |  The problem is while chaging your
 | Character 3: Penelo               |  attacker, you might get to have two
 |  1. Ally: Ashe     = Decoy        |  character with Decoy, if Fafnir choose
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        |  to attack your attacker is fine, but
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Echo Herbs   |  if you notice Fafnir is still aiming
 |  4. Ally: Any      = Alarm Clock  |  on your former attacker (Character 1),
 |  5. Self: HP <50%  = Curaga       |  you better Dispel his/her Decoy before
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Bubble       |  anything goes bad. Just keep on going
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       |  for the same strategy like first half
 -------------------------------------  battle to the end.

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Truth Shrouded in Mist  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =========================
 --<<  Behemoth King  >>--
 =========================  Location : 
 |   Lv : 70             |    Feywood, The Edge of Reason
 |   HP : 1668491        |    the South-West section of the map.
 |   Weak : -            |
 |   Possible Steal:     |  Client : 
 |    - Behemoth Steak   |    Koqmihn, Rabanastre Downtown/Lowtown,
 |    - Elixir           |    the man sitting inside Old Dalan's Place.
 |    - Ring Wyrm Scale  |
 |-----------------------|  Reward :
 | LP gain    : 40       |   - 250 gil
 | Clan Point : 20000    |   - Bucchas's Wine x2
 -------------------------

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 58   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 55   :
 :   Average Lv : > 42   :
 '-----------------------'

 Kill all enemies in these two section before Giruvegan gate where known as
 The Edge of Reason and Ice Field of Clearsight, when the tomato enemies show
 in the Ice Field of Clearsight, that's mean Behemoth King is already there.
 There're around 60 enemies in this two sections.

 Wondering this mob remind you the Fafnir? He is actually something like
 Fafnir, with stronger attack, defense, higher HP, know magic or physical
 attack immunation, and he's smarter than Fafnir. However, with everything
 recommended for Fafnir fight, this mob is NOT harder that Fafnir, all you
 need is just the time. You will know how useful of moving your character
 during the battle in this fight. Reverse + Decoy tactic doesn't work well
 for this fight since you need lot of MP and Behemoth King will put up the
 physical barrier many times before his death, but Decoy is still very useful.

 Make your healer as leader, then set Gambit to cast Decoy on this character.
 Dispel Behemoth King at the beginning. Get closer to Behemoth King to lure
 him use magic (not tight to him), once he has ready the magic, run further
 until out of his magic range, if you did it well, Behemoth King will freeze
 in the casting magic status until you back close to him, so now you just need
 to wait and let other characters to attack him. Behemoth King will stop doing
 this when your Decoy/Lure status gone, and now he will attack the targets near
 him. Now recast Decoy on your healer and move closer to Behemoth King again to
 lure him, stay in a distance to make him freeze again. Repeat this until your
 healer run out of MP, change your healer to do the same thing.
 Example, my Gambit is roughly like this:

 ------------< First Step >----------- Well, here is only my example, I just
 | Character 1: Fran  (healer)       | simply show the basic of this tactic,
 |  1. Ally: Fran     = Decoy        | of cause you can fill in the remaining
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | Gambit slots to make this better.
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear |
 |  4. Ally: HP <60%  = Curaja       | You should always control the healer
 |  5. Ally: Any      = Hastega      | (set him/her as leader) who is always
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Bubble       | has the Lure status (Decoy). Make sure
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | to open the target line option under
 |                                   | Config menu, so that you can clearly
 | Character 2: Ashe  (attacker)     | notice when Behemoth King targets on
 |  1. Ally: Fran     = Decoy        | you healer, probably he will use magic
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | attack if you are not closer enough.
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | Run away when your healer is targetted,
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | stay out of his magic ranage and wait
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | until your healer's Lure status gone.
 |                                   | If you did it well, Behemoth King will
 | Character 3: Penelo  (attacker)   | freezing there within the casting magic
 |  1. Ally: Any      = Arise        | status, now just wait your attackers to
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | attack him as many as possible.
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Bubble       |
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | Once the Lure status gone from your 
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | healer, Behemoth King will start attack
 ------------------------------------- other characters. Now faster cast Decoy
 -----------< Second Step >----------- on your healer again and  lure  him  to
 | Character 1: Fran  (attacker)     | use magic again. Repeat this until your
 |  1. Ally: Any      = Arise        | healer nearly out of MP (less then 80),
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | change your team setup like listed at
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Bubble       | <- the side (Second Step). Continue the
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | same tactic until your second healer
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | run low of MP, change your team setup
 |                                   | like the Third Step.
 | Character 2: Ashe  (healer)       |
 |  1. Ally: Ashe     = Decoy        | With the gain MP while attack and get
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | hit abilities on the License Board,
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | you should re-gain enough of MP for
 |  4. Ally: HP <60%  = Curaja       | the first healer before your third
 |  5. Ally: Any      = Hastega      | healer out of MP. So just switch your
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Bubble       | Gambit setup like First Step to fight,
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | then repeat to Second Step, Third Step
 |                                   | and so on until the battle end.
 | Character 3: Penelo  (attacker)   |
 |  1. Ally: Ashe     = Decoy        | Reason I recommend this strategy is
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | to avoid to fight Behemoth King against
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | his physical attack, which can deal lot
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | more damage than his magic, plus, you 
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | can block many magics with different
 ------------------------------------- equipments. Example, Zodiac Escutcheon
 ------------< Third Step >----------- and Rubber Suit can immune his Thundaga,
 | Character 1: Fran  (attacker)     | Demon Shield and Black Mask absorb his
 |  1. Ally: Penelo   = Decoy        | Darkja and more... And the main reason
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | is also because of magic attack is much
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | more slower than his normal hit. Look at
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | Holy, you may actually attack 3-5 hits
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | before Behemoth King fully recover after
 |                                   | casting a Holy spell.
 | Character 2: Ashe  (attacker)     |
 |  1. Ally: Any      = Arise        | Some more things to add, to re-change
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | your character's MP by using attack,
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Bubble       | you can equip the weapons with higher 
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%  = Curaja       | combo rate like Masamune, Ninja Sword
 |  5. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | type weapons, with Genji Gloves, you
 |                                   | could gain many MP back for a few turn.
 | Character 3: Penelo (healer)      | As for changing your healer, you should
 |  1. Ally: Penelo   = Decoy        | switch off the Decoy Gambit slot before
 |  2. Ally: Any      = Arise        | the Lure status gone from you current,
 |  3. Ally: Any      = Chronos Tear | then set the Gambit to Decoy the next
 |  4. Ally: HP <60%  = Curaja       | character who willing to be the healer.
 |  5. Ally: Any      = Hastega      | Chronos Tear is to cure Stop status
 |  6. Ally: Any      = Bubble       | from the White Breath, just in case
 |  7. Foe :lowest HP = Attack       | Behemoth King did it while recasting
 ------------------------------------- Decoy, you may cure this immediately.

 If you were to set Bravery or Berserk Gambit for the attacker, make sure
 you off this Gambit when Behemoth King is within physical attack immunation
 status or nearly to put the immunation barrier, needless to say, it would be
 wasting your MP.  For the later on the fight when Behemoth King builds the
 Greater Barrier,  he seems highly increase the magic speed, so running away
 might still get damaged by his magic. But you should keep on the same tactic,
 just had to use Curaja frequently, again, getting magic attack is much more
 better than physical attack from Behemoth King.



7a-2-8. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------
|  Rank X / Rank VIII  |------------------------------------------------------X
------------------------

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~|  Farewell to a Legend  |~
 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 =========================
 -----<<  Yiazmat  >>-----
 =========================  Location : 
 |   Lv : 73             |    Ridorana Cataract/ Colosseum,
 |   HP : 50112254       |    the round section at South.
 |   Weak : Dark         |
 |   Possible Steal:     |  Client : 
 |    - Holy Crystal     |    Montblanc, Rabanastre Clan HQ.
 |    - Holy Magicite    |    the person who gives you mob hunt mission.
 |    - Holy Stone       |
 |-----------------------|  Reward : 
 |  LP gain    : 255     |   - 30,000 gil
 |  Clan Point : 20000   |   - Godslayer's Badge
 -------------------------

*Defeat Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu optional boss and clear all other mob/mark
 hunting missions to unlock this.

 .--- Lv to challenge ---.
 :   Recommended: > 80   :
 :   Minimum Lv : > 75   :
 :   Average Lv : > 55   :
 '-----------------------'

 Like Hell Wyrm optional boss, you can run from the fight anytime you like,
 as long as not leaving  Yiazmat with Regen status, he won't restore his life.
 So, fight until you're tired, then leave and save your game at the nearest
 Save Crystal, return there later as your wish.

 Well, my recommended level is  80, or it can be even lower, but of cause
 if you have higher level characters. There's a little tricks to reduce his
 long HP bar much easier than fighting him at the stage. At around level 80
 or lower, you have to do this trick, you cannot beat him by using normal
 battle style.

 Some important things you need are:
  - Darkga,  this is your main attack.
  - Mirror Mail, at least 3 for supporting your main attack.
  - Phoenix Down, 99 if it. You must sacrifice an ally for some reasons.
  - Gold Needle & Chronos Tear at least 10 for each. I believe you have more.
  - Hermes Sandals, if you don't like to unequip Mirror Mail and cast Haste.
  - Lv 3 Mists,  to max out your Max MP. I believe you have done this.
  - Windbreaker, just in case for Yiazmat's Cyclone.

 Optional:
  - Ashe and Penelo as main party, they have strongest magic power.
  - Bubble Belt, for safety before you can really trapped Yiazmat.
  - Opal Ring, in case of need.
  - Black Mask, in case of need.
  - Fomalhaut + Dark Shot, in case of need.
  - Sage's Ring to save your MP.

 NOTE:
  Before anything, I would like to let you know, this trick can only take
  down 95% Yiazmat's HP, you must fight the remaining 5% in the hard way!
  Althought this trick could not beat Yiazmat, but I think it would be
  helpful to get rid of 95% Yiazmat.

 #- Trapping Yiazmat
 Here comes the fight, I found a little trick to trap Yiazmat and attack him
 without worrying much, which means you don't actually need to fight him face
 to face. Switch off the Gambit, enter the Colosseum and manually cast Dispel
 on Yiazmat at first, let him target on your current leader. Circling Yiazmat
 at the side to lure him get close to the side, and now you will get one or
 two hits, but with Bubble Belt or Bubble status, you can survive it without
 problem. If you're unluckly get Stop or Petrify, or even stomp on the trap
 with other bad statuses, faster use item to cure it. Once Yiazmat has closed
 to the stairs (be sure it's very close to the stairs), change your second
 character as your leader, leave the former leader KO'd by Yiazmat, but now
 make sure you new leader run down the stairs and hide behind the wall.

 Use Phoenix Down or Arise to revive your former leader once yo reached
 behind the wall. Now Yiazmat will start casting Protect at the same place,
 and you can actually damage him behind the wall, by using Reflect + Darkga
 is the strongest attack. Equip all character with Mirror Mail and use the
 Darkga on your own.

 You might not understand what I mean, so check the link below, click "Next"
 at the bottom to see step by step of the trick.

http://
s157.photobucket.com/albums/t43/sephirosuy/Yiazmat/?action=view&current=s01.jpg

 Once you've done trapping Yiazmat, simply set the Gambit like this:
 ---------------------------------------
 | Character 1                         | As mentioned before, equip all your
 |  1. Ally: Any      => Phoenix Down  | character with Mirror Mail, so you
 |  2. Ally: Any      => Darkga        | don't need to cast Reflectga on the
 |                                     | team. Keep on using Darkga to bounce
 | Character 2                         | off triple damage to Yiazmat.
 |  1. Ally: Any      => Phoenix Down  |
 |  2. Ally: Any      => Darkga        | Same time, Yiazmat will cast Protect,
 |                                     | Shell, Regen, Haste, Bravery... spell
 | Character 3                         | on his own, you should Dispel him
 |  1. Ally: Any      => Phoenix Down  | again at the suitable timing.
 |  2. Ally: Any      => Darkga        | I recommend begin your Dispel once
 --------------------------------------- Yiazmat has done his Haste.

 By doing so, you would trigger Yiazmat to use Deathstrike since Dispel
 cannot cast through the wall. Just send the character with weakest Magic
 to do this job. Revive him/her after the Deathstrike, the Dispel should
 be sent before Yiazmat did the Deathstrike. So, Yiazmat will recast the
 support spell accrodingly again, repeat and send him more Darkga until
 him cast Haste, Dispel as usual.

 Sometimes, Yiazmat will use Cyclone instead of Deathstrike, if this happen,
 try set your team to be only one existing character to take on the Cyclone,
 but probably you can't do this well  since your Gambit is on. So equip all
 character with Windbreaker armor, also equip  Shell Shield  if you have it,
 just only to block the Cyclone. Change back the better equipments afterwards.
 Remeber Cyclone bring you Sap status, be sure you heal it.

 #- Additional notes:
  - Sometimes you can actually make Yiazmat cancels Cyclone, but I haven't
    discovered how exaclty was it. So far I've done few times, which is keep
    running further from Yiazmat (who was targetted by Yiazmat with Cyclone),
    and eventaully Yiazmat begins casting Protect again.
  - Equip Sage's Ring to regain some MP, because you can gain MP while
    using Darkga, and Sage's Ring reduce the MP cost.
  - If you need to cast support spell, equip Opal Ring, but remember to
    unequip it after you've done.
  - In case after Cyclone you need to heal badly, unequip the Mirror Mail
    on the character at low HP and equip Black Mask, means heal by using
    Darkga, meanwhile you can damage Yiazmat.
  - Equip Hermes Sandals to speed up your progress.
  - Prevent Reflectga from Yiazmat by equiping Mirror Mails.
 
 *** READ THIS ***

   Hopefully you haven't go and fight Yiazmat without reading this.
   Again, with the strategy above, you can only cut off 95% of his HP,
   what would happen after that? Like King Bomb restores its HP after
   getting certain amount of damage, but Yiazmat is like a auto-ability,
   he will restore his HP very faster, probably 2 seconds restore one
   life bar, you can't Dispel this, however, this auto-ability can only
   be activated when Yiazmat cannot detect any target in his range. So,
   show off yourself to stop Yiazmat from restoring HP. And I noticed
   this will happen when Yiazmat HP is down to 2 bar left, that's mean
   when 1 red dot left under his HP bar.
   For safety, GO AND SAVE YOUR GAME NOW~!

   Before return to the fight, remember Yiazmat will give you a Cyclone
   after he done his supporting setup. So, send a solo character to take
   against this Cyclone. It's better you have Reverse status in the right
   timing, so you don't need to worry for it. I recommend start casting
   Reverse when you pass the stairs.

 #- Final showdown

    1. Lure Yiazmat to use Deathstrike
    With the over-wall attack trick above, Yiazmat can only use Deathstrike
    if you don't enter the stage. To not make Yiazmat stop attacking, use
    two characters to keep staying at the stairs, as Yiazmat can detect the
    targets, he will keep using Deathstrike, so his HP wouldn't restore as
    long as he sees your ally. Keep one ally using Darkga as usual, be sure
    you have Gambit set to use Phoenix Down against your ally to revive from
    Deathstrike. But this technique is slow, and Yiazmat might use Cyclone
    instead of Deathstrike, so you do have to prepare against Cyclone too.

    2. Decoy + Reverse
    As you need to close combat with Yiazmat, he will cast Reflectga on
    your team, if you want to use Dispel on your team, you will lost all
    your current supporting statuses, and you need to recast them, which
    is wasting your time. To make the things easier, equip Mirror Mail
    to prevent the Reflectga from Yiazmat. Decoy a character and Reverse
    him/her. Already mentioned in Fafnir strategy under Rank H/VII section,
    check it out for the basic setup. By using this technique, you have to
    prepare Esuna or Chronos Tear and Gold Needle to cure the possible bad
    statuses from Stone and White Breath. Since Yiazmat only attack your
    Decoyed character, so equip Windbreaker to other characters for the
    oming soon Cyclone.

    3. Reverse everyone
    You don't need to Decoy, only cast Reverse to all ally, but you need
    to spend lot of MP. This is also a close combat, so equip Mirror Mail
    to prevent Yiazmat's Reflectga. Now you should have Gambit setup for
    "Self => Reverse" or "Ally: Any => Reverse". Equip Sage's Ring to
    reduce MP cost of Bubble/Bubble Belt to double your HP for just in
    case get hit by Yiazmat before you put up the Reverse. So basically
    you don't need to worry about Cyclone, but you still need to prepare
    curing Petrify, Stop and Sap. 

  The strongest boss in the game is going down, Good Luck~!

7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-3. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O---------------------------O ------------------------------------------------
-O  Back to Barheim Passage  O 
 O---------------------------O                                           [s7a3]

After events in Barheim Passage, you can return to this from other entrance in
Dalmasca Eastersand. Reasons of going back to Barheim Passage are side quests
and esper/summon, as well as some great treasures. All you need is just the
Barheim Key. To get Barheim Key follow the steps below...

7a-3-1. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
------------
< Starting >
------------

- Clear Flower Saboten and Nidhogg Mob Hunt missions (rank E/rank I), so you
  should have Great Serpentskin, if you keep this loot/treasure to clear this
  quest, you do have a chance to get extra reward. Without it, you still able
  to get Barheim Key, read below.
- After got your reward of Flower Saboten mission from Dantro (your client),
  talk to him again in Dalmasca Estersand and he will request you to pass the
  flower to his wife.

- Now go to South Bank Village where you can find the Dalmasca Estersand
  Gate Crystal. Talk to Dantro's wife to get Bundle of Needles (treasure).
- Leave and return this area, talk to the people near the river and the boy
  named Tchigri, then choose first option to North Bank Village.
- Talk to Tchigri for some events, then will back to South Bank Village.
- Now speak with Dantro's wife again, then search behind her camp for the
  red flower, examine it, a flower saboten will follow you.
- Speak with the boy, Tchigri to go North Bank Village again.
- Get close to the giant flower saboten, watch a scene. The flower saboten
  left you 1000 gil and Wyrmfire Shot.


7a-3-2. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------
< Choosing an Extra Reward >
----------------------------

 Ok, let see the how are the possible rewards being affected
 before going for the loot that will Dantro's Wife request.

   First of all, the requested loot/treasure by Dantro's Wife for
   the Recovering Traveler can recover a little HP (not yours!),
   and the extra reward is based on the Recovering Traveler's HP 
   when the quest is end. Below is the list of them

      Loots that will        Amount of HP    
      Dantro's Wife          recovered by       The Maximum and
      request for the         this loot       Minimum amount of
      Recovering Traveler          |        this loot you need
                \                  |         /    |
                 \                 |        /     |
        ---------------------------------------------
        |      Loot Needed      |  HP.  | Max | Min |
        |-------------------------------------------|
        |   Semclam Shell       |  + 1  |  5  |  1  |
        |   Nebralim            |  + 1  |  2  |  1  |
        |   Valeblossom Dew     |  + 1  |  3  |  1  |
        |   Great Serpentskin   |  + 3  |  1  |  0  |
        ---------------------------------------------


    After all, the Recovery Traveler show out and give you the extra reward
    depending on the treasures/loots that you gave Dantro's Wife during the
    quest. And below is the list of the rewards accordingly.

      Extra reward that     The total HP of       The Recovering Traveler
      comes with the       Recovering Traveler    who show in the end.
      Barheim Key          when the quest end     /
                \                 |              /
                 \                |             /
        ---------------------------------------------
        |       Rewards       | Total HP |    NPC   |
        |-------------------------------------------|
        |  Balance Mote       |  3 ~ 7   |  Bangaa  |
        |  Magick Gloves      |  8 ~ 12  |   Hume   |
        |  Golden Armlet      | 13 (max) |  Moogle  |
        ---------------------------------------------


7a-3-3. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------
< Collecting Loot for Extra Reward >
------------------------------------

Back to the quest:

Semclam Shell (max = 5)
 - Talk to Dantro's Wife in South Bank Village, she will request the
   Semclam Shells. You can find 5 of it.
 - Search the shore and check the shinning thing for the Semclam Shells.
 - Some more are around the Banks of the Nebra section, near the shore as well.
 - Pass the Semclam Shells to Dantro's Wife once you got the amount you want.
 - Afterwards, she will request for the Nebralim.

Nebralim (max = 2)
 - Return to the Outpost section and talk to Dantro. Same place, find the
   boxes in the central, check the jars there for Nebralim, another one is the
   jar behind the chocobo, pass them to Dantro's Wife also.
 - Now Dantro's Wife request the Valeblossom Dew, which can be found in the
   Broken Sands section.

Valeblossom Dew (max = 3)
 - Talk to Tchigri and move to Northern most section of Dalmasca Estersand,
   find the flowers in the valley. One of them is in the middle of the section,
   beside the rock which you can push down, examine it to get Valeblossom Dew.
   You can find 3 Valeblossom Dews here.
 - Back to South of River and give the Valeblossom Dew to Dantro's Wife.

Giving the Great Serpentskin
 - And now Dantro's Wife will ask for the Great Serpentskin, give her as
   you choice of the extra reward, of cause you can refuse to pass it over.
   Check the section above (7a-3-2).

Barheim Key and Extra Reward
 - Leave here for awhile and return. Speak to the Recovering Traveler, she's
   behind the camp where Dantro's Wife is, and the Recovering Traveler will
   give you the Barheim Key with the extra reward depending on how many
   Semclam Shell, Valeblossom Dew, Nebralim or Great Serpentskin you gave
   Dantro's Wife.

From the Dalmasca Eastersand Gate Crystal, go South, then turn to South-East,
there is a small area, use your Barheim Key to unlock that door can back to
Barheim Passage now.

7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-4. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O---------------------O ------------------------------------------------------
-O  Fishing Mini-Game  O 
 O---------------------O                                                 [s7a4]

The main objective to play this Mini-Game is Lu Shang's Badge, which is
named Taikou/Lu Shang's Badge on the Japanese version. It's one of the three
treasures for Wyrmhero Blade (US)/Tolo Sword (JP) trading.

Read the 'Special Trading' under "Secret Matters" section for the details.
Of cause you could get some other treasures during the process.

7a-4-1. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
------------
< Starting >
------------

After you get the Barheim Key (side quest above), and the story reached to
Port At Balfonheim,

- Back to Dalmasca Estersand Gate Crystal section, talk to Ruksel who's
  looking at the river, knowing he wants to fishing. 
- Return to Port At Balfonheim, the South-East section which is the road
  to Airship Terminal/Aerodrome.
- Find the fishing old man around the crates area and talk to him twice,
  then choose the first option.
- Now go further from the old man, but don't leave this section.
  After awhile back to the same place, and the old man is gone,
  examine the fishing rod there to obtain Muramata.
- Move back to Dalmasca Estersand and pass the Muramata to Ruksel to start
  this Mini-Game.


7a-4-2. -----------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------
< Advancing >
-------------

If you've completed Mysterious Man/Gilgamesh rank H Mob Hunt mission, you will
get Blue, Green, Red, Yellow and Black Bottle during the fishing one by one.
With the hints from the Bottles, find five letters from the locations below:

Blue Bottle
- Nabreus Deadlands, section South section from the Gate Crsytal.
  Reference the picture below if you don't want to find yourself.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/bottle1.jpg


Green Bottle
- Salikawood, section before to Nabreus Deadlands.
  Find the shack by the middle trunk.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/bottle2.jpg


Red Bottle
- Mosphoran Highwaste, Gate Crystal section. 
  Find the Wind Shrine at North-West area, check it to get the letter.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/bottle3.jpg


Yellow Bottle
- Cerobi Steppe,
  Go turn on the windmill No.1, 2, 5, 7, 9, turn off 3, 4, 6, 8, 10. If you
  do so, you will get the letter automatically, make sure double check to
  confirm all of them have been fixed right.


Black Bottle
- Garamsythe Waterway, central control section where the Save Crystal by.
  Go South-East abit, where you can see some mouses running round.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/bottle5.jpg


After you got all five letters, move on to Barheim Passage to find Gilgamesh.
Go to the longest railway in the middle known as Zeviah Span, you can see a
small area at the South of this section, and you can only reach there from
South. Enter that small area to watch a scene with Gilgamesh and Enkidou.
Here is the location:

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/gil.jpg

After all, you will obtain Matamune demon rod. Now return and pass this rod
to Ruksel in Dalmasca Estersand, continue fishing until you get Upstream.
At the beginning, you can only fish in the Downstream, get 5 or more perfect
fishing (no mistake) to unlock the Midstream. 5 more perfect fishing in the
Midstream to unlock the Upstream.


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
    Getting the Lu Shang's Badge
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Now with the Matamune, you can obtain Saboten Bond/Cactoid Compact in the
Upstream. Continue fishing in the new fishing spot, Hidden Shoals. You will
eventually get the Saboten Crest/Cactoid Commendation. Now fish in the last
fishing spot, named Den of the River Lord (name Master Den for JP version).
Try your best to get  9 successfully command input  for the King Of Nebra,
then lastly obtain the  Lu Shang's Badge,  which is the trading treasure
for Wyrmhero Blade/Tolo Sword.

Note/Tips:
  I've heard the Saboten Crest/Cactoid Commendation in Hidden Shoals is
  random, not too sure, but I got it at my fifth perfect fishing.

  For the last fishing spot, Den of the River Lord, you just need to get
  9 sucessfully fishing to get the Lu Shang's Badge/Taikou Chest. And it's
  simple since you don't need to get perfect fishing exaclty, as long as
  you got 9 times, the loot is yours.

  Try to memorize the buttons like this:
    .-----------------------------.
    |   R 1    L 2     ^     [ ]  |
    |   R 2    L 1     X     ->   |
    '-----------------------------'

  Nothing other than practice, keep your cool during the process.
  Relax and chew a chewing-gum seems work for me lol

 different price.

  ** Empty Bottle **
       Collect 99 Empty Bottles (can be fished from any fishing spot)
       and pass to Ada to exchange an Electrum (loot).




7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-5. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O--------------------O -------------------------------------------------------
-O  80 Rare Monsters  O 
 O--------------------O                                                  [s7a5]

--------------------
< Starting & Basic >
--------------------

When tory reached to Port At Balfonheim before anything starts. Go back to
The Phon Coast. same section with the Gate Crystal, talk to the Bangaa captain
known as huntmaster in front of the cabin that's near the shore. Now the quest
is began, go to the South-East most and head up to the hill, wait until the
first rare monster appears at the bottom, then go down to defeat it. It's
quite outstanding and big, very easy to be noticed.

You will get an Engage item (name Trophy for US version) from this first ever
rare monster, take it back to the Gate Crystal section and talk to the Bangaa
captain again. Now you can begin to find more other rare monsters with the
Engage/Trophy item in the whole Ivalice.

After collecting enough of Engage/Trophy items, pass them to the Bangaa NPCs
in front of the Bangaa captain/Huntmaster, and the 'Hunt Shop' near the Bangaa
NPCs will start selling the items. The stocks in the Hunt Shop will be affected
base on the amount of Engage items that you pass to the Bangaa NPCs.

- Bangaas
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/bangaa.jpg

- Hunt Shop
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/hunt_shop.jpg

-----------------------
< Treasures Of Zodiac >
-----------------------

With enough of Engage items, go to the Imperial City of Archades, and obtain
all 28 White Leafs in the four sections at East for the Black Feather before
you can find the NPC who gives you the treasure of Horoscopes.

Same as how you get 9 White Leafs for the taxi guard to travel. Run around
speak with any one of the 28 appointed NPCs for the information, then inform
to the other one of the pair to complete it. Is better you run this with the
7a-6. Cockatrice Find quest together (below), since that quest in this place
needed all 28 White Leafs as well. Anyway, of cause you could done this
seperately if you don't want to be confused. When you back here during the
Cockatrice Find quest, you don't need to find all these White Leafs anymore.

In the section beside Airship Terminal, you can speak with the girl who's
runing around, and she will tell you the remaining White Leaf for each section.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/leaf.jpg

After getting all 28 White Leafs, go find the Guild Counter in any shops here,
trade all White Leafs for the Black Feather. With the Black Feather, you're
allowed to enter the Terrace of Central Section, where the Northern area from
Gate Crystal.

Inside here, head to right corner and run up to the corner. You can see four
NPCs are discussing there, talk to the old man for your reward. Check these
picture if you want to see their location:

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/area.jpg
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/horo_reward.jpg

7a. Side Quest / Mini-Game
7a-6. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O  Cockatrice Find  O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s7a6]

Before anything about this quest, you must get:

- Story reaches to Imperial City of Archades.
- Completely clear Cluckatrice/Niwatoris rank E Mob/Mark Hunt.
- Clear Gil Snapper/Gilgame rank C Mob/Mark Hunt mission.
- Find the Feather Of The Flock in the South-East section where you fought
  Gil Snapper/Gilgame mob, you can only reach there during rainy season.

If you've done everything above, the go to Giza Plains camp section during
DRY SEASON. Talk to Tira by the stable knowing the Cockatrices were gone, know
start to find them in the locations below:

 -----------------------------
 - Jahara, Land of the Garif -
 -----------------------------
Head to middle section meet with Cockatrice. Talk to the Cockatrice and the
cattle breeder beside, tell him you came from Giza Plains. Then move to the
inner section and talk to the eldest Garif will obtain Eldest Garif's Present,
just give it to Cockatrice. Before leaving, talk to the breeder again for
Platinum Dagger.

 -----------------------
 - Dalmasca Eastersand -
 -----------------------
For certain reason, you must finish the 'Back to Barheim Passage' quest and
get Sluice Gate Key for first. Return to Dalmasca Eastersand Gate Crystal
section, talk to the boy by the river shore and send Nasir (wolf), Aril (kid)
and  Sasana (Cockatrice) to Northern shore one by one. After that, talk to
Sasana again for Koga Blade (Ninja Sword).

 -----------------
 - Eruyt Village -
 -----------------
Go to the Northern area, find Mjrn and Cockatrice in the right end. After
speaking with them, pick up the Dewdrops Pebble left from Mjrn, give it to
her. Now search the entire village for other 8 more stones.

Dewdrop Pebble locations:
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_dewdrop.png

In the Northern section, 
- you can find one in front of the trunk door along with a viera.
- opposite side from above location.

From the Northern section down to the lower section,
- on the stairs, one is on the outer trunk beside.
- the three ways junction with a suspension bridge, find it beside one of the
  tied block.
- West area, go right hand side, examine the weapon shelf for another one.
- in the round garden, you can see a shinning thing in the middle, talk to the
  nearest viera to obtain it.
- on the middle of the stairs to bottom, find it on the outer side.
- East area, there is a bridge faces to South, but it has been blocked, the
  end of that bridge contain another stone.

After collecting all 8 of them, back to Northern section and pass all of
them to Mjrn. Talk to Cockatrice again, the last pebble will appear beside
the Cockatrice, pass it the Myulin also. Reward of this part is Yoichi Bow.

 -----------------------------
 - Imperial City of Archades -
 -----------------------------
You need to obtain all 28 White Leafs/Pinewood Chops in the four sections at
East. It's actually mentioned in the main walkthrough at Archades part, if
you had follow the walkthrough, definitely the Sandalwood Chop is already
inside your inventory.

(I've mentioned this in the 7a-5. 80 Rare Monsters quest, if you had already
 done this, just head to highland Terrace to find the Cockatrice, it's at the
 North of the Gate Crystal.)

Same like how you get 9 White Leafs for the taxi guard to travel. Just run
around speak with any one of the 28 appointed NPCs for the information, then
inform to the other one of the pair to complete it.

In the section beside Airship Terminal/Aerodrome, you can speak with the girl
who's runing around, and she will tell you the remaining White Leaf for each
section.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/leaf.jpg

After all, go to a shop and find the Guild Counter/Chop Master inside that
shop, trade all 28 White Leafs for the Black Feather/Sandalwood Chop. Now head
to West section where the Gate Crystal by, go to North. With the Black Feather/
Sandalwood Chop, you now can enter the highland Terrace. Inside there, just get
close to the giant Cockatrice and talk to it, then choose the first option to
obtain Tumulus hand bomb weapon.

 ----------------------------
 - Royal City of Rabanastre -
 ----------------------------
Completed all four events above, back to Rabanastre and find the Cockatrice at
the Northern point. Once you check on the Cockatrice, it will run away, now
you need to chase it. When closing to the Cockatrice, you do have to walk,
otherwise it will run into a distance, and you're not able to chase it by
running.

The two corridors at both sides corner are the key points to catch up with it,
if you lost to get it, just drive it until the next corridor. Near the side
corner, the Cockatrice will just keep going on the street, so you just need to
walk into the corridor for short cut, as long as you don't show in front of
it, you should catch up with it after the corridor. Talk to it and choose the
first option, it will stay at the Northern area. Talk to it again and choose
second option for Diamond Sword, and it will gone for Giza Plains.

 ----------------------
 - Port At Balfonheim -
 ----------------------
Same section with Gate Crystal, talk to the moogle opposite of the map seller,
who's walking around the chocobo stable. Then talk to the girl looking at the
chocobo stable and show her the Feather Of The Flock, the moogle just now will
come around. Now talk to the Chocobo Stable Guardian to watch some scenes. You
will get Defender (Greatsword) for this part.


After all, back to Giza Plains camp section during DRY SEASON. Talk to Tira for
ending the quest. Obtain Hi-Ether x2.




7a-7. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O  Balfonheim Race  O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s7a7]

---------
< About >
---------

It's a Mini-game as well. During the race, keep pressing 'Circle' and 'X'
buttons to run. 'Circle' works to turn your character to right and 'X' works
to turn your character to left while running. You must reach to the end point
of the race by using the combination of 'Circle' and 'X' buttons. Also you must
get the first place for the rewards and level up.


------------
< Starting >
------------

You can start this mini game after Pharos at Ridorana event. Talk to Rikken
for the infomation of the final stage, talk to him again to start this mini
game.

Later when you want to challenge the racing again, just talk to Rikken at the
same place to start it. Each win of the racing would bring you to the next
level. Read below for the rewards of each level.

7b. Sub-Event
7b-1. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------O --------------------------------------------------------------
-O  7 Sisters  O 
 O-------------O                                                         [s7b1]

This quest start from the Airship, the Cabin Chief in the the Lounge. When
you're able to travel with Airship, you could have a chance to meet with a man
in the Airship Lounge, he's talking with the Cabin Chief in the counter.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/7sis.jpg

Check on them to listen what are they talking about. The man is come from high
society (who also has 7 brothers in his family), he's offering the marriage to
the girl, but with certain reasons, the girl refuse him. Now he turns to you
and ask you to travel for another 6 routes of flight, find 6 other sisters and
tell them about this theme, then the man (whom you see at the counter) will
give up this marriage.So now what you need to do is keeping travelling to
defferent trips by normal flight to find the remaining 6 sisters. You would
get the key item, Ann's Letter from when you start quest.

When you found the different sister by the Cabin Chief counter, you could also
see a man in front of the counter. Talk to the Cabin Chief and show her the
Ann's Letter that you got from the first sister. Repeat this to the remaining
sister. Once you've done, you will get Ring of Renewal (accessory).

 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 |                                Tips & Hint                               |
 |--------------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | Start this with Death Gaze rank H/VII Mob Hunt. Since you have to travel |
 | some other places to get more informations of this mob, so while you     |
 | travelling to different trips, just have a look on the Cabin Chief in    |
 | Lounge see whather encounter the other sisters or not. Save some times   |
 | by doing so.                                                             |
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

You should take the different flights to encounte other sisters.
Below are the possible flights to encounter the sisters, take them repeatedly
if you didn't found the sisters.

 Rabanastre <-> Bhujerba
 Rabanastre <-> Nalbina
 Rabanastre <-> Archades
 Bhujerba   <-> Balfonheim
 Balfonheim <-> Archades
 Archades   <-> Nalbina

According to the advises from 6th sister, take 'Nalbina -> Balfonheim'
to search the last sister.


** thanks to Thaisak inform various flights to find the sisters.




7b. Sub-Event
7b-2. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O  Bhujerban Madhu  O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s7b2]

They are the wine bottles in different locations of Bhujerba, obtain and sell
them to the appointed NPCs, each Bhujerban Madhu can be sold for 1000 gil. All
together are 14 Madhus, that's mean you could have 14000 gil here.

You can start to collecting them after Tomb Of Raithwall event.
Here are the Bhujerba Madhus location, you could get them randomly,

 1. Inside Airship Terminal, from the entrance head to right area. It's on
    the traveller's bag.

 2. Inside Armor Shop, in the third left carbinet.

 3. Inside Weapon Shop, turn right from the first stairs. It's in the corner.

    a moogle.

    it's on the crate.

14. South-East section, behind the blue seeq.
