7b. Sub-Event
7b-3. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O------------------------O ---------------------------------------------------
-O  July, The Female Spy  O 
 O------------------------O                                              [s7b3]

This event can only happen after Tomb of Raithwall event and before story
reaches to Mosphoran Highwaste.

- First, head to Nalbina and find two guards who block the way to Mosphoran.
Talk to July sitting away in front of them knowing she is undertaking a job,
and she wants to end it and back to Archades.


- Close to the guards and listen to their discussion.
The Senior Guard told The Junior Guard not to leave his post not ever what
happen. But the Junior Guard said he cant bear the smell of chocobo.


- Hire a chocobo and drive this guard, he will scream and run away.
Junior Guard's family is Chocobo Gardener, and always get the smell, he work
hard and save the money to buy a perfume from Viera to cover this disfavored
and married his wife. This is the secret he keeps all the time. That's why
Julie was hired to search for.


- After that, July turns to you and thank.
She pursues you to come Archades for the reward. When you reach to Imperial
City of Archades, find her in the magic shop and get your reward, which is
Salamand Halcyon. It's a treasure to trade for Arcturus (Atk +44) gun type
weapon.

** thanks to Thaisak again, this Sub-Event was actually done by him, NOT ME.

-O  Viera Lover  O

This event can be triggered after Bur Omisace.

7b. Sub-Event
7b-5. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O------------------O ---------------------------------------------------------
-O  Pilika's Diary  O 
 O------------------O                                                    [s7b5]

Must clear the Rocktoise Mob/Mark Hunt mission which given by Pilika in
Bhujerba SkyCity. After taking your reward from Pilika, speak to her again
and she will tell you there was another matter. Agree to help her would be
given a Merchant's Armband, now she wants you to find her diary inside the
Clio's Technicks.

Now head to the technick/skill shop, the moogles no longer blocking the
stairs to the left. Get close to the bookcase at left corner and take the
Pilika's Diary, you're able to choose either Read It or Abstain, but it
doesn't matter for now, however, if you choose Read It, you can spot a
mini serpent on top of the other bookcase looking at you (Easter Egg?).

When you return the diary to Pilika, she will ask whether you had read
the diary, now your answer affects the reward. It's either level 2 or
level 3 Mystic Armor.

  Lv2 - Kilimweave Shirt, awarded if you say you read it.
  Lv3 - Shepherd's Balero, awarded if you say "I've done nothing"




7b. Sub-Event
7b-6. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O----------------------O -----------------------------------------------------
-O  New Recruit - Jovy  O 
 O----------------------O                                                [s7b6]

At the beginning, you can see Jovy is in the West Ward of Nalbina,
lying on the ground and says his hero has gone ...

Now clear all Mob/Mark Hunt mission that were given by the
clients/petitioners in Nalbina, which are:
  - Atomos  ----- by Burrogh   ( rank C/III )
  - Roblon  ----- by Morgen    ( rank S/VI )
  - Goliath  ---- by Barrong   ( rank S/VI )
  - Deathscythe - by Popol     ( rank S/VI )
  - Carrot  ----- by Zammadria ( rank H/VII )

Once you've done, back to Nalbina and speak to your clients/petitioners
for the rewards (you don't need to clear them in once), and Jovy will show
up for a scene with each of them, then leaves you a "snort".

After all, find Jovy in the West Ward area which is outside the Aerodrome/
Airship Terminal, he's running across the middle, talk to him for a scene,
and you will get Elixir and Knot of Rust from Jovy, as well as became his
new hero.




7b. Sub-Event
7b-7. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O-------------------O --------------------------------------------------------
-O  Ktjn's Decision  O 
 O-------------------O                                                   [s7b7]

*Ktjn named Catherine in Japanese version.
This event might be available only after Tomb of Raithwall.
Find Ktjn in Rabanastre, Muthru Bazaar area, she is sitting at the middle
of the stairs. When you speak with her, she will ask you a question, and your
answer affects her decision and the reward. But you can't just talk until she
ask all four questions in once, you have go through the story before she ask
the next question. If you have passed Pharos at Ridorana, you need to wait
15 minutes for her next question.

   After all four questions, wait for another 15 minutes,
   then talk to her again, she will head off. Find her in
   the other place for your reward. Your answer for each
   question would be gained +1 or -1 point, of cause, the
   total points affect your rewards. Here is the possible
   results that you got after all four questions.

  =========================================================================
  | Q1 :            | Q2 :            | Q3 :            | Q4 :            |
  |~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|
  | 1st answer + 1  | 1st answer + 1  | 1st answer - 1  | 1st answer + 1  |
  | 2nd answer - 1  | 2nd answer - 1  | 2nd answer   0  | 2nd answer - 1  |
  |                 |                 | 3rd answer + 1  |                 |
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------

  ============================================================
  | Total Pt. |          Reward         |      Location      |
  ============================================================
  |     + 4   |  Platinum Sword         |  Clan HQ Hall      |
  |     + 3   |  Paramina Crossbow      |  Outside Clan HQ   |
  |     - 3   |  Firefly                |  Outside Item Shop |
  |     - 4   |  Fuzzy Miter            |  Item Shop         |
  |  *other   |  Ether x1, Hi-Potion x3 |  **Wandering       |
  ------------------------------------------------------------
*  other: -2, -1, 0, +1, +2.
** Wandering: (thanks to Ashille)
     - North End, in front of Gambit Shop.
     - East End, near the entrance of Muthru Bazaar.
     - Airship Terminal/Aerodrome, the inner area.
     - Muthru Bazaar, with a child.


***************************
  Follow these steps to obtain the reward that you wish if you don't
  like to calculate yourself. It's quite confusing during the process,
  I'm still not 100% sure all this are correct, please send me an e-mail
  if you got something wrong here.

Here is the transcriptions of the event (thanks to Ashille).

~~~~ Q1 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  Hello,  I am called Ktjn.  I left my home and came to Rabanastre
  only quite recently. I have yet to learn my way around. I had been
  hoping to find someone I might speack with. Should you like to talk
  again,  it would please me  Greatly.  Is  the city not wondderful?
  I still lose my way on occasion,  but I have come to know some of
  her walks and alleyways.

<<Question>>

  But the Land, i cannot heart it...Should this not Trouble me as a vieara?
    1 --> "Yes, you should be ashamed."
          - (I see, then perhaps it was a mistake to leave the wood...)
          - (Pay no mind to my mutterings. Pray, speak with me again soon.) 
    2 --> "No, don't be silly."
          - I am Glad you think so. I somtimes worry that a true
            Viera would not have such difficulty finding her way.
          - I wonder if my sister had such doubts when first she left the 
            wood...ah, pay no mind mutterings. Pray speak with me again soon. 

~~~~~ Q2 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  It is good to see you again.  I have had so little  opportunity to
  Speak with Humes. My people keep to themselves. The number of visitors
  to our village could be counted out on a single hand. So did I long to
  come to a hreat city such as Rabanastre.  That wish is now come true,
  but this is not how i had hoped it would be. 

<<Question>>

  I knew my choice would bring hardship, yet...
    1 --> "You should've thought it through."" 
          - Perhaps i should have.Strength of will alone could not
            make up for my ignorance of the wider world. 
          - I do not wish to admit it, but i know it now to be true...
          - Feel not sorrowful, it is not easy thing to speak unwelcome
            truths to another. Yet these are the most valuable truths to hear.
    2 --> "Things will get better."
          - I suppose few things go as we originally plan them.
            That is why we must each struggle through life.
          - I too will struggle toward my goal.

~~~~ Q3 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  Hello, have you come for another visit? Little has changed for me.
  I have seen much of the city, thought I still have made few friends,
  and am no closer to realizing my goal. I have not spoken of this to
  you before, but I came to Rabanastre to become...more like my sister.
  She had Grown tired of our life of isolation... Long ago she left,
  only later did i hear rumors she had come here.  All this time my
  sister has been making her way through  the world,  while I lived
  in the sheltered peace of the wood. 

<<Question>>

  I would be as she is. Do you think it possible?
    1 --> "Sure, if you put your mind to it."
          - You are right! Time spent lingering in doubt is time wasted.
            If I am to be like my sister, i must work hard at this...
          - But she and i possess very different talents. What if i have
            made the wrong choice?
    2 --> "I don't know your sister."
          - True, you do not. i will tell you of her, when the time is right.
          - I do not mean to keep secrets, but i am not ready to be measured
            against her. Not yet.
    3 --> "It'll never happen." 
          - ...I see. So you think me too naive to follow
            in my sister's footsteps.
          - Though you may speak the truth, I am not yet beaten. 

~~~~ Q4 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
  I am happy to see you visit again. Talking with you somehow
  makes my burdens feel lighter I have left my home, and I can
  never return.  I had no doubts when set out,  but now wonder
  whether I will fail where my sister did not.  It would not be
  right to turn to my sister for help, she is now an accomplished
  warrior,  but for me  no allure does the call of  battle hold.
  Others have said  I possess a warmth of care my sister lacks.
  Still, not on kindness alone can one make her way in the world.
  Perhaps it would be best if I too became a warrior like my sister.

<<Question>> 

  What do you think?
    1 --> "I think it's a good idea."
          - I thought am much. I will join a Clan, and learn
            to fight as my sister.
          - But i have ne skill in battle. Even should i join a Clan,
            I may be more burden than aid.
          - Ah forgive me. I always seem to look at what is not,
            instead of what is.
          - Pray speak with me again soon
    2 --> "I'm not so sure."
          - Hmmm...so, strength in battle does not necessarily mean
            strength of character. I had not thought of it in this way.
          - I believe i may have taken one step stoward choosing the 
            path I should follow. I look forward to our next meeting.




7b. Sub-Event
7b-8. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 O--------------------O -------------------------------------------------------
-O  Other Sub-Events  O 
 O--------------------O                                                  [s7b8]

Here is a overview of all other sub-events which have not been listed above.
However, some of them are already mentioned in the Walkthrough. Anyway, here
is to cover all remaining sub-events in the game.

If you found somethine that're not here, just go through the
 "8. Esper / Summon"
 "9. Optional Bosses"
the answer should be there.


------------------
< Help the Yensa >
------------------

Timing   : After SkyCity of Bhujerba
Location : Ogir-Yensa and Nam-Yensa Sandsea
Rewards  : Eksir Berries

How to start:
 - Enter Nam-Yensa from North-West of Ogir-Yensa.
 - Talk to the moogle, then follow the Urutan Yensa.
 - Defeat Urutan Eater in Nam-Yensa Sandsea.
 - Back to the moogle for a scene.
 - Return Ogir-Yensa from where you came.
 - Go up the tower and you can see the Urutan Yensa is going back to
   Nam-Yensa, go after the Urutan Yensa for another scene.
 - Afterwards, check the flower on the ground that's near the moogle,
   that is Eksir Berries.


---------------------
< Sunstone Creating >
---------------------

Timing   : After Dreadnought Leviathan
Location : Giza Plains (dry reason)
Rewards  : 1. 200 gil, Holy Stone x1, Potion x2
           2. 150 gil, Holy Stone x1
           3. 100 gil
           4. 50 gil

How to start:
 - Talk to Masyua in the Nomad Camp.
 - Find the Black Crystal marked as ! in the map to raise the energy to 100%,
 - Return Sunstone to Masyua for rewards.


------------------
< The Jaya Stick >
------------------

Timing   : Jahara, Land of Garif
Location : Jahara, Land of Garif
Rewards  : Crossbow, Onion Bolts

How to start:
 - Talk to High-Chief Zayalu (opposite of the shop) to receive the Jaya Stick.
 - Speak with the War-Chief Supinelu at North-West, give him the Jaya Stick.
 - When leaving Jahara, you will be awarded.


--------------------
< Injured Achadian >
--------------------

Timing   : While going to Henne Mines
Location : Ozmone Plains
Rewards  : Alarm Clock x2

How to start:
 - When you return to Ozmone Plains from Eruyt Village, you will find the
   Imperial soldier with his injured friend at the side, near the Save Crystal.
 - Talk to the the soldier and give him a Potion to heal his injured friend.
 - Back to this place later, check the shiny object (letter) on the ground.
 - Obtain Alarm Clock x2 after reading the letter.


--------------------
< Tales exchanging >
--------------------

Timing   : Story reaches to Imperial City of Archades, when need to take cab.
Location : Imperial City of Archades
Rewards  : Sandalwood Chop

 What you need to do is speak with the NPC who gives the tale, then
 find the appointed NPC and send the tale to him/her, and you will be
 awarded with a Pinewood Chop. Collect all 28 Pinewood Chop here and
 trade them to the chop master in any shop for the Sandalwood Chop.
 With the Sandalwood Chop only can you enter the High Terrace.

 Below is the list of them.

--------------------
< The Legend's end >
--------------------

Timing   : After defeating Behemoth King (rank H/VII mob)
Location : Bur Omisace
Rewards  : 500,000 gil, Rod of Faith

How to start:
 - Clear Behemoth King ranked H/VII mob hunt mission.
   (check "7a-2. Mob Hunt" for details)
 - Back to your client in Dalan's Place (Downtown/Lowtown).
   He leaves you a message:

    " And when the watcher of the deepwood should
      fall, ts slayer shall look to the stone-hewn
      wyrm and know joy.

      Though cold stone shall never stir again, a blow
      struck true by slayer's hand shall find warmth in
      the wyrm's elation "

 - Once you've got it, go Mt Bur Omisace/ Temple Approach.
 - Unequip Vaan's weapon and examine the Wyrm Snout on the left, plunder it.
 - Check the shiny object on the ground, they're 500,000 gil and Rod of Faith.


----------------------------------
< Discarded Paper in Henne Mines >
----------------------------------

Timing   : After Pharos at Ridorana
Location : Henne Mines
Rewards  : Megalixir x2

How to start:
 - Clear Mindflayer (rank B/IV) mob hunt mission.
 - Collect 10 Espers.
 - Talk to the geomancer in Jahara to unlock the Henne Mines secret area.

 Ok, a picture worth than 1000 Words, check Henne Mines secret areas map:
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_henne_secret.png

 - Go to the point display as "Hint" to find the discarded paper.
 - Go to the point display as "Spawn after getting hint" to get Megalixir x2.

 .========================|___________________________________________________/
=|   8. Esper / Summon    []_________________________________________________/
 '========================(  /
                       \_/~~'                                            [s080]
 _____________________________________________________________________________
/-----------------------------------------------------------------------------\

The summons of the game are known as 'Esper', when it appears will aid you
in battle. The esper/summon will follow you and fight until its HP down to 0
orreaches the time limit. Esper's level and stats are depend on the summoner,
means leveling up your summoner will increase the stats of the Esper.

To get any of the Espers, you must find it and beat it, some of them even
stronger than final boss. Below are the details and strategies to find all
Espers in the game.

NOTE: No Exp gain by defeating the Esper!

(sort by name)

8-1.
===============================================================================
o------------------------------o
|  1. Adrammelech - the Wroth  |
o------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 1
LP Cost  : 25
Zodiac   : Capricorn
Element  : Thunder
Location : The Zertinan Cavern

#Limit Break - Judgement Bolt

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 39        Atk:      63   |   Recommended: > 40   |
          |  HP: 39630     Def:      29   |   Minimum Lv : > 35   |
          |  LP: 42        Mag Res:  25   |   Average Lv : > 25   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

Can reach this cavern through Nam-Yensa Sandsea, Ozmone Plains or Dalmasca
Westersand. Find the inner area where couldn't display proper in the mini map,
around there will encounter this esper. If you can kill the monsters in the
cavern easily, defeating the esper won't be a problem.

Flying target, plan to use magic, skill and weapons for flying target, since
the esper immune to some ammunitions, so recommend learn Telekinesis before
the fight. Some Shambling Corpses join the battle too. First you can flee from
the battle, then re-enter this section to kill off the corpses before the esper
found you. Equip the armor or shield that're immune to lightning if you have
any, eg: Rubber Suit which can be found in Pharos at Ridorana, or the strongest
shield Zodiac Escutcheon if you have got it.

 --------------------------------------------
 |             Elemental Effects            |
 |------------------------------------------|
 |  Fire    = Immune   |  Water  = Immune   |
 |  Thunder = Absorb   |  Ice    = Weak     |
 |  Wind    = Immune   |  Earth  = Immune   |
 |  Holy    = Immune   |  Dark   = Immune   |
 --------------------------------------------

 ==========================================================================
 |                           Leveling up statistic                        |
 ==========================================================================
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 | Level |  HP Variation  | MP Variation  |  Str. |  Mag. |  Vit. |  Spd. |
 |------------------------------------------------------------------------|
 |  1~10 |   1110 ~ 1268  |    23 ~  70   | 48~53 | 46~51 | 32~34 | 26~28 |
 | 11~20 |   1246 ~ 1556  |    51 ~ 140   | 53~59 | 51~57 | 34~36 | 28~30 |
 | 21-30 |   1491 ~ 1928  |    91 ~ 212   | 59~65 | 57~63 | 36~39 | 30~33 |
 | 31~40 |   1806 ~ 2280  |   132 ~ 302   | 65~71 | 63~69 | 39~41 | 33~35 |
 | 41~50 |   2104 ~ 2845  |   182 ~ 378   | 71~77 | 69~75 | 41~43 | 35~37 |
 | 51~60 |   2580 ~ 3343  |   225 ~ 448   | 77~83 | 75~81 | 43~46 | 37~40 |

8-3.
===============================================================================
o----------------------------------o
|  3. Chaos - Walker of the Wheel  |
o----------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 3
LP Cost  : 90
Zodiac   : Taurus
Element  : Multi
Location : Necrohol Of Nabudis

#Limit Break - Hurricane

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 57        Atk:     155   |   Recommended: > 55   |
          |  HP: 208966    Def:      56   |   Minimum Lv : > 50   |
          |  LP: 60        Mag Res:  37   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

Before you can fight Chaos, you have to go through some little quests and get
the apppointed keys. First of all, go Nabreus Deadlands to trigger the scene
with Ma'Kleou. Afterwards, you need to obtain three fragments, below is the
way for them:

- Clear Wraith (rank E), White Mousse and Orthros (rank A) Mob Hunt missions.
- Return to your client for rewards with the first fragment from Orthros
  mission, Blackened Fragment.

With Sluice Gate Key which get from the reward of White Mousse hunting mission,
back to Garamsythe Waterway, so that you can control the panel. In the central
control section, you can see some spheres there which are the panel of 3rd,
4th, 10th and 11th area waterway. To not be confused, light off all panels
for first, then follow the steps below:
- On No.11 Area Panel. (thats mean light up the panel)
- On No.4 Area Panel.
- Off No.11 Area Panel.
- On No.3 Area Panel.
- Off No.4 Area Panel.
- Now go around South in the same area and find the shiny object on the ground
  which is another fragment that you need, Dull Fragment.
  NOT in the South section, it's still the semi-circle!
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/fragment_gw.jpg

If it's any wrong step you did, just light off all panel and start again.


- In Rabanastre Downtown/Lowtown, head to Old Dalan's Place at South, talk to
  Roh'Kenmou near Dalan.  
- Still in Downtown/Lowtown, around South-East area, talk to Filo.
- Go Rabanastre central section where known as Southern Plaza, talk to the
  Curious Women who's looking at the fountain.
- Now go Bazaar section and speak with all merchants there and ask about the
  Necklace things until you get the answer.
- Head to Magic shop and talk to the Sotted Imperial, the only soldier sitting
  in the left corner, choose first option twice.
- Back down to Downtown/Lowtown and talk to Filo, choose lets go with Filo to
  return to Magic Shop for some events, you will get one more fragment after
  the scene, Grimmy Fragment.

Before leaving for the next quest, back to Old Dalan's Palce in
Downtown/Lowtown, pass all three fragments that you get to Roh'Kenmou,
and he would disappear.

- Since you had already met with Ma'Kleou, now go to The Imperial City Of
  Archades.
- Within the Magic Shop, talk to Roh'Kenmu.
- Move on to Old Archades West section, talk to Otto at the corner for the
  Moonsilver Medallion.
- Return to Imperial City Of Archades, pass the Moonsilver Medallion to
  Roh'Kenmu in Magic Shop.

After the quests above, you're getting closer to the esper. Now,
- Go to Nabreus Deadlands and talk to Ma'Kleou.
- Head to North-West section. Like you hunt Roblon (rank S), you have to go
  through the hidden path. Just go South from the Gate Crystal, following
  section search the North-West area for the path.
- Go until you see something like monument to get Medallion Of Bravery, Love
  and lately obtain the Lusterless Medallion.

Now move to Necrohol Of Nabudis, central West area, use Medallion Of Bravery
to open the Door Of Horrors, defeat Humbaba Boss/Mistant optional boss. Head
to North-East area, use the Medallion Of Love to open the Door Of Loathing and
defeat Fury optional boss. Now the Lusterless Medallion become Mighty. Go to
the central section, use the Medallion Of Might to open the Door of Despair
and battle with this esper.

*about Humbaba Boss/Mistant and Fury, you can look for them under
 "Optional Bosses" section.

Check this map to find out the details of Nabudis:
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_nabudis.png

Use Fury and Humbaba Boss/Mistant as your tests before the fight, if you
couldn't handle these battles well, go train some more before fighting Chaos.
Attack command was sealed, the worst thing. Prepare your Gambit system focus
onto magic and skill uses, Telekinesis (Distance Attack for JP version) skill/
technick is recommended to replace your normal attack, you can buy it from the
secret shop there (Nabudis) after Giruvegan event. As for magic, of cause the
stronger is better, strongest Black Magic is Scathe (Collapse for JP version)
which sell in the secret shop as well, buy it after Pharos at Ridorana if you
need it.

Cast support spell on your party, and recast them for the entire battle when
they're gone, do remember Faith is to raise up the magic power. And needless
to say, Dispel Chaos whenever he has support spells. Take down the 4 elemental
Chaosjets before focus on Chaos. Chaos attacks are pretty stronge, recommend
equip shield for this battle since you don't use any weapon attacks, unless
you're using Telekinesis, so you need stronger weapons to boost up the damage
to Chaos,  if you're not using the Telekinesis technick style, just use the
shields. Chaos can you Silence, and magics are the main attack for now, you
must prepare Gambit to cure Silence all the time. Because of Chaos can absorb
the elemental spells, remember just use the non-element spells to damage him.
If you have lot of gil, use Gil Toss isn't a bad idea. Beside, you can also
send him Slow and Sap.

8-4.
===============================================================================
o--------------------------------------o
|  4. Exodus/Ex-Death - the Judge-Sal  |
o--------------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 2
LP Cost  : 50
Zodiac   : Libra
Element  : none
Location : The Mosphoran Highwaste

#Limit Break - Meteor

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 46        Atk:      97   |   Recommended: > 45   |
          |  HP: 199060    Def:      53   |   Minimum Lv : > 40   |
          |  LP: 52        Mag Res:  35   |   Average Lv : > 28   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

After story reaching to Phon Coast, camp section, back to Mosphoran
Highwaste only you can find this esper. From the Gate Crystal section:

- Prepare some Gysahl Green.
- Activate the South-South Wind Shrine, it's South from the shop.
- Now you can see an exclamation mark in the map screen. Go North-East from
  the Gate Crystal section.
- Give a Gysahl Green to the chocobo so you can ride it.
- Cross over the exclamation mark to West by using that chocobo.
- In West area, activate the West-West Wind Shrine there, then push down the
  rock beside can back to Gate Crystal section.
- Activate North-West Wind Shrine which is around the shop.
- Now you can see two more exclamation marks in the map screen, they're around
  West area, cross over them will reach to the arena.
 
Can't use item for this battle. He has around 100,000 Hp, always like to cast
Reflect. One way to delay him is let one of your character always Dispel his
Reflect, so he will keep recasting it back, then use other characters to hit
him. Just beware of Collapse/Scathe spell which can damage all your characters,
he know to cast Flare and has absorb HP attack as well. Sometimes, he will
build a magic barrier when he was Critical HP.

Since he loves to play with Reflection, if you got some stronge magic like
Scourage, Collapse/Scathe, why not you play Reflect with him. Cast Reflect on
your party, cast Collapse/Scathe on your party. So now you can see even you're
facing an only target, but your spell can strike more then once time on the
opponent, depends on how many active characters you have, each of characters
reflect one strike of the spell. And do remember not cast Curaja and other
support spells on your team, otherwise they will be sent to your opponent,
however, equip Opal Ring for the character who's going to cast these spells
can still works as normal. This trick works with other spell which can damage
all enemies, and of cause it works on many other enemies, bosses fights which
I didn't mention.

8-8.
===============================================================================
o---------------------------------------o
|  8. Queklain/Cuchulainn - the Impure  |
o---------------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 2
LP Cost  : 50
Zodiac   : Scorpio
Element  : Poison
Location : Garamsythe Waterway

#Limit Break - Blight

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 45        Atk:      83   |   Recommended: > 48   |
          |  HP: 126165    Def:      47   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
          |  LP: 50        Mag Res:  31   |   Average Lv : > 30   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

Require finish Wraith (rank E) and White Mousse (rank A) Mob Hunt missions
first, obtain Sluice Gate Key and back here. From the first central area with
the Save Crystal, you should see some spheres here, they're the panels of 3rd,
4th, 10th and 11th area,

- First, switch on No. 3 and 10 Area Panel. (thats mean light up the panel)
- From here to South-West and switch on the No. 1 Area Panel there.
- Back to central, off No. 3 and 10 Area Panel, on No. 4 and 11 Area Panel.
- From here to South-East and switch on another No. 1 Area Panel.
- Back to central, off No. 11 Area Panel, on No. 3 Area Panel.
  Which means No. 3 and 4 Area Panel is on.
- Save your game before the battle, it wasn't an easy fight.
- From here, directly to South, down to the square area to face this esper.

You will get HP decrease in the entire battle, other than Curaja spells, also
prepare some X-potion to heal in case of no MP. Always cure the negative status
such as Immobilize, Disable, Sap and more, and these statuses would be send to
the entire party, means you should have Esunaga spell for this fight. Sometimes
he will Slow all your characters too, just recast Hastega to cover it. But the
main problem is Disable, you should prepare the Black Belt accessory for this,
the nearest shop can buy it is the item & accessory shop in Downtown/Lowtown,
buy one or two from there if you haven't got it. Some Foobar enemies will also
join the battle, should finish off them first. Remember Mist Knack/Quickening
can damage all enemies, make sure be the best combo. Use some Ether to restore
your MP after Mist Knack/Quickening, do it again when you have enough MP. By
the way, you could steal a Scorpio Gem from this esper.

8-10.
===============================================================================
o--------------------------------o
|  10. Ultima - the High Seraph  |
o--------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 3
LP Cost  : 90
Zodiac   : Virgo
Element  : Holy
Location : Crystal Grande/The Great Crystal

#Limit Break - Perfect Ultima/Eschaton

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 63        Atk:     147   |   Recommended: > 60   |
          |  HP: 258001    Def:      61   |   Minimum Lv : > 56   |
          |  LP: 65        Mag Res:  40   |   Average Lv : > 35   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

I strongely recommend to have Sage's Ring and White Mask for this Esper,
aside from them, you need Ring of Renewal, Bubble Belt and Opal Ring for
more advantages.

After Ancient City Of Giruvegan event, back to the Crystal Grande part where
only display a giant crystal in your map. When you just reach Crystal Grande,
you were at teleport VIII, they are several ways to find this esper, I just
list down one of them below, or reference this map for some helps:

(check the second link if the first link doesn't work)
db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_crystal_grande_upper.png
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/crystal_map.jpg

- From VIII you can see three ways here, one is up, one is down and another one
  was sealing by Gate Scorpio. Head to the up way and push the switch for Gate
  Scorpio. Now will start encounter some tough enemies on the way to the Ultima
  battle.
- Back to VIII and unseal the Gate Scorpio, then cross over it.
- Reach to IX, use it to X.
- From X, following the only way here will reach XX.

- XX platform has two sealing Gate Sagittarius, one way down, two ways up,
  another way is where you come from.
- From where you come to XX, go to the opposite way which is leads you down,
  continue until the end and push the switch for Gate Sagittarius, then back
  to XX within time limit.
- Unseal the Gate Sagittarius 2nd in XX platform, then cross over it.
- Reach to XII, just use it will come to XIV.

- In XIV platform, follow the leading to up way. Next platform push the switch
  for Gate Leo, then back to XIV. (time counting)
- From XIV, take the way to down.
- Until third platform the way branch to two, one leads to Gate Leo 2nd,
  another one is to Excalibur treasure (now you couldn't get it, return
  here later). Just follow the up way to unseal Gate Leo 2nd.
- Here can see two more ways and a Gate Gemini, take anyone of the ways here
  will reach XV, take it to XVI.

- In XVI platform, follow the middle way will see the switch for Gate Libra.
  (take note on your own for here, you will back here later)
  Push the switch and back to XVI.
- From where you back to XVI, take the right way, it should leads you up.
- Next platform, unseal the Gate Libra 1st and cross that way.
- Now reach to a platform with three ways. From where you come, go to leftern
  way which also leads up.
- Push the switch for Gate Capricorn, return to XVI. (time counting)
- In XVI, take the only going down way will see Gate Capricorn 1st, pass it
  come to switch for Gate Virgo, here is also a sealing Gate Aquarius.
- Push the switch for Gate Virgo (time counting) then return to XVI.
- In XVI, head to the middle way which leads to Libra switch.
- From Libra switch, follow the down way will see two sealing gate in next
  platform. Just unseal the Gate Virgo 2nd.
- Next section, from where you come, go to the right way which leads to up.
- Use XVII will reach XVIII.

- In XVIII platform, follow the only way here will see a Save Crystal in next
  section.
- Save Crystal section, here got three more ways. From where you come, left way
  goes to the switch for Gate Aquarius, right way leads to teleport XIX which
  warp back to XX, follow to the middle will battle against Ultima.

Phew, finally...

The esper has a bit more than 250,000 HP, defeat this esper will gain 65 LP.
She will cast Holyja after 12 attacks, the 12 attacks including normal attack
and Destrustion (named Redemption for US version). Like other Espers, her most
powerful elemental move, Holyja could heavily damage all characters by using
Holy elemental. Equip White Mask or Sage's Ring to absorb the Holyja, needless
to say, don't use Holy spell because it can heal the esper. As for her special
move, Destrustion/Redemption can deal large damage on one character, however,
Ultima won't use the Destrustion/Redemption to the character who has equiped
the White Mask or Sage's Ring since these equipments absorb Holy. You can lure
Ultima to use Destrustion/Redemption by unequiping White Mask or Sage's Ring,
pay attention on the information message on the top left screen, once Ultima
has targetted on the character with Destrustion/Redemption, equip White Mask
or Sage's Ring to absorb it. Do remember you can always change you equipments,
this trick goes for Holyja as well, if Sage's Ring and White Mask are not your
best equipments, you can just equip them only when the Holyja is ready, change
back the equipments that you like after Holyja.

I know it's an annoying way on changing equipment in the battle, but sometimes
you do have to do that for certain status. As later Ultima cast Reflect on to
all characters, now make sure you don't stupidly heal your team with Curaja or
other healing spells before your healer has equiped Opal Ring. And be sure you
don't heal your ally when the Reverse status is sent from the Holyja.

When Ultima HP down to around 70%, you will get HP decrease, MP decrease,
then following with battle commands will be sealing one after one.
Here is the arrangement:
-HP decrease-> MP->decrease-> Attack-> Magic-> Skill-> Item-> Magnet-> *repeat

When Ultima HP down to 50%, she will use Holyja after each 7 attacks instead
of 12 attacks at the beginning. So you might have to speed up your equipments
changing, and Ring of Renewal is recommended during the Magic seal period.
Again, just to remind, always equip White Mask or Sage's Ring to absorb the
Holyja and Destrustion/Redemption.

 |  Thunder = Immune   |  Ice    = Immune   |
 |  Wind    = Immune   |  Earth  = Immunes  |
 |  Holy    = Absorb   |  Dark   = Weak     |

8-11.
===============================================================================
o---------------------------------o
|  11. Zalera - the Death Seraph  |
o---------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 1
LP Cost  : 25
Zodiac   : Gemini
Element  : Death
Location : Barheim Passage

#Limit Break - Condemation

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 40        Atk:      62   |   Recommended: > 40   |
          |  HP: 72248     Def:      39   |   Minimum Lv : > 30   |
          |  LP: 42        Mag Res:  25   |   Average Lv : > 22   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

Require Barheim Key to return this place. More details of getting Barheim Key,
read "Back to Barheim Passage" section.

At where you back from Dalmasca Eastersand, go to North. Turn to West in the
section before Gate Crystal, then head to North-West passage. After there, you
will reach to the long railway at West known as Zeviah Span, follow the railway
to South, on the way you have to push down the broken wagon to unlock the new
path. A Save Crystal at South-West area just before the esper fight, continue
to West from the Save Crystal will reach to No.7 Terminus, where the Zalera
esper is waiting.

Time limit within five minutes, it's no time for you to play the long battle,
and some undead enemies will join the battle, it's quite hard if your team is
below 40 level. Prepare your Gambit for healing the bad statuses like Blind,
Disable and Sleep. Dispel on the esper at beginning, and you can try use Slow
as well. He/she will send you some negative status, and beware of the instant
kill, prepare Arise or Phoenix Down. Before you clear all undeads around, you
can't deal damage to Zalera (but I can still dealing damage to Zalera by using
Golden Axe). You can also try the Reflection trick like Exodus Esper battle if
you have stronger spells like Collapse/Scathe, but don't use elemental spells.
Like serveral special enemies, Zalera can also send Break, Disable and Sleep
according to your level, for easier the battle, make sure your characters are
not at the level that could be infected by the bad statuses below.

Level 4 Break can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 4,
eg: level 4, 8, 12, 16...
Level 3 Disable can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 3,
eg: level 3, 6, 9, 12...
Level 2 Sleep can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 2,
eg: level 2, 4, 6, 8, 10...

8-12.
===============================================================================
o----------------------------------o
|  12. Zeromus - Convicted Tyrant  |
o----------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 2
LP Cost  : 50
Zodiac   : Cancer
Element  : Gravity
Location : The Stilshrine Of Miriam

#Limit Break - Big Bang

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 51        Atk:     103   |   Recommended: > 52   |
          |  HP: 166888    Def:      53   |   Minimum Lv : > 45   |
          |  LP: 55        Mag Res:  35   |   Average Lv : > 30   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

After the battle in Mt. Bur Omisace, talk to an elder outside this building
to get Stone Of The Condemner. Back to Stilshrine Of Miriam, and check the
Way Stone inside the main hall, then use Stone Of The Condemner on it will
to into a secret room, exit from the room will face this esper.

You can't cast any spells in this battle, make sure prepare more useful items
before entering the battle, recommend 40 X-Potion in stock, equip Power Armlet
or Ring of Renewal accessory. Also prepare Chronos Tear for curing Stop if you
don't have the Power Armlet, and prepare some Antidote for curing Poison, and
it's the time to spend your Hastega Mote as well. Don't use Bubble or your
character lost more HP from the Gravity.

Many annoying enemies keep on spawn around, you must be very good in physical
attack. Now your Mist Knack/Quickening is very useful, can't avoid from using
items to restore your MP to do more Mist Knack/ Quickening, however, if you
have higher defense point or shield evasion,  you can easily block off the
attack from the undeads,  so equip the armors which raise your defense and
evasion. Remember finish off him faster when he left lesser HP, like common
bosses, him will be stronger when lower HP. Another way is the Gil Toss, but
it works well only if you got lot of gil. By the way, set Gambit to heal with
X-Potion on the character less than 60% is recommended.

 |  Holy    = Half     |  Dark   = Half     |

8-13.
===============================================================================
o-------------------------------------------------o
|  13. Zodiac/Elidibus - The King Of Commandment  |
o-------------------------------------------------o

Mist Lv  : 3
LP Cost  : 200
Zodiac   : Serpentarius
Element  : Dark
Location : Henne Mines

#Limit Break - Last Eclipse

          .--------- Esper Stats ---------.--- Lv to challenge ---.
          |  Lv: 66        Atk:     201   |   Recommended: > 70   |
          |  HP: 336847    Def:      61   |   Minimum Lv : > 65   |
          |  LP: 70        Mag Res:  40   |   Average Lv : > 45   |
          '-------------------------------'-----------------------'

Must have at least 10 espers and finish Mind Flayer mob hunt mission (rank B),
go Land Of The Garif and find the geomancer to get some info, he is located at
opposite from the Item Shop. Back to Henne Mines, go North from Gate Crystal,
now you can see the gate to East has been open up. Follow the path to the
secret area, you can also get the map here, but the map doesn't show all the
ways here. There is not save point from the Gate Crystal, and the enemies are
pretty stronge, don't fight with this esper if you can't defeat those enemies
here. Within the secret area, you can see a section around North, something
like oval shape, Zodiac is waiting you there.

- Here is the arena
http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v515/sephiroth_y/Guide/zodiac.jpg

For this battle, you must have lot of HP and great in speed, strongly
recommend to use Bubble spell, or equip Bubble Belt which can double your HP,
also prepare Demon Shield, Black Mask and lot of Pheonix Down for this battle.

At the beginning, Zodiac will present you his powerful skill, Darkja. It could
deals large damage and Death touch to all your character, means this move could
kill all your characters in once. After Darkja, it might perform other skill
like Vanish Ray or attack to your remaining characters, be sure to revive your
character before it does the attack. Of cause, equipments which could block or
absorb Dark element are recommended, must equip them to all characters.

During the battle, Zodiac will cast Faith and Bravery itself, Dispel it before
he does any attack, because when it has Faith, its Collapse/Scathe can be very
dangerous. Try keep Dispeling it whenever it's casting Faith and Brave, I've
noticed it will recast them before attack, but Zodiac can cast them very fast,
so you should start to cast Dispel during the Faith or Brave status is coming
to support Zodiac.

Looks like pretty easy to reduce its HP, but the worst thing is when almost
defeated it, Zodiac knows to build full barrier as well. During its barrier
period, there is nothing you can do other than defend, pay attention either
magic or physical barrier has gone, blast him whatever you can. Becareful of
its Reflect if you going to cast spell or just equip Opal Ring. Times that you
can hurt it before the next perfect barrier is very short, so don't waste the
chance, but you should give up attacks if your characters need to heal. Zodiac
weaks against Holy, but from the first barrier it puts, it will also change its
elemantal weakness. Other than this, Darkja will come faster during Zodiac in
lower HP. Since you have at least 10 espers, just summon one of it to block the
Darkja if you haven't prepared.

The first half of the battle, Zodiac would also use the Level statuses skill
like the Gilgamesh rank H/VII mob hunt second battle and Zalera Esper fight.

Level 4 Break can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 4,
eg: level 4, 8, 12, 16...
Level 3 Disable can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 3,
eg: level 3, 6, 9, 12...
Level 2 Sleep can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 2,
eg: level 2, 4, 6, 8, 10...

Back here later if you can't beat it. Recommend at least three characters are
over 70, is better at level 71, and hopefully got a character with around
40 level for back up.

|  Zodiac      |  Final Eclipse  | Summoner within Stone status.              |
|              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
|              |  Scathe         | When more than one target spotted.         |
|              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
|              |  Flare          | If the target can absorb/immune Dark.      |
|              |--------------------------------------------------------------|
|              |  Banish Ray     | When target spotted/weak against Dark.     |

BOSS : Demon Wall
HP   : 22,187

Easy words, this is the "first Demon Wall" in Tomb Of Raithwall, the one
without any torches at the side and the distance of the bridge is shorter.
Needless to say, this is stronger than second Demon Wall which the one you
must defeat to pass through the story. If you can't beat it for the first
encounter, just back here after you have defeated Belias.

Since the Demon Wall likes to send you Blind, so prepare some Eye Drops, but
it's much better you have bought the Argyle Armlet BEFORE entering the tomb,
and equip this accessory in the battle to prevent Blind. Recommend at least
have 3 characters learned Mist Knack/Quickening, the more characters learned
it, the easier this battle will become. Like the other Demon Wall, it can
remove your ally from the battle, so you better use the Mist Knack/Quickening
earlier of the battle, hopefully it can reduce Demon Wall's HP down to half.
Continue blast the Demon Wall with your physical attack, or try to Berserk
your ally who's strongest physical attack to make more powerful damage.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Earth Tyrant/Earth Dragon
HP   : 71,000

After passed the event in Tomb Of Raithwall, back to Dalmasca Westersand, go
to North-East, you will see a dragon going through the sand storm. Now:

- Back to Westgate of Rabanastre City, talk to the bangaa Rimzat.
- Still in Rabanastre City, head to the central section and talk to Cotze,
  he is in the fountain.
- Go to Downtown, around Storehouse No.5, talk to the man named Northon, he is
  crouching beside the bangaa.
- Back to Dalmasca Westersand, go find the Dynast-Cactoid in the Eastern
  section before you reach to the Gate Crystal, where known as Windtrace Dunes.
  It's located in the smaller site, so you should go there from the South area.
- Check on the inner Dynast-Cactoid of this section for the Wind Globe.

- Return to Westgate of Rabanastre City, now those NPCs who giving you
  the mission should be there. Speak with them to get Windvane.
- Now move to North-East section of Dalmasca Westersand, you're able to cross
  the sand storm.

Becareful when the boss perform the Air Screw which can damage all characters.
Normal attack not that powerful, tail attacks even weaker as long as you have
character with shield. But also don't forget always heal your characters before
anyone of them KO. Slow spell does work for this boss, but also you might miss
it sometimes. When it has less then half of the life bar, it will auto increase
the defend, just spend some times to finish off it. Anyway, this could be some
challenges if your characters are around level 30.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Bomb King
HP   : 37596

From the Gate Crystal of Salikawood, go North will encounter this boss.

Some mini bombs join with the boss, beware of their self-destruction, but
you can kill them before they explode. Remember to cure oil status before the
boss flame you. It will fully restore its HP when it left around half of the
life bar, before it restore HP, mostly it will goes far from you. But after few
times it will stop restoring HP for a while. This boss also knows to spawn new
mini bomb to help itself. Not much HP for this boss, a good Mist Knack combo
can cut off half of its life bar.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Phoenix
HP   : around 150,000

Return to Pharos At Ridorana, take the elevator in main hall to bottom level.
Subterra-Origin In Darkness, B1F, but shown as 77F. To go next bottom level,
you must collect enough Black Pearls to fill in the Altars in each corner.
Before that, enter to North-East corner section at B1F (Penumbra), there is a
fake wall at the inner area, hit it to open the hidden place. Follow the place
till the central North, you should have opened 2 ancient doors before you can
found this boss.

It's a flying target, is better you get Telekinesis skill from Nabudis secret
shop for this. Replace Telekinesis to your normal attack for the entire fight.
If you had follow the walkthrough, you should done the Urutan Yensa sub event
in Ogir and Nam Yensa before the Garuda battle, and using the Eskir Berries on
the Garuda is to weaken down its stats. Same thing on this boss, you can head
back to Nam Yensa where you got the Eskir Berries, examine the flower at the
same point to obtain another Eskir Berries. This boss is like Garuda, the giant
bird you fought in front Tomb Of Raithwall, but sure this is much more stronger
than that, just use the Eskir Berries to weaken it. But it still has powerful
attack, and the agility is not bad at all. Don't always stand still, it could
attacks you up to six hits in one turn. Send it Dispel at the beginning, then
send Blind immediately after Dispel. Once Phoenix has got the Blind status, it
will almost miss all the attacks. Equip shield could helps lot.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Shadowseer/Darkness God
HP   : 278,078

One of the clan's Mob Hunt mission from Monblanc which named 'The Seer'. This
mission will show after completing various mob hunt from Clan HQ, it's rank S. 

When you're handling this mission, back to Pharos at Ridorana after the events. 
So now an elevator available in 1F, take it to underground B1F. Now you have to
collect enough Black Pearls from killing monsters, fill those Black Pearls onto
the Altars at four different corner to get to lower floors. Below is the number
of Black Pearls for each Altar before to the bottom level.
(defeat Phoenix optional boss at B1F)

  B1F - South-West  6, South-East  3, North West  9, North-East 18
  B2F - South-West 18, South-East 15, North West  9, North-East 15
  B3F - South-West 12, South-East 27, North West 21, North-East 15

Also defeat the Phoenix optional boss above at B1F while you're going through.
Once you have done, take the elevator to Unknown Goal which is the most bottom.
You can't escape from the fight, better back up to save before fight against
this dude.

The boss knew many spells included elemental or non-elemental, normally
he will show them later. Cast support spells on your party before entering
the arena.

1. Beginning
The boss has Immobilize status in his normal attack. Other, he will use
Darkness and Shining Ray randomly, both of them deals large damage on your
characters in an area. You can equip those Dark element absorber such as
Demon Shield, Black Mask to absorb the Darkness, for Shining Ray which is
Holy element, you can equip those Holy absorber such as Sage's Ring and the
White Mask to absorb it. If you don't mind to always change your equipments,
just pay attention when he's charging Darkness, equip those Dark element
absorber, when he's charging Shining Ray, change to Holy element absorber.
Remember cast Dispel to him for the first.

2. Facing other bosses - 1
When the boss leaves around 75% HP, he will summon out Pandaemonium, Slyt,
Fenrir which you fought in each Ascent, and Phoenix optional boss which you
fought in Subterra B1F. Now you can hit Shadowseer/Darkness God since he has
builded up the barrier, all you need to do is focus to defeat other bosses one
by one. During this moment, pay attention on what was Shadowseer/Darkness God
is going to do, he will keep on attacking your team with different move, the
worst thing is will blow off your MP anytime. Normally this boss would invert
your HP/MP after your MP get drained, if he doesn it, your will be switch at
very low HP or even death. Use Charge (technick/skill) to refill a little MP
before Invert came. Use X-Potion to recover instantly after you get inverted
since item is always faster than spell. After that you should have full MP,
so cast Curaja and other useful spells before your MP was drained again.

3. Facing other bosses - 2
Another annoying move is Curse, which will send you some very bad statuses.
Equip Ribbon for your healer when he readies Curse (be sure always read the
information message on the top left screen), once the Curse sent, cast Esunaga
to cure your party. If you didn't get Ribbon before, better set a Gambit to use
Smelling Salts for everyone. The toughest part is Fenrir summoned, I recommend
use a shield to block Fenrir attack, although you can't block every single hit,
but at least you would get lesser attacks from him. As for Phoenix, Dispel and
send it Blind status. Like mentioned on the Phoenix boss strategy, the faster
you sent the Blind, the easier this will become.

4. Final showdown
After all, Darkness God's barrier should be gone, attack him again. Since its
name call Darkness God, no doubt for using Holy, Excalibur could help lot too.
Remember, the damage of each weapon attack to the Shadowseer/Darkness God will
be returned 7% on your own, let say your damage is 5000, your character will
get 350 damage him/herself. As his HP getting lesser, his defence power will
be highly increased, but if you continue attack him with all your best weapons
with a healer support this fight should be done safely, just take a little
longer to reduce his remaining HP.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Fury
HP   : around 52,000

One of the two bosses that you must fight before gain Chaos esper. For more
details about the ways to get this battle, you can look for Chaos - The King Of
Reincarnation under "Esper/Summon" section.

Dispel all supporting spells whenever Fury recast them. It's not much HP, one
Mist Knack/Quickening combo can cut off a half of its life bar. When Fury's HP
down half, it will use Bucchas's Wine, if you had Dispel the berserk status, it
will repeat using Bucchas's Wine again, even would cancel any attack just for
using Bucchas's Wine, this is a way you can delay Fury to make more advantages
on your ally. Another way is by using the area space, when Fury targeting on
your leader, run further from Fury and let other characters to attack it. Fury
can increase its defensive power and chance of evasion when it starts using
Bucchas's Wine as you can see many "PARRY", keep you Mist Knack/Quickening to
kill it off, or just use the Dispel tactic till the battle end. Besides, you
can also send Sap, Silence and Slow effect to this boss.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Humbaba Boss/Humbaba Mistant
HP   : around 308,000

One of the two bosses that you must fight before gain Chaos esper. For more
details about the ways to get this battle, you can look for Chaos - King Of
Reincarnation under "Esper/Summon" section.

Compare to Fury, this boss deals slightly lesser damage for normal attack,
but the special skill is still dangerous. Dispel him at the beginning, you
can also send Sap, Silence and Slow to him, Silence doesn't matter, but make
sure send him a Slow status. Same as other battle, heal and cure your ally
in the entire battle, use Protect to reduce the physical damage. Things that
you should pay attention are the moment when the boss is near dead, he seems
like very easy to perform a series of combo hits. Cure Immobilize and Disable
status as soon as possible because he can attack your character many times in
a turn when the character with Immobilize status.

After defeating this boss, you will get the map for Necrohol Of Nabudis.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Gilgamesh
HP   : 123,103

One of the clan's Mob Hunt mission from Monblanc which named 'Mysterious Man'.
This mission will show after completing various mob hunt from Clan HQ,
it's rank H/VII. 

Once you handle this mission, back to Lhusu Mines. From the Gate Crystal, move
to West will encounter him on the bridge. Other than Gilgamesh, you were also
face against his beast, Enkidou.

Before anything, just to inform that you could steal Genji Shield on his
4th form (less than 45% HP) and Genji Gloves on his last from (when he start
to builds full barrier). This is the only chance that you could get these two
equipments, if you miss it, you will never get them anymore. About his form
changing, you will see a scene and he will change a different sword, start
from second form, it's very easy to be noticed.

Dispel Enkidou for the first, defeat it before you focus on Gilgamesh. You can
send Slow to Gilgamesh, other status didn't work on him. Once he's got certain
amount of damage, he will change his attack style. In each form, try to steal
something from him, you might get some potions, be sure you steal Genji Shield
during his 4th form. Also make sure you steal the Genji Gloves from his last
form, this equipment can increase your attack combo. Also when he is in the
last form, he will build up the perfect barrier by coming out with his special
attack, Ultimate Illusion. Now you can't do anything other than defend, recast
the support spells when anyone of them gone. After he does Ultimate Illusion
for the second time, the barrier will gone. Now Dispel him and continue your
attacks. Again, make sure you have stole the Genji Gloves before end the
battle.



BOSS : Gilgamesh
HP   : 473,246

After the first fight, Gilgamesh will run to Site 7 which is South-East most
of the mines. Before you can reach there, you must clear Antlion (rank A/V)
mission, then back to Phon Coast Gate Crystal area, go North-West can see two
men there, take the shinning thing beside the sitting man which is the key of
Site 11. With the key, you now can get to South-East area of the mines. Before
the arena, you should see a Save Crystal.

For this fight, you could steal Genji Helmet and Genji Armor on his last two
forms like before. Remember, you can't get these equipments from any other way.
Other things that's recommended are Bubble Belt, Genji Gloves with Greatsword,
Ninja Sword or Katana, and other best equipment that you currently have, also
make sure to always recast Bubble for those who're not to equip Bubble Belt.

Now he is more stronger than the first fight, and Slow doesn't work on him
anymore. And he will send Disable, Sleep and Break/Petrify from time to time,
actually all these statuses can be avoided, it depends on your character level.
Let say the Break, it's belong to Lv.4, and the indication of "Lv.4" means this
status can only be affected on the character who's at the multiple level of 4.
For example, character at level 52, 56, 60, 64 ...  will 100% get this status
unless this character has equiped certain accessory to prevent it. Same theory
goes to Disable and Sleep statuses, which are only affect on the characters at
the multiple level of 2 and 3. So is better you get a perfect level that is not
at the multiple of 2, 3 and 4 before the fight, recommend get to Lv 55, 59, 61.
Of cause there're lot more levels are no at the multiple of 2, 3, 4, if you get
higher, the battle should be more easier.

At the beginning, Dispel on Enkidou/Enkidu and defeat it immediately like the
first fight, but there's a problem when Enkidou/Enkidu in Critical status, you
will probably miss alot attacks with you weapon, I suggest use the gun type
weapon like Fomalhaut, Antares.., whatever the best guns that you have for now
since the gun type weapons have 100% accurate ratio. When your enemy is down
to Gilgamesh, change back the best weapons that you used.

Gilgamesh will send you some status at the beginning, beware of Disable, he
will send it to all your characters, probably some will miss depends on your
characters level as mentioned above or read below for some details. Likewise,
Gilgamesh will change fighting style when his HP down to certain level, you can
steal some more Genji equipments on his last two form as well, the equipments
are Genji Helm and Genji Armor, be sure you don't miss them. His normal attack
send Stop to your characters, thought the chance is low, but you must care of
it, prepare to heal this negative status.  When he's down to around 20% HP, he
will put up the Sword of Legend in a special scene, now stop everything, try to
Dispel him before he perform Monarch Sword special move. Start from his first
Monarch Sword, he will build the perfect barrier again, you have to wait his
second Monarch Sword for the barrier gone.  Just now if you had successfully
Dispel him before the perfect barrier, now you don't have to defensse yourself
against him with the Bravery, Haste and more support spells. Now just recast
all support spells on your team if anyone of them gone, keep you eyes on the
second Monarch Sword, it can deal a large damage on a single character. Revive
your character with Arise before Gilgamesh attack the next character, since his
chance of combo will be highly increased when he within the Critical status.
After that, continue your attack when his barrier has gone,  don't forget to
Dispel him if he has recast any support spell.

Level 4 Break can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 4,
eg: level 4, 8, 12, 16...
Level 3 Disable can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 3,
eg: level 3, 6, 9, 12...
Level 2 Sleep can only affects on the characters with level multiple of 2,
eg: level 2, 4, 6, 8, 10...

If you're interesting to know more about his weapons, you can check the
separate guide here:

http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_gilgamesh.txt

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu
HP   : around 8,500,000

Located in Sochen Cave Palace, the West area. Before you can enter the arena,
here are the things that you need to do:

- Clear Vyraal (rank A) Mob/Mark Hunt mission, after getting the rewards and
  give the Viera Rucksack which dropped by Vyraal to your client, she will
  give you the Dragon Scale.
- Now head to Cerobi Steppe, find the windmill in the North-East section where
  you hunt the Vyraal.
- Examine windmill No.10 to trigger a scene, then pass Dragon Scale to that
  NPC for Ageworn Key.
- Return to Sochen Cave Palace, go to the section just after the five ways
  area, there is also the section before the boss. You can see in your map
  it's a circle area with a cross in the central (Destiny's March), you have
  to run through the circle follow the clockwise. And you must reach here from
  South, enter the circle area from East, then go South > West > North > East,
  if you do so, the road to the arena will be unlock.
- Now enter to the door to West section, use the Ageworn Key to unlock the
  arena.

This boss has lot of HP, make sure set up your gambit system for this long
battle. There is a trick to beat this boss without pressure, you can actually
flee from the battle to heal your party, back to the battle later, and it
won't restore the HP.

If you decided to have a long battle without escaping, you should get your
main team characters over 65 level or at least 60 level with some recommended
equipments below, the more of these equipments you have, the easier this
battle will become. And the equipments are:
 - Weapon: Excalibur, Masamune, Golden Axe/Scorpion Tail, Whale Whisker...
 - Acc.  : Ribbon/Power Armlet, Bubble Belt, Sage's Ring, Hermes Sandals...
 - Item  : Phoenix Down >20, Chronos Tear >30, Gold Needle >30...
 - Other : Golden Skullcap, Maximillian, Mirage Vest, Magepower Shishak,
           Brave Suit, Demon Shield, Zodiac Escutcheon...
Note:
 Shield doesn't have much usage actually, the Demon Shield, Zodiac Escutcheon
 are for you to block the Dark and Thunder spells from Hell Wyrm in case of
 your strategy is not stable under certain situations.

The Decoy idea from Wesley Watson is quite good, and I've slightly changed
the tactic to be easier. This is a long battle, althought you can use the
Decoy + Reverse tactic, but don't recommend to use it for the entire battle.
Anyway, here is my Gambit setup for this battle.

 --------------------------------------- *Note:
 | Character 1: Fran   (attack)        |   - Character 1, Gambit 3
 |  1. Ally: Any       = Phoenix Down  |      Cancel this Gambit if you have
 |  2. Ally: Any       = Chronos Tear  |      this character with Brave Suit.
 |  3. Ally: Fran      = Bravery*      |
 |  4. Ally: Any       = Bubble        |   - Character 2, Gambit 7
 |  5. Ally: HP <50%   = Curaja        |      Use this Gambit only if your
 |  6. Self: MP <10%   = Charge        |      team is weak on Def.
 |  7. Foe : lowest HP = Attack        |
 |                                     |  Hell Wyrm is weak against Holy,
 | Character 2: Ashe   (lure)          |  needless to say, Excalibur deals
 |  1. Ally: Ashe      = Decoy         |  the largest damage to this boss.
 |  2. Ally: Any       = Arise         |  Cast a Bravery to the ally with
 |  3. Ally: Any       = Chronos Tear  |  Excalibur can send the maximum
 |  4. Self: HP <60%   = Curaga        |  damage to Hell Wyrm.
 |  5. Self: MP <10%   = Charge        |
 |  6. Ally: Any       = Bubble        |  As for Reverse, you can cast it on
 |  7. Ally: Any       = Protectga*    |  your Decoyed character when he/she
 |  8. Foe : lowest HP = Attack        |  in full or over 80% HP, so basically
 |                                     |  you don't need to worry on casting
 | Character 3: Penelo  (attack/mage)  |  healing spell on the character with
 |  1. Ally: Ashe      = Decoy         |  Reverse status.
 |  2. Ally: Any       = Arise         |
 |  3. Ally: Any       = Chronos Tear  |  When Hell Wyrm down to 25% HP, it'll
 |  4. Ally: HP <50%   = Curaja        |  use Invert each two turns,  it's to
 |  5. Ally: Any       = Gold Needle   |  switch between  your HP and MP. You
 |  6. Ally: Any       = Hastega       |  can simply use  Renew  on this ally
 |  7. Ally: Any       = Bubble        |  manually. Better start casting Renew
 |  8. Self: MP <10%   = Charge        |  before the effect of Invert is sent,
 |  9. Foe : lowest HP = Attack        |  so you should able to heal  before
 ---------------------------------------  the  next attack from  Hell Wyrm.

The Judgement move is the strongest attack from Hell Wyrm, but it doesn't show
this much, but when it performs this move, you might be killed after a short
while. Make use to cure the Stop from this move, and it's better if you have
accessory to prevents it. Anyway, this move seems to destroy the whole arena,
but doesn't mean this move can attack everyone in the arena. Like common area
magic, Judgement is a skill to attack all target in an area, if you're out of
this area, you will not take any damage. During my battle, Ashe is supposely
to be the target of Hell Wyrm most of the time, I just move a character away
from Ashe to evade the Judgement, so probably this character will escape from
the Judgement area. To make things easier, just move a character to the back
of Hell Wyrm for all the time.

One more additional note is remember that you can always change your equipment,
equip Demon Shield or Black Mask when Hell Wyrm use Darkga, equip Flame Shield
to block Firage and so on... if you like it.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Yiazmat
HP   : around 50,000,000

The last Mob Hunt mission, it's located in Ridorana Cataract, the round section
at South where knowing as Colosseum. You must complete all other Mob Hunt
mission and defeat Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu optional boss, then back to Clan HQ
and talk to Montblanc to receive this mission.

#- General Strategy
It's like a enhanced version of Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu (above), and you can run
away anytime like Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu fight. With everything for the Hell Wyrm/
Majinryuu battle (except the weapon has some changes), and your main team raise
above than 70 level, you can fight this boss in a long period without escaping.
However, Yiazmat's weakness is Dark and it can absorb Holy, so Excalibur should
be keep away from this fight.

  Some weapons which are not using in the Hell Wyrm battle,
   - Yagyuu Darkblade or Orochi, Fomalhaut + Dark Shot

Basically, you can just use the Gambit setup for Hell Wyrm/Majinryuu (above),
just to add some Gambit to cure other negative statuses, be prepared to cure
Petrify, Stop, Sap. Also prepare some Phoenix Down and Arise spell to revive
your team from time to time since Yiazmat will use Deathstrike to your team
randomly. But I've noticed Yiazmat likes to use it when the spotted character
is near or at the staircase, so if you hate Deathstrike, don't stay at the
staircase, fight it at the stage. Sometimes, Death Strike gives you a little
benefit since it takes Yiazmat longer time to recover, means Yiazmat needs a
few more second to start its next more if it does perform Deathstrike on you.

Later, the Death attack come even faster, maybe Arise would be useless, just
keep on using the Phoenix Down to revive your ally. After half of its life,
its defence and attack power will be raised. Same time, it might cast Reflecga
spell to you, make sure you don't cast the healing spells when you got Reflect
status. To reduce the damage of Cyclone Tornado, you can equip the Windbreaker
(light equipment) when it's going for this move, it can reduce 50% damage of
Wind elemantal attack. Since it's like Hell Wyrm, so you can flee from the
battle and heal your party on the Save Crystal, just be sure Yiazmat is not
in Regen status when you leave.

#- Overwall attack trick
But there's a little trick to trap Yiazmat and attack him without worring much.
Everything has already mentioned in 7a-2 Mob Hunt section, check it out for
the details, and here is the basic steps to trap it:

http://
s157.photobucket.com/albums/t43/sephirosuy/Yiazmat/?action=view&current=s01.jpg

You can actually use this trick for 95% of the battle. Only problem is when
Yiazmat down the 2 life bar (1 red dot left under his HP bar), he will restore
his HP, so this trick doesn't work anymore, you have to close combat to stop
him from restoring HP. And it's not a Regen, so yuo can't Dispel it. So be
sure you save your game when Yiazmat remains 2 life bars.

Again, this is a tough boss, by using the overwall attack technique, you can
be at lower levels like 65~70 since he can't attack you. But in the end, you
will eventually fight him face to face, and you should be at least 75 level.
Only attack and cure isn't a good idea unless you're over 90 level, you can
have a try for the tough fight like other bosses. Or else, I recommend either
use Decoy + Reverse tactic or use Reverse to all character during the fight,
means transfer Yiazmat's powerful attack to heal your team, that's the reason
of using Reverse.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOSS : Omega Mk.XII
HP   : around 12,000,000?

Before plan to face this boss, you must unlock Yiazmat Mob Hunt mission and
collect all Esper, or defeat Yiazmat and collect 10 Espers? Go Crystal Grande
(The Great Crystal) upper layer, please reference to this map,

db.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/file/final_fantasy_xii_crystal_grande_upper.png

Since you've went through this map on the road to Ultima Esper fight, you
should have unsealed some of the gate in Map 3. If you left the Crystal Grande,
all the '1st' gates will reseal, so you need to unseal the gates if required.

Now you need to unseal Gate Taurus 1st to reach the arena. Just get back to
the Save Crystal at Map 4 through the teleport XX...

- Push the swtich for Gate Aquarius.
- Return to Map 3 through the teleport XVIII
- Unseal the Gate Aquarius 1st (base on how you unseal the gate when you're
  going to Ultima Esper fight, just make sure to unseal Gate Virgo and Libra
  2nd.)
- Now push the switch for Gate Capricorn, then unseal Gate Capricorn 2nd.
- Back to switch for Gate Taurus and push it, rush to Gate Taurus 1st and
  unseal it.
- Take XXI to the arena.

Omega Mk.XII's attack style is nothing special, the difficulty is the damage
amount of Omega, each hit might kill one of your characters, with its higher
speed, this boss can kill your team within a minute. Recommend cast Reverse
and Decoy on one character for the entire battle, so Omega will keep 'healing'
one of your character for the entire battle.

Reverse is to turn over the damage and healing amount, Decoy is provoke enemy
focus to attack one target, so if the character has both these spells' in once,
Omega will  only attack  this character,  same time its damage will heal that
character. Make sure set two other characters' Gambit to keep recasting Reverse
and Decoy when they're gone, also keep Haste on these two characters to speed
up casting the spells. For more easier, equip Hermes Sandals for the character
who's position to cast Reverse or Decoy. Another thing is avoid to use any
elemant attack on this boss. When Omega's HP leave around 20%, its defence
and attack power will be raised automatically, but if you can keep with the
tactic above, it doesn't become a problem. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

When you have learned any magic and skill from the Licence Board, you're not
able to use it before you own the magic stuffs.

This section is about the selling locations of all magic and skill stuffs in
the game. Some of them are available in more than one place, I just list down
the first place that you can buy the stuff.
